text2: Paire ' piya ' itɨ ' pʉ Sises ekepu ekama ' pose , ato ' pe tʉuya . Paire ' uya tʉsoisaai ton apiyo ' ma ' pʉ Sises ekepu tʉto ' pe to ' uya itena ' .

text: And when Joseph had taken the body , he wrapped it in a clean linen cloth ,
text2: Isose ' uya nin si itekepu arɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ . Iwontɨ ' pʉ iya epe ' kena ' pon renen tato ' atʉ ke ,

text: And laid it in his own new tomb , which he had hewn out in the rock : and he rolled a great stone to the door of the sepulchre , and departed .
text2: mɨrɨpan uya Sises ekepu nonka ' pʉ tiwano ' pe emenna ' pe tɨ ' akasa ' uruwai ' pe ya ' . Eke rɨ tɨ ' tʉtɨrinkai ' imʉra ' taai a ' koro ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan nin si utɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ , mɨrɨ yapai .

text: And there was Mary Magdalene , and the other Mary , sitting over against the sepulchre .
text2: Meri Mataren mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron nɨ Meri ereutasa ' esi ' pʉ tɨ ' akasa ' uruwai ' pe ratoi pe .

text: Now the next day , that followed the day of the preparation , the chief priests and Pharisees came together unto Pilate ,
text2: Mɨrɨ ema ' sa ' yau , Sapa ' a ' tai , Papa ena ' use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan epuru ton , Pari ' si amʉ ' utɨ ' pʉ Paire ' piya ' .

text: Saying , Sir , we remember that that deceiver said , while he was yet alive , After three days I will rise again .
text2: “ Ina epuru , kʉrɨ Sises kasi ye ' esi a ' tai serɨ yau nurɨne isaurokʉ ' pʉ esi ina enu yau , ‘ Osorʉwau wʉi pata ' pʉ pe e ' mʉ ' sa ' kato ' oton , ’ tawon .

text: Command therefore that the sepulchre be made sure until the third day , lest his disciples come by night , and steal him away , and say unto the people , He is risen from the dead : so the last error shall be worse than the first .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ɨsoisaai ton apiyo ' ma ' iuruwasii erasuntɨto ' pe to ' uya serɨ awonsi ' kɨ osorʉwau wʉi pʉ ' kʉ pona rɨ ima ' ta ' pʉ awonsi ' kɨ . Mɨrɨ pʉra nin iyesi yau , ipoitorʉ ton uyepʉ mɨrɨ itekepu onanse ' na , mɨrɨpan a ' tai nin si ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' , ‘ Sises e ' mʉ ' sa ' kakaa ' pʉ man , ’ ta to ' uya mɨrɨ . Serɨ nin si e ' ku ' sa ' a ' tai , wapiya iyesi ' pʉ entai rɨ nin si ennakan nɨto ' e ' to ' oton mɨrɨ ipan pe rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: Pilate said unto them , Ye have a watch : go your way , make it as sure as ye can .
text2: “ Aya ' kɨrɨ ' nokon si usoisaai ton atɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ Paire ' uya . “ Entantɨ ' , wakʉ pe uruwai ' erasuntɨtantɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: So they went , and made the sepulchre sure , sealing the stone , and setting a watch .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon nin si utɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ uruwai ' piya ' erasuntɨse ' na . To ' uya a ' si ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ wakʉ pe tɨ ' pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ tʉpo nin si , soisa amʉ ' uya erasuntɨto ' pe to ' uya ikupʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨ .

text: In the end of the sabbath , as it began to dawn toward the first day of the week , came Mary Magdalene and the other Mary to see the sepulchre .
text2: Awanakʉi ' kuru rɨ nin si , suntaaka epiya ' tɨ pe , Sapa ' ema ' sa ' yau , Meri Mataren mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron nɨ Meri utɨ ' pʉ Sises uruwasii tɨ ' akasa ' ense ' na .

text: And , behold , there was a great earthquake : for the angel of the Lord descended from heaven , and came and rolled back the stone from the door , and sat upon it .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ɨsɨ pe tʉrʉ ' pʉnʉ esi ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra Itepuru inserʉʉi u ' tɨ esi ' pʉ Epʉn poi . Tɨ ' akasa ' uruwai ' piya ' itɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya tɨ ' ama ' pʉ imʉra ' taai apai , mɨrɨpan po iyereuta ' pʉ .

text: His countenance was like lightning , and his raiment white as snow :
text2: Sirɨn pe iyesi ' pʉ kamiri ' kasa . Ipon esi ' pʉ ipan pe rɨ aimu ' ne , sino kasa .

text: And for fear of him the keepers did shake , and became as dead men .
text2: Erasuntɨ pɨ ' si te ' san soisa amʉ ' etʉipɨtʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' ipan pe , mɨrɨpan kon e ' tɨtɨtɨ ' ka ' pʉ to ' uta ' mo ' ka ' pʉ iyeri ' sa ' kon kasa .

text: And the angel answered and said unto the women , Fear not ye : for I know that ye seek Jesus , which was crucified .
text2: Uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' pɨ ' inserʉ uya , “ Kenari ' nʉntʉu ! Sises , to ' nʉpokapɨtʉ ' pʉ kurusu ' pona warinpa auya ' nokon tukai ' si ' tuyai ' .

text: He is not here : for he is risen , as he said . Come , see the place where the Lord lay .
text2: E ' tane ipʉra man serɨ yau . Iye ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ ta ' pʉ tʉuya kasa rɨ . Apʉne , ipata ' pʉ entanʉ ' tɨ ' .

text: And go quickly , and tell his disciples that he is risen from the dead ; and , behold , he goeth before you into Galilee ; there shall ye see him : lo , I have told you .
text2: Inke pʉra ipoitorʉ ton ipana ' tɨtantɨ ' : ‘ Iye ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' man terikʉ ' pʉ apai , mɨrɨpan utɨn pɨ ' man arawɨrɨ ' nokon Kiyarari pona . Mɨrɨ yau ene auya ' nokon mɨrɨ . ’ Apana ' tɨsa ' uya ' nokon si mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ inserʉ uya .

text: And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy ; and did run to bring his disciples word .
text2: Kamoro si uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' enna ' po ' pʉ mɨrɨ uruwai ' piyapai to ' etʉipɨ ' sa ' esi ' pʉ e ' tane ipan pe rɨ kanan to ' esi ' pʉ pori ' pe , mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ teka ' tunse ipoitorʉ ton pana ' tɨse ' na .

text: And as they went to tell his disciples , behold , Jesus met them , saying , All hail . And they came and held him by the feet , and worshipped him .
text2: Ite ' kwanau pʉra rɨ , Sises uya to ' eporo ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya , “ Miyarɨ ' nokon ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' . To ' utɨ ' pʉ ipiya ' i ' ta pɨ ' tʉuta ' sii ' , to ' uya apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , Be not afraid : go tell my brethren that they go into Galilee , and there shall they see me .
text2: “ Kenari ' nʉntʉu ! ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya to ' pɨ ' . “ Utonpa ton pɨ ' Kiyarari pona entantɨ ' ka ' tantɨ ' ; mɨrɨ yau nin si to ' uya uyene mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Now when they were going , behold , some of the watch came into the city , and shewed unto the chief priests all the things that were done .
text2: Utɨn pɨ ' rɨ uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' e ' tane , Sises uruwasii erasuntɨnin nan soisa amʉ ' utɨ ' pʉ Surusiran pona , mɨrɨpan kon uya tanporo rɨ iye ' ku ' sa ' rʉ ' pʉ ekama ' pʉ Papa ena ' use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan epuru ton eke ton kuru pɨ ' .

text: And when they were assembled with the elders , and had taken counsel , they gave large money unto the soldiers ,
text2: Kamoro si Papa ena ' use ' ma nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan epuru ton eke ton kuru e ' seposa ' a ' tai Esuwerʉ amʉ ' epuru ton pokon pe , to ' ekoneka ' pʉ mɨrɨ ku ' to ' kon pe tukai ' . Soisa amʉ ' ena ' eke pe rɨ pʉrata tʉrʉ ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: Saying , Say ye , His disciples came by night , and stole him away while we slept .
text2: “ Se mɨkatʉi ' , ‘ Ina e ' nʉntane , ewarupɨ nau , Sises poitorʉ ton uya itekepu arɨ ' pʉ , ’ mɨkatʉi ' .

text: And if this come to the governor ' s ears , we will persuade him , and secure you .
text2: Serɨ etasa ' kopʉna uya yau , ɨkota ' ma iya ' nokon namai ' ina uya auro ' ka mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya to ' pɨ ' .

text: So they took the money , and did as they were taught : and this saying is commonly reported among the Jews until this day .
text2: Soisa amʉ ' uya nin si pʉrata a ' si ' pʉ mɨrɨ ; kamoro uya mɨrɨ kasa me ' tʉi ' tasa ' awɨrɨ rɨ to ' uya ikupʉ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ uriya ' , siya rɨ serɨ panton utɨsa ' mɨrɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' koro ' tau rɨ serɨ pʉ ' kʉ pona rɨ .

text: Then the eleven disciples went away into Galilee , into a mountain where Jesus had appointed them .
text2: Mɨrɨ pata ' pʉ pe , 11 kaisaron kon ipoitorʉ ton utɨ ' pʉ Kiyarari pona , wʉ ' pona , Sises uya , “ Mɨrɨ ya ' entantɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ rʉ ' pʉ pona .

text: And when they saw him , they worshipped him : but some doubted .
text2: To ' uya ensa ' a ' tai , to ' uya apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ , e ' tane tʉron kon uya ikasima ' pʉ .

text: And Jesus came and spake unto them , saying , All power is given unto me in heaven and in earth .
text2: Sises uyee ' pʉ to ' piya ' , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Umeruntɨrʉ ke urepasa ' man tanporon nɨ Epʉn mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ non poron kon nɨ esa ' pe e ' to ' pe .

text: Go ye therefore , and teach all nations , baptizing them in the name of the Father , and of the Son , and of the Holy Ghost :
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , siya rɨ entantɨ ' tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' ikonekatantɨ ' upoitorʉ pe to ' e ' to ' pe . To ' ipa ' taisimatantɨ ' ikʉipʉnʉ , imu , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ ese ' yau .

text: Teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you : and , lo , I am with you alway , even unto the end of the world . Amen .
text2: To ' menupatʉi ' tanporon nɨ ayauro ' ka ' pʉ uya ' nokon awɨron pe to ' e ' to ' pe . I ' napai rɨ kuru rɨ ɨpiyau ' nokon esi iweyu u ' matʉ pʉ ' kʉ pona rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ , the Son of God ;
text2: Serɨ , serɨ wakʉ itekare epiya ' tɨ Papa Mumu , Sises Kʉrai pɨ ' .

text: As it is written in the prophets , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Pu ' kena ' Aisaya karetaai yau iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' : “ Umaimu ekamanin ennoko uya mɨrɨ arawɨrɨ , ɨye ' ma konekanin pe , ” tawon .

text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: “ Rɨmono ' tau ka ' pon ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉ , ‘ Itepuru e ' ma ikonekatɨ ' ; to ' sa rɨ ite ' ma ikonekatɨ ' , ’ ” tawon .

text: John did baptize in the wilderness , and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins .
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa si Isaan uyee ' pʉ , pa ' taisiman pɨ ' rɨmono ' ta nono yau mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ makoi apai era ' tɨn epa ' taisimato ' makoi pɨ ' usentu ' man ekareei ekama pɨ ' .

text: And there went out unto him all the land of Judaea , and they of Jerusalem , and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan , confessing their sins .
text2: Tanporon kon nɨ Isutiya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ eke pata Surusiran winon kon nɨ utɨ ' pʉ ipiya ' . Tʉmakooi kon ekama pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan kon pa ' taisima ' pʉ iya Isotan tuna tʉu ' tɨsen kau .

text: And John was clothed with camel ' s hair , and with a girdle of a skin about his loins ; and he did eat locusts and wild honey ;
text2: Isaan pon esi ' pʉ kiyamerʉ i ' po ' konekasa ' , o ' pi ' pɨ konekasa ' esi ' pʉ ipokʉrʉʉi pe iworo ' pai pɨ ' . Kairau amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ teusan e ' ku pɨ ' tenta ' nasen pe iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And preached , saying , There cometh one mightier than I after me , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ se si esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ itekareei pe : “ Uye ' ma ' pʉ pe iyepʉ mɨrɨ ka ' pon meruntɨ kuru uyentaino , tʉu ' tɨi ' isapatooi euka uya pokena ' pen nɨ .

text: I indeed have baptized you with water : but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Apa ' taisima uya ' nokon serɨ tuna ke , e ' tane kʉrɨ rɨ uya nin si apa ' taisima kon mɨrɨ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ ke , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee , and was baptized of John in Jordan .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sises uyee ' pʉ Nasare ' , Kiyarari yawon winɨ , mɨrɨpan pa ' taisima ' pʉ Isaan uya Isotan kau .

text: And straightway coming up out of the water , he saw the heavens opened , and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him :
text2: Sises ekanwaka koro ' tau tuna kapai , ka ' uta ' koka e ' se ' ne ' pe ene ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan uya Ita ' kwarʉ u ' tɨ wako ' wa kasa ene ' pʉ tʉpona .

text: And there came a voice from heaven , saying , Thou art my beloved Son , in whom I am well pleased .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ main uyee ' pʉ Epʉn awonsi ' kɨ , “ Umu ɨmɨrɨ , uni ' nʉnkanʉ ; ɨpɨ ' pori ' pe e ' ai ' ipan pe , ” tawon .

text: And immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness .
text2: Inke pʉra rɨ , Ita ' kwarʉ uya ennoko ' pʉ rɨmono ' ta ' .

text: And he was there in the wilderness forty days , tempted of Satan ; and was with the wild beasts ; and the angels ministered unto him .
text2: Rɨmono ' tau iyesi ' pʉ 40 kaisa rɨ wʉi , Se ' tan esi ' pʉ i ' tupɨtʉ pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ yau rɨ kanan ene amʉ ' pokon pe iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan ene pɨ ' inserʉ amʉ ' esi ' pʉ .

text: Now after that John was put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God ,
text2: Isaan a ' sisa ' to ' uya tʉpo pariki ' si ta ' , Kiyarari pona Sises utɨ ' pʉ , wakʉ Papa ekareei ekama pɨ ' .

text: And saying , The time is fulfilled , and the kingdom of God is at hand : repent ye , and believe the gospel .
text2: “ Iweyu e ' seposa ' man , Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe man a ' ko pe ! Amakooi kon apai era ' tɨtɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itekare apurɨtɨ ' ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee , he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea : for they were fishers .
text2: Sises usarɨ koro ' tau parau ku ' pɨri Kiyarari piyawɨrɨ , asa ' ron kon moro ' a ' sinin nan ka ' pon amʉ ' ene ' pʉ iya , Saiman , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iyakon Anturu pokon , tʉpunwerʉ kon yai moro ' amʉ ' a ' si to ' uya esi ' pʉ .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Come ye after me , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Upɨkɨrɨ ɨsi ' tɨ ' . Ɨkonekato ' kon pe uya ka ' pon amʉ ' a ' sinin nan pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And straightway they forsook their nets , and followed him .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe rɨ , tʉpunwerʉ kon tʉnɨnse to ' utɨ ' pʉ ipɨkɨrɨ .

text: And when he had gone a little further thence , he saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who also were in the ship mending their nets .
text2: Ɨnnɨ iwa rʉ ' kwɨ itɨsa ' a ' tai , Isens ene ' pʉ iya , Sepiti mu mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isaan , iyakon kanau yau , tʉpunwerʉ kon konepɨtʉ pɨ ' .

text: And straightway he called them : and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants , and went after him .
text2: Oko pe pʉra rɨ , to ' kɨ ' ma ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan kon uya tʉkʉipʉnʉ kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ aka ' ne ' pe anʉnsa ' kon ipoitorʉ ton pokon pe tʉnɨnse kanau yau , to ' utɨ ' pʉ ipɨkɨrɨ .

text: And they went into Capernaum ; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue , and taught .
text2: To ' utɨ ' pʉ Ka ' paneyan pona ; Sapa ' uye ' sa ' a ' tai , Sises utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' . Mɨrɨ yau , to ' enupa pɨ ' iyepiya ' tɨ ' pʉ .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for he taught them as one that had authority , and not as the scribes .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' usewansiuka ' pʉ enupan nɨto ' iya pɨ ' , apʉne pʉra tenupa iya ' nokon pɨ ' tʉmeruntɨrʉkenan pe kuru rɨ , Main pɨ ' enupanin nan kasa pʉra .

text: And there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit ; and he cried out ,
text2: Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , ka ' pon , makoi a ' kwarʉ yen pe te ' sen mɨrɨ yau Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tau , ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ ,

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art , the Holy One of God .
text2: “ Sises , Nasare ' pon , ɨ ' rɨ pe ina ku ' se ' na ɨuye ' sa ' ? Ina pe ' ma ' tanʉ ' se ' na ɨuye ' sa ' ? Kɨnyi ' tuyai ' ɨmɨrɨ kʉrɨ rɨ — Wakʉ Ye ' Papa Iwano ' ! ” ta ' pʉ iya ipɨ ' .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him .
text2: “ E ' pana e ' kɨ ! Epa ' kakɨ iyapai ! ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya e ' se ' ne ' pe .

text: And when the unclean spirit had torn him , and cried with a loud voice , he came out of him .
text2: Makoi a ' kwarʉ uya e ' se ' ne ' pe ka ' pon i ' ki ' ma ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan epa ' ka ' pʉ iyapai tʉupirorʉnse .

text: And they were all amazed , insomuch that they questioned among themselves , saying , What thing is this ? what new doctrine is this ? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits , and they do obey him .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' usewansiuka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon usekama ' popɨtʉ ' pʉ tiwano ' kon pe , “ Ɨ ' rɨ si serɨ ? Emenna ' usenupan nɨto ' — meruntɨ a ' kɨron ! Makoi a ' kwarʉ ton nɨ apiyo ' manin , mɨrɨpan kon esi imaimu awɨrɨ ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee .
text2: Itekareei utɨ ' pʉ inke pʉra kuru rɨ siya rɨ Kiyarari nono poro .

text: And forthwith , when they were come out of the synagogue , they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew , with James and John .
text2: Tepa ' kasa ' kon a ' tai Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tapai , to ' utɨ ' pʉ Saiman mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Anturu pata ' se ' ya ' . Isens mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isaan pokon utɨ ' pʉ to ' a ' kɨrɨ .

text: But Simon ' s wife ' s mother lay sick of a fever , and anon they tell him of her .
text2: Saiman ewo ' pʉ esi ' pʉ e ' kɨɨi ' man pɨ ' , te ' kwe ' tau . Inke pʉra rɨ Sises uye ' sa ' a ' tai , to ' uya ekama ' pʉ ipɨ ' .

text: And he came and took her by the hand , and lifted her up ; and immediately the fever left her , and she ministered unto them .
text2: Sises utɨ ' pʉ ipiya ' , itemiyatʉ pɨ ' ta ' sii ' i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ iya . Iye ' kɨɨi ' mato ' ereuta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya to ' mʉta ' napa ' pʉ .

text: And at even , when the sun did set , they brought unto him all that were diseased , and them that were possessed with devils .
text2: Pata uko ' mansa ' a ' tai , wʉi enu pata ' pʉ pe , ka ' pon amʉ ' uya tanporo rɨ takuru ' kena ' nan mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ makoi a ' kwarʉ yen ton nee ' pʉ Sises piya ' .

text: And all the city was gathered together at the door .
text2: Tanporo rɨ mɨrɨ pata yau te ' san ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉra ' pʉ mʉra ' ta na ' .

text: And he healed many that were sick of divers diseases , and cast out many devils ; and suffered not the devils to speak , because they knew him .
text2: Sises uya tu ' kan kon nɨ takuru ' kena ' nan epi ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' eparan apai ' ne , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ makoi a ' kwarʉ ton nɨ enno ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ iya . Makoi a ' kwarʉ ton usaurokʉ i ' se pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra to ' uya ti ' tu wenai .

text: And in the morning , rising up a great while before day , he went out , and departed into a solitary place , and there prayed .
text2: Awanakʉi ' kuru , ewarupɨ pe rɨ marɨ pata e ' tane , Sises e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ ɨutɨ tapai tʉ ' kenan pata ya ' ɨpʉremase ' na .

text: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him .
text2: E ' tane Saiman mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itonpa ton utɨ ' pʉ iwarinpase ' na .

text: And when they had found him , they said unto him , All men seek for thee .
text2: To ' uya eposa ' a ' tai , “ Tanporon kon man awarinpa pɨ ' ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya ipɨ ' .

text: And he said unto them , Let us go into the next towns , that I may preach there also : for therefore came I forth .
text2: Sises uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Tʉron nɨ airɨ eke iwa ton a ' ko pa ' nan pata ton ya ' utɨnpai ' nokon . Mɨrɨ yau ' ne kanan itekare ekamato ' pe uya . Mɨrɨto ' pe uye ' sa ' serɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee , and cast out devils .
text2: Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ siya rɨ Kiyarari poro itekare ekama pɨ ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ton tau , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ makoi a ' kwarʉ ton nɨ enno ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ iya .

text: And there came a leper to him , beseeching him , and kneeling down to him , and saying unto him , If thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Erekʉ ' pan ka ' pon uyee ' pʉ Sises piya ' . Tese ' mu po esii ' ma iyeta ' kwanʉmʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ Ɨnku ' pai ɨwesi yau , wakʉ pe ukupʉ auya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Jesus , moved with compassion , put forth his hand , and touched him , and saith unto him , I will ; be thou clean .
text2: Sises usentu ' ma ' pʉ ipɨ ' . Temiyatʉ ɨnka ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan uya a ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ . “ Ɨnku ' pai rɨ e ' ai ' . Wakʉ pe e ' kɨ ! ” ta ' pʉ iya ipɨ ' .

text: And as soon as he had spoken , immediately the leprosy departed from him , and he was cleansed .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , ka ' pon erekʉ usepi ' tɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan ena ' pʉ wakʉ pe rɨ .

text: And he straitly charged him , and forthwith sent him away ;
text2: Sises uya inke pʉra ennoko ' pʉ ipanama tʉpo se tukai ' ,

text: And saith unto him , See thou say nothing to any man : but go thy way , shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing those things which Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: “ Ɨnʉ ' pɨ ' rɨ serɨ kʉsekamai , e ' tane enta ɨsenpoikata Papa ena ' use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin ena ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨuse ' mato ' pe te ' sen , Mosi ' uya tasa ' na ' ne ' awɨrɨ mʉtʉrʉi ' , ɨyekorʉkasa ' ekamanin pe to ' pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: But he went out , and began to publish it much , and to blaze abroad the matter , insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city , but was without in desert places : and they came to him from every quarter .
text2: E ' tane kʉrɨ rɨ ka ' pon utɨ ' pʉ siya rɨ itekareei ekamase . Mɨrɨ moron nʉ ' pʉ pe Sises epa ' ka poken pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ eke iwa pata ton ya ' ne , e ' tane rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' uye ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ mɨ ' tapai ' ne rɨ ipiya ' .

text: And again he entered into Capernaum , after some days ; and it was noised that he was in the house .
text2: Emennʉ ' pʉ po iwa rɨ , Sises enna ' po ' pʉ Ka ' paneyan pona . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , tʉpata ' se ' ya ' iyenna ' posa ' man tawon useta ' pʉ .

text: And straightway many were gathered together , insomuch that there was no room to receive them , no , not so much as about the door : and he preached the word unto them .
text2: Tu ' ke rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉra ' pʉ , pata oton pʉra rɨ pata tʉku ' se mʉra ' ta airɨ ' ne rɨ . Sises esi ' pʉ itekare ekama pɨ ' to ' pɨ ' .

text: And they come unto him , bringing one sick of the palsy , which was borne of four .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , asakɨrɨ ' nan kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uya ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' ka ' pon nee ' pʉ ipiya ' .

text: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the press , they uncovered the roof where he was : and when they had broken it up , they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay .
text2: Apʉne pʉra anpisin pe ka ' pon amʉ ' esi pɨ ' itʉrʉ tʉuya ' nokon poken pʉra Sises piya ' , iteuta koneka ' pʉ to ' uya ɨutɨ nakapu yai Sises epoi , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ aka tʉkon po , ka ' pon ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' nu ' tɨ ' pʉ to ' uya iyapon po rɨ .

text: When Jesus saw their faith , he said unto the sick of the palsy , Son , thy sins be forgiven thee .
text2: Sises uya to ' uya apurɨto ' ene ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' ka ' pon pɨ ' ta ' pʉ , “ Mooi , amakooi pɨ ' usentu ' masa ' man , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there , and reasoning in their hearts ,
text2: Mɨrɨ yau tereutai ' te ' san , Main pɨ ' enupanin nan usenuminka ' pʉ tiwano ' kon pe ,

text: Why doth this man thus speak blasphemies ? who can forgive sins but God only ?
text2: “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' mɨrɨ kasa Papa sapema pe rɨ isaurokʉ ? Ɨnʉ ' rɨ sa ' ne makoi pɨ ' tʉusentu ' masen pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ ko , Papa rɨken ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves , he said unto them , Why reason ye these things in your hearts ?
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , Sises uya ta ' kwarʉ yau i ' tu ' pʉ to ' usenuminka tewan kon yau , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' mɨrɨ kasa ɨusenuminka kon ?

text: Whether is it easier to say to the sick of the palsy , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Arise , and take up thy bed , and walk ?
text2: Nai esi sa ' man pe pʉra iwa pʉse rɨ ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' pɨ ' tato ' ; ‘ Amakooi pɨ ' usentu ' masa ' man , ’ ta , mɨrɨ pe pʉra , ‘ Te ' mʉ ' sa ' kai ' ayapon tanʉnse enta , ’ ta ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power on earth to forgive sins , ( he saith to the sick of the palsy , )
text2: Serɨ pe enpoika uya si serɨ non po , Ka ' pon , Papa winon piyau meruntɨ esi makoi pɨ ' usentu ' man nɨto ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan uya ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' ka ' pon pɨ ' ta ' pʉ ,

text: I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy bed , and go thy way into thine house .
text2: “ Ta uya ɨpɨ ' , e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' , ayapon anʉnkɨ , enna ' po ' apata ' se ' ya ' ! ” ta ' pʉ .

text: And immediately he arose , took up the bed , and went forth before them all ; insomuch that they were all amazed , and glorified God , saying , We never saw it on this fashion .
text2: To ' uya rɨ enpɨ ' tane ka ' pon e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , tapon anʉmʉ ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ . Ipan pe rɨ to ' usewansiuka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya Papa apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Serɨ waraino ensa ' uya ' nokon pʉra rɨ man ! ” tai ' ma .

text: And he went forth again by the sea side ; and all the multitude resorted unto him , and he taught them .
text2: Sises enna ' pokaa ' pʉ kanan parau ku ' pɨri e ' pi pona . Anpisin pe ka ' pon amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ ipiya ' , mɨrɨpan kon enupa pɨ ' iye ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ .

text: And as he passed by , he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom , and said unto him , Follow me . And he arose and followed him .
text2: Isarɨ koro ' tau , pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin , Ripai , Arʉ ' piyas mu ene ' pʉ iya , iyereutasa ' pʉrata amʉranʉ ' to ' iwʉ ' tau . Sises uya ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ Uya ' kɨrɨ ɨsi ' kɨ , ” mɨrɨpan Ripai e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , itɨ ' pʉ iya ' kɨrɨ .

text: And it came to pass , that , as Jesus sat at meat in his house , many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples : for there were many , and they followed him .
text2: Sises esi koro ' tau enta ' nan pɨ ' Ripai iwʉ ' tau tu ' kan kon nɨ pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉmakooikena ' nan esi ' pʉ enta ' nan pɨ ' ipokon pe , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ipoitorʉ ton pokon pe rɨ , apʉne pʉra tu ' ke rɨ ipɨkɨrɨ to ' esi ke .

text: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners , they said unto his disciples , How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners ?
text2: Main pɨ ' enupanin nan tonpa ton , Pari ' si amʉ ' pe te ' san uya Sises enta ' na ene ' pʉ pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉmakooikena ' nan pokon pe , mɨrɨpan kon uya ipoitorʉ ton ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' kamoro rupɨ pokon pe iyenta ' na ? ” ta ' pʉ .

text: When Jesus heard it , he saith unto them , They that are whole have no need of the physician , but they that are sick : I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Sises uya to ' eta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon eikʉ ' pʉ iya , “ Atu ' pe te ' san ka ' pon amʉ ' esi mɨrɨ ta ' ta i ' se pʉra rɨ , e ' tane kamoro takuru ' ke te ' san nɨken esi i ' se . Uye ' sa ' serɨ ipokena ' ton nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' kɨ ' mase ' na pen , e ' tane tʉmakooikena ' nan nɨken , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast : and they come and say unto him , Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast , but thy disciples fast not ?
text2: Isaan Pa ' tes mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Pari ' si amʉ ' poitorʉ ton useruma esi ' pʉ tenta ' nai ' pʉra . Tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ Sises piya ' ekama ' pose ' na , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' Isaan Pa ' tes poitorʉ ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Pari ' si amʉ ' poitorʉ ton useruma tenta ' nai ' pʉra , e ' tane ɨpoitorʉ ton useruma pʉra rɨ iyesi ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Can the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ? as long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
text2: Sises uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Nai kasa warawo ' temari ' masen nʉkɨ ' ma ' san useruma tenta ' nai ' pʉra tʉpiyau ' nokon nɨ iye ' tane ? To ' useruma pʉra iyesi tʉpiyau ' nokon iye ' tane .

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: E ' tane iweyu e ' sepoto ' oton warawo ' temari ' masen emo ' kato ' oton to ' piyapai ; mɨrɨ wʉi a ' tai nin si , to ' useruma mɨrɨ tenta ' nai ' pʉra .

text: No man also seweth a piece of new cloth on an old garment : else the new piece that filled it up taketh away from the old , and the rent is made worse .
text2: “ Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ emenna ' pon ke ipooi ' pɨ pon a ' si ' tɨ pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ . Mɨrɨ kasa iyesi yau , emenna ' pon uya ipooi ' pɨ pon karaka eke pe rɨ iteuta tʉku ' se .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles : else the new wine doth burst the bottles , and the wine is spilled , and the bottles will be marred : but new wine must be put into new bottles .
text2: Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ emenna ' waain entɨ pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ ipooi ' pɨ iten ya ' . Mɨrɨ kasa iyesi yau , asa ' rɨ rɨ nin si ima ' ta mɨrɨ . Emenna ' iten esi emenna ' waain yen pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And it came to pass , that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day ; and his disciples began , as they went , to pluck the ears of corn .
text2: Tʉron nɨ Sapa ' a ' tai , Sises utɨ esi ' pʉ a ' nai ' e ' kwa nawɨrɨ . Tʉutɨi ' ma ' nokon ipoitorʉ ton uya a ' nai ' e ' suruupɨ ' sa ' i ' kwɨ ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: And the Pharisees said unto him , Behold , why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful ?
text2: Pari ' si amʉ ' uya ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ Apʉne enkɨ , ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' Main uya tʉku ' sen pen Sapa ' a ' tai tasa ' rʉ ' pʉ kupʉ to ' uya ? ” ta ' pʉ .

text: And he said unto them , Have ye never read what David did , when he had need , and was an hungred , he , and they that were with him ?
text2: Sises uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Etanin nan pen pe ' ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon Tepi ' nʉkupʉ ' pʉ tʉpoitorʉ ton pokon pe , iwan pe tesi kon pɨ ' tenta ' nato ' kon i ' se tesi kon a ' tai ?

text: How he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest , and did eat the shewbread , which is not lawful to eat but for the priests , and gave also to them which were with him ?
text2: Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ Papa iwʉ ' ta ' , mɨrɨpan enta ' na ' pʉ ipʉremasa ' pʉreti pɨ ' . Serɨ e ' kupʉ ' pʉ Apiya ' ta , Papa ena ' use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan epuru a ' tai . Use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan nɨken nɨkunʉ Main uya tasa ' awɨrɨ . E ' tane Tepi ' enta ' na ' pʉ ipɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉtonpa ton nɨ nɨrɨ repapɨtʉ ' pʉ iya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said unto them , The sabbath was made for man , and not man for the sabbath :
text2: Mɨrɨpan Sises uya ta ' pʉ , “ Sapa ' ekonekasa ' ka ' pon iwano ' pe , ka ' pon ekonekasa ' pen Sapa ' iwano ' pe .

text: Therefore the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Mɨrɨ uriya ' , Ka ' pon , Papa winon esi Sapa ' Epuru pe rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he entered again into the synagogue ; and there was a man there which had a withered hand .
text2: Tʉron nɨ a ' tai Sises utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' . Mɨrɨ yau , ka ' pon iyaipʉtasa ' amʉrasa ' itemiyatʉ esi ' pʉ .

text: And they watched him , whether he would heal him on the sabbath day ; that they might accuse him .
text2: Tʉron kon esi ' pʉ Sises eseru ' tɨto ' tʉuya ' nokon iwenai kupʉ iya ene i ' se , mɨrɨpan kon uya a ' ko pe esii ' ma enpɨtʉ ' pʉ , Sapa ' a ' tai pe ' epi ' tɨ iya tukai ' .

text: And he saith unto the man which had the withered hand , Stand forth .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ ka ' pon iyaipʉtasa ' amʉrasa ' itemiyatʉ pɨ ' , “ E ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' tanporon kon rau , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he saith unto them , Is it lawful to do good on the sabbath days , or to do evil ? to save life , or to kill ? But they held their peace .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya ka ' pon amʉ ' ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Nai esi Main , Mosi ' winon awɨrɨ Sapa ' a ' tai tʉku ' sen pe : wakʉ kupʉ , mɨrɨ pe pʉra ɨri kupʉ katɨ ? Ka ' pon pika ' tɨ ima ' ta namai ' , mɨrɨ pe pʉra iwɨnɨ katɨ ? ” ta ' pʉ iya . E ' tane e ' pana to ' esi ' pʉ .

text: And when he had looked round about on them with anger , being grieved for the hardness of their hearts , he saith unto the man , Stretch forth thine hand . And he stretched it out : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Sises usakorota uya to ' enpɨtʉ ' pʉ , ipan pe rɨ ɨpokoitai ' ma rɨ marɨ , apʉne pʉra sa ' man pe rɨ to ' ewan esi pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ ka ' pon pɨ ' , “ Ɨyemiyatʉ ɨnka ' ! ” Ɨnka ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan emiyatʉ enna ' po ' pʉ tesi ' pʉ ya ' .

text: And the Pharisees went forth , and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him , how they might destroy him .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Pari ' si amʉ ' uya tʉusenupato ' kon iwʉ ' nɨmɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon e ' seporo ' pʉ kin pe te ' sen , Era ' tonpa ton pokon pe , mɨrɨpan kon ekoneka ' pʉ Sises wɨto ' pe tʉuya ' nokon pɨ ' .

text: But Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea : and a great multitude from Galilee followed him , and from Judaea ,
text2: Sises mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ipoitorʉ ton utɨ ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri ka ' . Tu ' ke rɨ anpisin Kiyarari winon kon utɨ ' pʉ ipɨkɨrɨ .

text: And from Jerusalem , and from Idumaea , and from beyond Jordan ; and they about Tyre and Sidon , a great multitude , when they had heard what great things he did , came unto him .
text2: Pʉsamoro uyee ' pʉ Isutiya winɨ , Surusiran winɨ , Itumiya winɨ , Isotan ratoi nono winɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Taya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Saitan nono winɨ ' ne . Anpisin ton nɨ uyee ' pʉ Sises piya ' , apʉne pʉra inkupʉnʉ etasa ' tʉuya ' nokon pɨ ' .

text: And he spake to his disciples , that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude , lest they should throng him .
text2: Apʉne pʉra anpisin pe rɨ to ' esi pɨ ' , Sises uya tʉpoitorʉ ton auro ' ka ' pʉ kanau epoto ' pe to ' uya tekanwa ' tɨto ' ya ' ka ' pon amʉ ' uya tu ' ke rɨ tʉu ' na ' tɨ namai ' .

text: For he had healed many ; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him , as many as had plagues .
text2: Tu ' kan kon nɨ epi ' tɨsa ' iya pɨ ' , tanporon kon nɨ takuru ' kena ' nan uyee ' pʉ tʉuta ' tu ' mapɨ ' se rɨ a ' pɨ ' se ' na .

text: And unclean spirits , when they saw him , fell down before him , and cried , saying , Thou art the Son of God .
text2: Makoi a ' kwarʉ yen ton uya ensa ' a ' tai , to ' uta ' mo ' kapɨtʉ ' pʉ irakʉi ' , mɨrɨpan kon upirorʉnpɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Ɨmɨrɨ rɨ kʉrɨ Papa Mumu ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he straitly charged them that they should not make him known .
text2: Sises uya e ' se ' ne ' pe makoi a ' kwarʉ yen ton panama ' pʉ , kʉrɨ rɨ kʉrɨ rɨ ta to ' uya namai ' tʉpɨ ' .

text: And he goeth up into a mountain , and calleth unto him whom he would : and they came unto him .
text2: Sises utɨ ' pʉ wʉ ' pona rɨ , mɨrɨpan uya kamo i ' se te ' to ' ton kɨ ' ma ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uyee ' pʉ ipiya ' ,

text: And he ordained twelve , that they should be with him , and that he might send them forth to preach ,
text2: mɨrɨpan kon anʉmʉ ' pʉ iya 12 kaisa rɨ . To ' koneka ' pʉ iya itekare ekamai ' enno ' sa ' kon pe , tʉpiyau to ' e ' to ' pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' enno ' to ' pe tʉuya itekare ekamase ' na ,

text: And to have power to heal sicknesses , and to cast out devils :
text2: tʉmeruntɨrʉ ke to ' e ' to ' pe makoi a ' kwarʉ enpa ' kapɨ ' nin nan pe .

text: And Simon he surnamed Peter ;
text2: Pʉsamoro si inanʉmʉ ' san 12 kaisaron kon : Saiman ( Pi ' ta tukai ' inese ' tɨ ' pʉ ) ;

text: And James the son of Zebedee , and John the brother of James ; and he surnamed them Boanerges , which is , The sons of thunder :
text2: Isens mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isaan , Sepiti munkɨ amʉ ' ( Powanoses tukai ' to ' ese ' tɨ ' pʉ iya , Korʉme Munkɨ ta e ' kwa pe ) ;

text: And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James the son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus , and Simon the Canaanite ,
text2: Anturu , Piri ' , Pa ' taramiu , Ma ' siu , Tamas , Isens Arʉ ' piyas mu , Tatiyas , Saiman Usera ' tukai ' tesa ' sen ,

text: And Judas Iscariot , which also betrayed him : and they went into an house .
text2: Isutas Eskariya ' , eparankanin pe iyesi ' pʉ na ' ne ' .

text: And the multitude cometh together again , so that they could not so much as eat bread .
text2: Sises ewomʉ ' pʉ ɨutɨ ta ' . Anpisin nɨ kanan amʉrakaa ' pʉ Sises mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ipoitorʉ ton enta ' nato ' a ' tai pʉra rɨ .

text: And when his friends heard of it , they went out to lay hold on him : for they said , He is beside himself .
text2: Serɨ etasa ' itonpa ton uya a ' tai , ikan to ' utɨ ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra ka ' pon amʉ ' uya , “ Itano ' masa ' , ” ta pɨ ' .

text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said , He hath Beelzebub , and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils .
text2: Tʉron kon Main pɨ ' enupanin nan Surusiran winɨ iye ' sa ' kon uya ta ' pʉ , “ Pirɨsipupʉ esi mɨrɨ iyau . Makoi amʉ ' epuru winɨ makoi a ' kwarʉ ton enpa ' kapɨtʉ iya mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: And he called them unto him , and said unto them in parables , How can Satan cast out Satan ?
text2: Mɨrɨ uriya ' , Sises uya ka ' pon amʉ ' kɨ ' ma ' pʉ tʉpiya ' . Mɨrɨ yau , panton ekama ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' : “ Nai kasa Se ' tan nɨrɨ enpa ' ka Se ' tan uya tukai ' ?

text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
text2: Esa ' wannɨ ton epantakapɨ ' sa ' yau , tiwano ' pe rɨ ɨsewa ' nomai ' to ' uko ' mamʉ pen nɨ mɨrɨ .

text: And if a house be divided against itself , that house cannot stand .
text2: Ɨsiwʉ ' tau te ' san epantakapɨ ' sa ' pe iyesi yau , tiwano ' kon pe ɨsewa ' nomai ' kamoro uko ' mamʉ pen nɨ mɨrɨ .

text: And if Satan rise up against himself , and be divided , he cannot stand , but hath an end .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tiwano ' pe rɨ Se ' tan usewa ' noma yau mɨrɨpan epantakapɨ ' sa ' , moro iko ' mamʉ pen nɨ mɨrɨ ; iu ' ma ' to ' rɨ e ' seposa ' .

text: No man can enter into a strong man ' s house , and spoil his goods , except he will first bind the strong man ; and then he will spoil his house .
text2: “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ ewomʉ pʉra iyesi mɨrɨ pana ' pan ka ' pon iwʉ ' ta ' tanporo itapuruui e ' ma ' tɨse ' na , wapiya auronpɨ ' sa ' iya a ' tai rɨken ; mɨrɨ a ' tai nin si , itimamin arɨ iya itiwʉ ' tapai .

text: Verily I say unto you , All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men , and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme :
text2: “ I ' napairon ekama uya ɨpɨ ' nokon , tanporon nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' makooi , isapema pe rɨ to ' usauro ' sa ' rʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' usentu ' man .

text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness , but is in danger of eternal damnation :
text2: E ' tane ɨnʉ ' rɨ kʉrɨ isapema pe Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ pɨ ' isauro ' sa ' pɨ ' usentu ' man pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ , apʉne pʉra siyaro ' pe rɨ iye ' makoimasa ' mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Because they said , He hath an unclean spirit .
text2: Sises uya serɨ ta ' pʉ , tʉron kon uya , “ Makoi a ' kwarʉ esi iyau , ” tasa ' pɨ ' .

text: There came then his brethren and his mother , and , standing without , sent unto him , calling him .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sises san mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iyakon non uyee ' pʉ . Te ' soto ' pɨ ' se pʉroroi po ikɨ ' manin ennoko ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And the multitude sat about him , and they said unto him , Behold , thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee .
text2: Anpisin ton nɨ ereutapɨ ' sa ' esi ' pʉ Sises woi , mɨrɨpan kon uya ipana ' tɨ ' pʉ , “ Asan mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ayakon non esi pʉroroi po awarinpa pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he answered them , saying , Who is my mother , or my brethren ?
text2: Sises uya to ' ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ɨnʉ ' si usan ? Ɨnʉ ' yan si uyakon non ? ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him , and said , Behold my mother and my brethren !
text2: To ' si ene ' pʉ iya , ka ' pon amʉ ' ereutapɨ ' sa ' tʉwoi , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ , “ Pʉsamoro usanon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ uyakon non .

text: For whosoever shall do the will of God , the same is my brother , and my sister , and mother .
text2: Ɨnʉ ' rɨ Papa e ' to ' i ' se ku ' nin esi mɨrɨ uyakon pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ uparusi pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ usan pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he began again to teach by the sea side : and there was gathered unto him a great multitude , so that he entered into a ship , and sat in the sea ; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land .
text2: Sises kanan e ' sara ' tɨkaa ' pʉ to ' enupa pɨ ' parau ku ' pɨri piyau . Anpisin ton ka ' pon amʉ ' iwoi iyamʉrasa ' kon esi ' pʉ tu ' ke rɨ . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' , iyekanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ kanau ya ' ereutai ' parau ku ' pɨri kau , tanporo ka ' pon amʉ ' e ' tane a ' mun po , tuna e ' pi po .

text: And he taught them many things by parables , and said unto them in his doctrine ,
text2: Tu ' kan pɨ ' rɨ to ' enupa ' pʉ iya panton yai . To ' enupa tʉuya yau , ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' :

text: Hearken ; Behold , there went out a sower to sow :
text2: “ Apʉne etatɨ ' ! Umɨ pɨ ' te ' sen utɨ ' pʉ kiyari ye ' pɨnse ' na tʉpa ' karakai ' .

text: And it came to pass , as he sowed , some fell by the way side , and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up .
text2: Ipa ' karaka iya koro ' tau , tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ asanta ta ' . Toron amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ mɨrɨpan kon uya ɨku ' pʉ .

text: And some fell on stony ground , where it had not much earth ; and immediately it sprang up , because it had no depth of earth :
text2: Tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ tɨ ' pe te ' sen ya ' , eke pe pʉra te ' sen non ya ' . Inke pʉra iya ' ta ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra i ' nau pʉra non esi ke .

text: But when the sun was up , it was scorched ; and because it had no root , it withered away .
text2: E ' tane wʉi enu enu ' sa ' a ' tai , a ' ne ' pe ipuru ' pʉ iya mɨrɨpan aipʉta ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra imi ' ton utɨpɨ ' sa ' pʉra iyesi wenai .

text: And some fell among thorns , and the thorns grew up , and choked it , and it yielded no fruit .
text2: Tʉron nɨ ton ite ' ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ tikʉkenan nʉ ' ta ' . Iya ' ta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan e ' tane ɨwɨtanʉkʉ ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan epeta ' pʉ pen nɨ .

text: And other fell on good ground , and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased ; and brought forth , some thirty , and some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Mɨrɨ e ' tane rɨ , tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ wakʉ non ya ' , mɨrɨpan uwa ' ta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan epeta ' pʉ tʉron nɨ ton esi ' pʉ 30 kaisa rɨ ite ' kwa iteperu , tʉron nɨ 60 , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ 100 kaisarɨ rɨ ite ' kwa e ' to ' airɨ inpɨmɨ ' pʉ entai rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said unto them , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai Sises uya ta ' pʉ , “ Kʉrɨ tʉpana ke na ' ne ' etato ' ike , tɨwɨ netai , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: And when he was alone , they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable .
text2: Sises esi koro ' tau tikin sarɨ , isaurokʉ etanin nʉ ' san uyee ' pʉ ipoitorʉ ton pokon pe ekama ' pose ' na , ɨ ' rɨ ta iya e ' kwa pe iyesi tukai ' .

text: And he said unto them , Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God : but unto them that are without , all these things are done in parables :
text2: To ' pɨ ' ta ' pʉ iya , “ Ama ' aino Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe e ' tʉsa ' ɨyena ' nokon . E ' tane kamoro mɨ airon kon pɨ ' tanporon nɨ usekama panton yai ,

text: That seeing they may see , and not perceive ; and hearing they may hear , and not understand ; lest at any time they should be converted , and their sins should be forgiven them .
text2: “ ‘ to ' uya rɨ enpɨtʉ mɨrɨ e ' tane wakʉ pe to ' uya ene pen nɨ , to ' uya rɨ eta mɨrɨ ito ' ka ' nʉkʉi ' ma pʉra rɨ . Mɨrɨ kupʉ to ' uya pe iyesi yau , to ' era ' tɨ nesii ' no Papa winɨkʉi ' , mɨrɨpan kon pɨ ' nin nʉsentu ' mai ' no . ’ tasa ' iya . ”

text: And he said unto them , Know ye not this parable ? and how then will ye know all parables ?
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Serɨ pe ' panton to ' ka ' nʉkʉ auya ' nokon pʉra rɨ iyesi ? Ɨ ' rɨ kasa ken si tʉron nɨ panton to ' ka ' nʉkʉ kon pa ?

text: The sower soweth the word .
text2: Umɨ pɨ ' te ' sen uya Papa Maimu pa ' karaka .

text: And these are they by the way side , where the word is sown ; but when they have heard , Satan cometh immediately , and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts .
text2: Tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' esi ite ' ipa ' karakasa ' uta ' po ' sa ' asanta ta ' kasa . Eta to ' uya pe rɨ , Se ' tan uyepʉ Main mo ' kase ' na to ' ya ' ipa ' karakasa ' .

text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground ; who , when they have heard the word , immediately receive it with gladness ;
text2: Tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' esi ite ' ton tɨ ' pona ita ' po ' sa ' kasa . Main eta tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , inke pʉra rɨ to ' uya anʉmʉ tepori ' ma kon pe .

text: And have no root in themselves , and so endure but for a time : afterward , when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word ' s sake , immediately they are offended .
text2: E ' tane to ' mi ' pʉra to ' esi , inke to ' uko ' mamʉ pʉra iyesi . Ɨ ' rɨ rɨ anpokʉmanin mɨrɨ pe pʉra kota ' manin uye ' sa ' a ' tai main uriya ' , inke pʉra to ' e ' nonka ipiyapai .

text: And these are they which are sown among thorns ; such as hear the word ,
text2: Mɨrɨ e ' tane rɨ , tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' esi mɨrɨ ite ' tikʉkenan nʉ ' ta ' ipa ' karakasa ' kasa , main etanin nan ,

text: And the cares of this world , and the deceitfulness of riches , and the lusts of other things entering in , choke the word , and it becometh unfruitful .
text2: e ' tane tʉuko ' manto ' kon pɨ ' tʉusewankamasan , ipʉrataaike ' pe e ' nɨto ' nenku ' tɨnʉ ton , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron nɨ ton nɨ i ' se to ' e ' to ' uya main ɨwɨtanʉkʉ . Mɨrɨ uya nin si iyepeta pʉra ikupʉ .

text: And these are they which are sown on good ground ; such as hear the word , and receive it , and bring forth fruit , some thirtyfold , some sixty , and some an hundred .
text2: Tʉron kon nin si esi mɨrɨ ite ' wakʉ non ya ' ipa ' karakasa ' kasa . To ' uya main eta , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' uya rɨ anʉmʉ , mɨrɨpan kon epeta 30 , 60 , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ 100 kaisarɨ rɨ ite ' kwa ipa ' karakasa ' rʉ ' pʉ entai rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said unto them , Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel , or under a bed ? and not to be set on a candlestick ?
text2: Ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ pe ' raan ' pu ewonnʉ ' nin pʉsau o ' koi ' itʉto ' pe tʉuya , mɨrɨ pe pʉra e ' nʉn nɨto ' apon o ' koi ' rɨ ? E ' tane ru ' ku , itapon pona pe ' itʉnin pen ɨmɨrɨ ?

text: For there is nothing hid , which shall not be manifested ; neither was any thing kept secret , but that it should come abroad .
text2: Apʉne pʉra onansa ' pe te ' sen e ' nɨponkato ' pe rɨ iyesi ; iwapu ' tɨsa ' pe te ' sen epa ' ka kɨpo ' pona .

text: If any man have ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Kʉrɨ tʉpana ke na ' ne ' etato ' ike , tɨwɨ netai ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said unto them , Take heed what ye hear : with what measure ye mete , it shall be measured to you : and unto you that hear shall more be given .
text2: Ta ' pʉ iya kanan to ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨnetanʉ kon pɨ ' wakʉ pe ɨsenuminkatɨ ' . I ' tuto ' auya yai pe rɨ ɨnkupʉ ' pʉ yai ɨyena ' i ' tu mɨrɨ — mɨrɨ entai rɨ .

text: For he that hath , to him shall be given : and he that hath not , from him shall be taken even that which he hath .
text2: Ɨnʉ ' rɨ itesa ' pe te ' sen repa mɨrɨ miyarɨ rɨ . Ɨnʉ ' rɨ ɨ ' rɨ esa ' pen nɨ enapai imo ' ka mɨrɨ , itenawon nʉ ' kwɨ rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said , So is the kingdom of God , as if a man should cast seed into the ground ;
text2: Sises uya kanan takaa ' pʉ , “ Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe esi mɨrɨ ka ' pon kiyari ye ' pɨnnin tʉpa ' karakai ' tʉmainarʉ yau kasa .

text: And should sleep , and rise night and day , and the seed should spring and grow up , he knoweth not how .
text2: Iye ' nʉntane rɨ ewarupɨ nau , ipakasa ' rɨ e ' tane wʉi nai , kiyari ye ' rɨ a ' ta mɨrɨ , ɨ ' rɨ kasa iye ' sa ' tukai ' i ' tu iya pʉra rɨ iyesi .

text: For the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself ; first the blade , then the ear , after that the full corn in the ear .
text2: Non uya rɨ iya ' tato ' pe ikupʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iyepetato ' pe rɨ nɨrɨ ikupʉ iya : wapiya ite ' pe te ' ton epa ' ka ; mɨrɨ tʉpo , i ' pai , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ nin si iyɨ ton utaka .

text: But when the fruit is brought forth , immediately he putteth in the sickle , because the harvest is come .
text2: Iyakʉ ' pʉsa ' a ' tai nin si , iye ' sara ' tɨ mɨrɨ e ' tʉrawasoman pɨ ' a ' tɨto ' tʉuya tʉmariyarʉ , si ' kʉrʉ tato ' ke , apʉne pʉra anʉnto ' weyu e ' seposa ' pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said , Whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of God ? or with what comparison shall we compare it ?
text2: Takaa ' pʉ iya kanan , “ Ɨ ' rɨ kasa Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe esi ta ? Ɨ ' rɨ rupɨ panton ekama , ekamanin pe ?

text: It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when it is sown in the earth , is less than all the seeds that be in the earth :
text2: Mosta ' ena ' pɨ , aiko rʉ ' kwɨ kuru kasa iyesi , ɨnpɨmɨnʉ non ya ' .

text: But when it is sown , it groweth up , and becometh greater than all herbs , and shooteth out great branches ; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it .
text2: E ' tane ipɨnsa ' a ' tai , iya ' ta mɨrɨ eke pe rɨ tʉron nɨ ye ' ton umɨ yawon entai rɨ . Eke ton pe rɨ ipanta ton esi toron amʉ ' rɨ esi iti ' nʉ ' kenanʉ yau , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them , as they were able to hear it .
text2: Sises uya tekareei ekama ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' tu ' kan nɨ serɨ warai ' nan panton yai ' ne , to ' uya ito ' ka ' nʉkʉ poken .

text: But without a parable spake he not unto them : and when they were alone , he expounded all things to his disciples .
text2: Panton tapurɨi ' pʉra to ' auro ' ka iya poken pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ . E ' tane tʉpoitorʉ ton pokon pe tesi a ' tai tikin sarɨ , mɨrɨ ta iya e ' kwa pe iyesi tukai ' ekama ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And the same day , when the even was come , he saith unto them , Let us pass over unto the other side .
text2: Mɨrɨ ko ' mamiri pe rɨ , Sises uya , “ Iratoi pona utɨnpai ' nokon , ” ta ' pʉ tʉpoitorʉ ton pɨ ' .

text: And when they had sent away the multitude , they took him even as he was in the ship . And there were also with him other little ships .
text2: Anpisin ton ka ' pon amʉ ' nɨmɨ ' pʉ to ' uya . Sises e ' to ' iyau kanau ya ' ipoitorʉ ton ekanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya arɨ ' pʉ . Tʉron nɨ ton nɨ kanau amʉ ' esi ' pʉ moro .

text: And there arose a great storm of wind , and the waves beat into the ship , so that it was now full .
text2: Pana ' pe rɨ a ' setun uyee ' pʉ , sipa ' sipa uya eke pe tuna anuku ' pʉ kanau yau , isemʉ ' nʉkʉ poken nɨ tʉku ' se .

text: And he was in the hinder part of the ship , asleep on a pillow : and they awake him , and say unto him , Master , carest thou not that we perish ?
text2: Sises esi ' pʉ e ' nʉn nɨ pɨ ' iyaure yau , eke ' nan tapon po . Ipoitorʉ ton uya enpaka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan pɨ ' , “ Ti ' sa , ina pe ' aputa pɨ ' ɨusewankama pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he arose , and rebuked the wind , and said unto the sea , Peace , be still . And the wind ceased , and there was a great calm .
text2: Sises e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' uya a ' setun eseremekʉ ' pʉ , “ E ' paka ' kɨ ! ” mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ sipa ' sipa pɨ ' , “ E ' tʉtʉika ' ! ” ta ' pʉ iya . Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , a ' setun ereuta ' pʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wakʉ pe rɨ pata ena ' pʉ .

text: And he said unto them , Why are ye so fearful ? how is it that ye have no faith ?
text2: Tʉpoitorʉ ton pɨ ' Sises uya ta ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pɨ ' ɨyenari ' nʉmʉ kon ? Anapurɨnʉ kon pʉra rɨ marɨ pe ' iyesi mɨrɨ ? ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they feared exceedingly , and said one to another , What manner of man is this , that even the wind and the sea obey him ?
text2: E ' tane to ' etʉipɨ ' sa ' esi ' pʉ , “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ si pʉse rɨ ka ' pon ? ” tukai ' to ' usekama ' popɨtʉ ' pʉ . “ A ' setun mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ sipa ' sipa rɨ e ' to ' imaimu awɨrɨ ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And they came over unto the other side of the sea , into the country of the Gadarenes .
text2: Kerasin amʉ ' nono pona to ' utɨ ' pʉ , parau ku ' pɨri ratoi pon kon .

text: And when he was come out of the ship , immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit ,
text2: Sises ekanwakasa ' koro ' tau , ka ' pon uruwai ' apai iyepa ' kasa ' uya eporo ' pʉ . Pʉse rɨ ka ' pon yau makoi a ' kwarʉ esi ' pʉ ,

text: Who had his dwelling among the tombs ; and no man could bind him , no , not with chains :
text2: mɨrɨpan uko ' mansa ' esi ' pʉ uruwai ' koro ' tau , ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ tauronpɨ ' se enkurunpa poken pʉra rɨ iyenaka ' sa ' esi ' pʉ , i ' sen ke rɨ auronpɨtʉ poken pʉra rɨ .

text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains , and the chains had been plucked asunder by him , and the fetters broken in pieces : neither could any man tame him .
text2: Inke rɨ i ' ta ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itemiyatʉ ton auronpɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya esi ' pʉ i ' sen amʉ ' ke , e ' tane rɨ mɨrɨ ton nɨ i ' kɨrɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wa ' ka pun nɨ ti ' ta pɨ ' te ' sen a ' morʉpɨtʉ ' pʉ iya . Ɨnʉ ' uya ereutanʉkʉ poken pʉra rɨ , ipan pe rɨ pana ' pe iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And always , night and day , he was in the mountains , and in the tombs , crying , and cutting himself with stones .
text2: Ewarupɨ ' tau mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wʉi nai rɨ usarɨn pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ uruwai ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wʉ ' poro ' ne rɨ , ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨ ' nɨ pɨ ' rɨ , tiwano ' pe rɨ uta ' tɨpɨ ' nɨ pɨ ' tɨ ' ke .

text: But when he saw Jesus afar off , he ran and worshipped him ,
text2: Ɨnnonsi ' kɨ Sises ensa ' tʉuya a ' tai , iyeka ' tumʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan e ' sekunka ' pʉ irau .

text: And cried with a loud voice , and said , What have I to do with thee , Jesus , thou Son of the most high God ? I adjure thee by God , that thou torment me not .
text2: Mɨrɨpan ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ eke pe rɨ , “ Sises , eke Papa Mumu , ɨ ' rɨ pe ukupʉ i ' se me ' an ? Papa pɨ ' , ‘ Ikota ' ma uya pen , ’ ka ' kɨ ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: For he said unto him , Come out of the man , thou unclean spirit .
text2: Serɨ ta ' pʉ iya , apʉne pʉra Sises uya makoi a ' kwarʉ pɨ ' , “ Pʉse ka ' pon yapai epa ' kakɨ ! ” tasa ' pɨ ' .

text: And he asked him , What is thy name ? And he answered , saying , My name is Legion : for we are many .
text2: “ Ɨnʉ ' ɨyese ' ? ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya ipɨ ' . “ Anpisin ton kuwayau amʉ ' uyese ' , ” tukai ' eikʉ ' pʉ iya .

text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country .
text2: Ipan pe rɨ Sises pawana ' tɨ pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ mɨrɨ pata yapai ɨri a ' kwarʉ ton ennoko iya namai ' .

text: Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding .
text2: A ' ko pe rɨ tu ' kan kon nɨ peiruku amʉ ' esi ' pʉ enta ' nan pɨ ' i ' kʉrʉ po .

text: And all the devils besought him , saying , Send us into the swine , that we may enter into them .
text2: Sises pawana ' tɨ ' pʉ ɨri a ' kwarʉ ton uya peiruku amʉ ' ya ' tenno ' to ' kon pe iya .

text: And forthwith Jesus gave them leave . And the unclean spirits went out , and entered into the swine : and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea , ( they were about two thousand ; ) and were choked in the sea .
text2: To ' nin si utɨto ' pe ikupʉ ' pʉ iya mɨrɨ . Ɨri a ' kwarʉ ton nin si utɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ ka ' pon yapai peiruku amʉ ' ya ' . Tanporo rɨ nin si , 2 , 000 e ' to ' airon kon peiruku amʉ ' e ' tʉrʉ ' kwa ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon aputa ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri ka ' .

text: And they that fed the swine fled , and told it in the city , and in the country . And they went out to see what it was that was done .
text2: To ' pa ' sima pɨ ' te ' san ka ' pon amʉ ' eka ' tumʉ ' pʉ pata pona itekareei ekamase ' na , umɨ yau ' ne rɨ te ' san pana ' tɨ ' pʉ to ' uya . Iye ' ku ' sa ' rʉ ' pʉ ense ' na ka ' pon amʉ ' utɨ ' pʉ .

text: And they come to Jesus , and see him that was possessed with the devil , and had the legion , sitting , and clothed , and in his right mind : and they were afraid .
text2: To ' uyee ' pʉ Sises piya ' , mɨrɨpan kon uya kʉrɨ rɨ anpisin kuwayau makoi a ' kwarʉ yen pe te ' sen ka ' pon ene ' pʉ iyepontɨsa ' , iyereutasa ' esi ' pʉ , wakʉ pe iya ' kwarʉ . Tanporo enari ' ke ' pe to ' ena ' pʉ mɨrɨ pɨ ' .

text: And they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil , and also concerning the swine .
text2: Kamoro ennin nʉ ' san uya ka ' pon amʉ ' pana ' tɨ ' pʉ iye ' ku ' sa ' makoi a ' kwarʉ yen ka ' pon pɨ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ peiruku amʉ ' pɨ ' rɨ nɨrɨ .

text: And they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon uya Sises ekama ' po ' pʉ itɨto ' pe tʉnono kon apai .

text: And when he was come into the ship , he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him .
text2: Sises ekanwa ' tɨ koro ' tau kanau ya ' , makoi a ' kwarʉ yen nʉ ' pʉ ka ' pon uya ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Aya ' kɨrɨ utɨi ' ya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Howbeit Jesus suffered him not , but saith unto him , Go home to thy friends , and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee , and hath had compassion on thee .
text2: E ' tane Sises esi ' pʉ itɨ i ' se pʉra , e ' tane , “ Enna ' pokɨ apata ya ' , ɨtonpa ton koro ' ta ' . Eke pe rɨ Itepuru nʉkupʉ ' pʉ ɨpɨ ' isentu ' masa ' ekamata , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he departed , and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him : and all men did marvel .
text2: Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ tanporo Te ' ka ' pores poro , Sises nʉkupʉ ' pʉ tʉpɨ ' ekama pɨ ' , mɨrɨ pɨ ' tanporon kon usewansiuka ' pʉ .

text: And when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side , much people gathered unto him : and he was nigh unto the sea .
text2: Sises enna ' po ' pʉ iye ' kwɨrɨtʉ ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri ratoi pona . Mɨrɨ yau parau ku ' pɨri ka ' ta po , anpisin pe rɨ to ' amʉra ' pʉ iwoi .

text: And , behold , there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue , Jairus by name ; and when he saw him , he fell at his feet ,
text2: Isairas , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' epuru uyee ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan Sises ensa ' tʉuya a ' tai ita ' mo ' ka ' pʉ i ' ta piya ' .

text: And besought him greatly , saying , My little daughter lieth at the point of death : I pray thee , come and lay thy hands on her , that she may be healed ; and she shall live .
text2: Mɨrɨpan ipan pe rɨ ipawana ' tɨ ' pʉ iya , “ Aiko rʉ ' kwɨ uyensi man takuru ' ke , iyeri ' kapʉ rɨ . Apʉne ɨsi ' kɨ , ɨyemiyatʉ inonkatanʉ ' kɨ ipona , mɨrɨpan usepi ' tɨto ' pe iyerikʉ namai ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Jesus went with him ; and much people followed him , and thronged him .
text2: Mɨrɨpan Sises e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ iya ' kɨrɨ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , tu ' kan kon nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' utɨ ' pʉ iya ' kɨrɨ , to ' uya iwontɨ ' pʉ sen winɨ ' ne rɨ .

text: And a certain woman , which had an issue of blood twelve years ,
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , uri ' san esi ' pʉ 12 kaisa rɨ wʉipiya mʉn ennoko pɨ ' iko ' mansa ' .

text: And had suffered many things of many physicians , and had spent all that she had , and was nothing bettered , but rather grew worse ,
text2: Tu ' kan kon nɨ ta ' ta amʉ ' uya epi ' tɨ tane , tʉpʉrataai rɨ enno ' tane iya to ' e ' ma pɨ ' , e ' tane tʉusepi ' tɨ pe ekama tane iya , miyarɨ rɨ ipan pe rɨ iyena ' pʉ .

text: When she had heard of Jesus , came in the press behind , and touched his garment .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya rʉ ' kwɨ Sises eta ' pʉ , iyee ' pʉ anpisin ton koro ' tau ite ' ma ' pʉ pe .

text: For she said , If I may touch but his clothes , I shall be whole .
text2: “ Ipon nʉ ' kwɨ rɨ a ' pɨ ' sa ' uya yau , usepi ' tɨ rɨ mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya ti ' nau rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ .

text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up ; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague .
text2: Ipon a ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan mʉn tʉutɨsen ereuta ' pʉ mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ . E ' ne ' pe iye ' to ' anpokʉmanin usepi ' tɨ ' pʉ .

text: And Jesus , immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him , turned him about in the press , and said , Who touched my clothes ?
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , Sises uya tʉmeruntɨrʉ epa ' ka ' pʉ i ' tu ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan era ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ anpisin koro ' tau , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ , “ Ɨnʉ ' upon a ' pɨtʉi ? ” tai ' ma .

text: And his disciples said unto him , Thou seest the multitude thronging thee , and sayest thou , Who touched me ?
text2: Ipoitorʉ ton uya eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Ene auya pʉra pe ' nai ka ' pon amʉ ' uya ɨwontɨsa ' ? Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ‘ Ɨnʉ ' uya ' pɨtʉi ? ’ ta auya ? ”

text: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing .
text2: E ' tane rɨ Sises uya tenu tʉpɨtʉ ' pʉ , ɨnʉ ' uya iku ' sa ' tukai ' .

text: But the woman fearing and trembling , knowing what was done in her , came and fell down before him , and told him all the truth .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uri ' san uya i ' tu ' pʉ tʉpɨ ' iye ' ku ' sa ' , mɨrɨpan uyee ' pʉ e ' tɨtɨtɨ ' kai ' ma rɨ tenari ' nʉmʉ ke . Ita ' mo ' ka ' pʉ i ' ta piya ' , mɨrɨpan uya tanporo rɨ i ' napairon ekama ' pʉ ipɨ ' , tʉpɨ ' iye ' ku ' sa ' rʉ ' pʉ .

text: And he said unto her , Daughter , thy faith hath made thee whole ; go in peace , and be whole of thy plague .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ Ma ' non , anapurɨnʉ uya rɨ ɨkonekasa ' mɨrɨ wakʉ pe . Enta si tʉusewankamai ' pʉra , ɨusepi ' tɨsa ' si mɨrɨ ɨyewankamanin apai , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: While he yet spake , there came from the ruler of the synagogue ' s house certain which said , Thy daughter is dead : why troublest thou the Master any further ?
text2: Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , Isairas pana ' tɨnin nan uyee ' pʉ itiwʉ ' tawonsi ' kɨ , mɨrɨpan kon uya ta ' pʉ , “ Ɨyensi eri ' ka ' sa ' man . Ti ' sa rɨ kʉsanpokʉmai , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken , he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue , Be not afraid , only believe .
text2: Sises esi ' pʉ to ' maimu ɨnetapai pʉra rɨ , e ' tane ta ' pʉ iya ipɨ ' , “ Kenari ' nʉmʉi , e ' tane apurɨkɨ rɨken , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he suffered no man to follow him , save Peter , and James , and John the brother of James .
text2: Mɨrɨpan ɨnʉ ' rɨ utɨ i ' se pʉra iyesi ' pʉ ta ' kɨrɨ , Pi ' ta , Isens mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iyakon Isaan nɨken .

text: And he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue , and seeth the tumult , and them that wept and wailed greatly .
text2: To ' uyee ' pʉ itepuru iwʉ ' ta ' , mɨrɨ yau Sises uya tʉutano ' masan eke pe rɨ ene ' pʉ , pokoi pe rɨ tʉukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨ ' se rɨ tʉukaransan eta ' pʉ .

text: And when he was come in , he saith unto them , Why make ye this ado , and weep ? the damsel is not dead , but sleepeth .
text2: Mɨrɨpan ewomʉ ' pʉ , ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' tanporo rɨ autano ' ma kon serɨ ? Ɨ ' rɨ pɨ ' aukaramʉ kon ? Mʉre eri ' sa ' pen , iye ' nʉmʉ rɨken , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they laughed him to scorn . But when he had put them all out , he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel , and them that were with him , and entereth in where the damsel was lying .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ uta ' kɨrɨn pɨ ' ipɨ ' . Tanporo to ' enpa ' ka ' pʉ iya , mʉre kʉipʉnʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ isan mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ osorʉwawon kon nɨken tʉpoitorʉ ton pokon pe iyewomʉ ' pʉ mʉre eri ' sa ' pata ' se ' airɨ .

text: And he took the damsel by the hand , and said unto her , Talitha cumi ; which is , being interpreted , Damsel , I say unto thee , arise .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ itemiyatʉ pɨ ' ta ' sii ' , “ Tari ' ta kun ! ” ta ' pʉ iya ( “ Uri ' san mʉre , e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' , ta uya ɨpɨ ' , ” ta tʉuya e ' kwa pe ) .

text: And straightway the damsel arose , and walked ; for she was of the age of twelve years . And they were astonished with a great astonishment .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , iye ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ usarɨn pɨ ' ( 12 kaisaron iwʉipiyaai pe iyesi ' pʉ ) . Serɨ e ' ku ' sa ' pɨ ' ipan pe to ' usewansiuka ' pʉ .

text: And he charged them straitly that no man should know it ; and commanded that something should be given her to eat .
text2: Sises uya ipan pe to ' pɨ ' ta ' pʉ , “ Kʉsekamatʉu ɨnʉ ' yan pɨ ' rɨ . Irepatɨ ' ɨ ' rɨ rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ iyenta ' nato ' ipɨ ' ke , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he went out from thence , and came into his own country ; and his disciples follow him .
text2: Sises uya mɨrɨ pata nɨmɨ ' pʉ , iyenna ' po ' pʉ tʉpata ' se ' ya ' , ipoitorʉ ton nɨ itonpa pe .

text: And when the sabbath day was come , he began to teach in the synagogue : and many hearing him were astonished , saying , From whence hath this man these things ? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him , that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands ?
text2: Sapa ' e ' seposa ' a ' tai , to ' enupa pɨ ' iye ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tau . Tu ' ke rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ yau , mɨrɨpan eta tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , tanporon kon nɨ usewansiuka ' pʉ . “ Nai yau serɨ ton eporo ' pʉ pʉse rɨ ka ' pon uya ? ” tukai ' to ' usekama ' popɨtʉ ' pʉ . “ Ɨ ' rɨ rɨ pu ' ketʉ ke irepasa ' pe iyesi ? Ɨ ' rɨ kasa rɨ eke rɨ Papa tʉrawasooi kupʉ iya ?

text: Is not this the carpenter , the son of Mary , the brother of James , and Joses , and of Juda , and Simon ? and are not his sisters here with us ? And they were offended at him .
text2: Kiya ' pinta pen pe ' pʉse rɨ ? Meri mʉre ; Isens , Isoses , Isutas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Saiman pokon rui ? Serɨ yau pe ' upiyau ' nokon iparusi ton pʉra nai ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya . Mɨrɨpan kon ɨkɨnʉmʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' .

text: But Jesus said unto them , A prophet is not without honour , but in his own country , and among his own kin , and in his own house .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Ipata ' se ' yau rɨken , itonpa ton koro ' tau mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itiwʉ ' rɨ tau pu ' kena ' nama pʉra iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he could there do no mighty work , save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk , and healed them .
text2: Eke Papa tʉrawasooi kupʉ iya poken pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ mɨrɨ yau , e ' tane rɨ temiyatʉ rɨken nonkapɨtʉ ' pʉ iya tu ' kan kon pen ka ' pon amʉ ' takuru ' kena ' nan pona , mɨrɨpan kon epi ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ iya .

text: And he marvelled because of their unbelief . And he went round about the villages , teaching .
text2: Ipan pe rɨ to ' pɨ ' isewansiukapɨtʉ ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra apurɨto ' to ' uya pʉra iyesi pɨ ' . Mɨrɨpan Sises utɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ eke iwa ton pata ton kaisa rɨ ' ne , ka ' pon amʉ ' enupapɨtʉ pɨ ' .

text: And he called unto him the twelve , and began to send them forth by two and two ; and gave them power over unclean spirits ;
text2: Tʉpoitorʉ ton , 12 kaisaron kon tʉkɨ ' mai ' tʉpiya ' , to ' enno ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ iya asa ' rɨ ' ne , mɨrɨpan kon repa ' pʉ iya to ' meruntɨrʉ ke , makoi a ' kwarʉ entai to ' e ' to ' pe .

text: And commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey , save a staff only ; no scrip , no bread , no money in their purse :
text2: Serɨ ton ke to ' auro ' ka ' pʉ iya , “ Ɨ ' rɨ rɨ kʉsatʉu aya ' kɨrɨ ' nokon ɨutɨ kon koro ' tau , teke ' sen nɨken — tʉwenantu ke pʉra rɨ , tʉpaikii ke pʉra rɨ , pʉrata pʉra rɨ ɨpokʉrʉʉi kon yau mʉtɨtʉi ' .

text: But be shod with sandals ; and not put on two coats .
text2: Sapato yau rɨ e ' tɨ ' ; tu ' ke ipona ɨpon kon pʉro ' pon yau ke ' tʉu , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And he said unto them , In what place soever ye enter into an house , there abide till ye depart from that place .
text2: To ' auro ' ka ' pʉ iya kanan , “ To ' uya ɨyereutanʉ ' sa ' kon na ' ne ' airɨ rɨ , mɨrɨ rɨ ɨutɨ tau me ' tʉi ' pata nɨmɨ auya ' nokon pona rɨ .

text: And whosoever shall not receive you , nor hear you , when ye depart thence , shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them . Verily I say unto you , It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment , than for that city .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ pata uya ɨyereutanʉ ' sa ' kon pʉra iyesi yau , mɨrɨ pe pʉra ɨyetapai ' nokon pʉra rɨ iyesi yau , to ' nɨmɨ auya ' nokon a ' tai a ' ta kon mʉtɨutɨpɨ ' tʉi ' . Serɨ uya rɨ to ' pana ' tɨ mɨrɨ Papa uya to ' kota ' mato ' oton ekamanin pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they went out , and preached that men should repent .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' itekare ekamase ' na , to ' era ' tɨto ' pe tʉmakooi kon apai .

text: And they cast out many devils , and anointed with oil many that were sick , and healed them .
text2: Mɨrɨpan tu ' ke rɨ makoi a ' kwarʉ enpa ' kapɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon uya tu ' kan kon nɨ takuru ' kena ' nan karapaimapɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' epi ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And king Herod heard of him ; ( for his name was spread abroad : ) and he said , That John the Baptist was risen from the dead , and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him .
text2: Kin Era ' uya serɨ eta ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra Sises ese ' enasa ' esi ' pʉ wakʉ pe kuru ti ' tusen pe . Tʉron kon uya , “ Isaan Pa ' tes rɨ e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' mɨrɨ terikʉ ' pʉ apai ; mɨrɨ wenai , eke Papa tʉrawasooi kupʉ iya mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: Others said , That it is Elias . And others said , That it is a prophet , or as one of the prophets .
text2: Tʉron kon uya , “ Iraisa kʉrɨ rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ . Tʉron kon uya rɨ kanan , “ Pu ' kena ' kʉrɨ rɨ , penaro ' kon pu ' kena ' amʉ ' esi ' pʉ waraino , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: But when Herod heard thereof , he said , It is John , whom I beheaded : he is risen from the dead .
text2: Era ' uya etasa ' a ' tai , “ Isaan Pa ' tes sa ' ne kʉrɨ rɨ ko ! I ' pai unakʉtʉ ' pʉ , e ' tane ito ' pansa ' terikʉ ' pʉ apai ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John , and bound him in prison for Herodias ' sake , his brother Philip ' s wife : for he had married her .
text2: Apʉne pʉra Era ' uya rɨ Isaan a ' sito ' pe ikupʉ ' pʉ . Auronpɨ ' to ' pe to ' uya ikupʉ ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan tʉto ' pe pariki ' si ta ' . Era ' uya serɨ kupʉ ' pʉ Eratiyas wenai , tʉnmari ' ma ' pʉ takon Piri ' no ' pʉ pe rɨ iye ' tane .

text: For John had said unto Herod , It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother ' s wife .
text2: Isaan Pa ' tes e ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ Era ' auro ' ka pɨ ' , “ Main awɨrɨ ɨwesi pe pʉra iyesi mɨrɨ ayakon no ' pʉ anʉnsa ' auya na ' ne ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya ipɨ ' .

text: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him , and would have killed him ; but she could not :
text2: Mɨrɨ uya Eratiyas ɨkɨnʉnpasa ' esi ' pʉ Isaan nɨ ɨnwɨpai , e ' tane ikupʉ iya poken pʉra iyesi ' pʉ ,

text: For Herod feared John , knowing that he was a just man and an holy , and observed him ; and when he heard him , he did many things , and heard him gladly .
text2: apʉne pʉra Era ' esi ' pʉ Isaan namanin pe , iwapu pe iyesi ' pʉ i ' tu tʉuya ke , ipokena ' pe , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wakʉ pe . Isaurokʉ eta tʉuya a ' tai , ekamʉra rɨ iyenapɨ ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨ rɨ e ' tane imaimu ɨnetapai iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And when a convenient day was come , that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords , high captains , and chief estates of Galilee ;
text2: Mɨrɨ yau nin si , iweyu e ' sepokaa ' pʉ mɨrɨ . Tentu ' pʉ weyu rʉ ' pʉ a ' tai , Era ' uya enta ' nan kupʉ ' pʉ eke ton itepuru ton , soisa amʉ ' epuru ton , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ eke ton Kiyarari pata yawon kon ewe ' to ' iya .

text: And when the daughter of the said Herodias came in , and danced , and pleased Herod and them that sat with him , the king said unto the damsel , Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt , and I will give it thee .
text2: Eratiyas mʉre uye ' sa ' a ' tai amanʉnse ' na , imanʉmʉ uya wakʉ pe rɨ Era ' kupʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ inkɨ ' ma ' san nɨrɨ . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' , kin uya ta ' pʉ uri ' san pɨ ' , “ I ' se ɨwe ' to ' pɨ ' rɨ uyekama ' pokɨ ɨrepa uya mɨrɨ ike , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he sware unto her , Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me , I will give it thee , unto the half of my kingdom .
text2: Eke pe rɨ auro ' ka ' pʉ iya tʉnku ' ton pɨ ' , “ Ɨnekama ' po ' pʉ ke rɨ ɨrepa uya , a ' sa ' mʉyai itesa ' pe e ' to ' pata ke rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And she went forth , and said unto her mother , What shall I ask ? And she said , The head of John the Baptist .
text2: Mɨrɨ pɨ ' uri ' san epa ' ka ' pʉ tʉsan ekama ' pose ' na . “ Ɨ ' rɨ kuru rɨ ekama ' po uya serɨ ? ” ta ' pʉ iya . “ Isaan Pa ' tes i ' pai rʉ ' pʉ ekama ' po ' , ” tukai ' eikʉ ' pʉ iya .

text: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king , and asked , saying , I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , tʉusenutɨi ' uri ' san enna ' po ' pʉ kin piya ' , “ Urepa auya i ' se e ' ai ' serɨ pe Isaan Pa ' tes i ' pai rʉ ' pʉ ke parapi po ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And the king was exceeding sorry ; yet for his oath ' s sake , and for their sakes which sat with him , he would not reject her .
text2: Kin upokoita ' pʉ tʉusaurokʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' ipan pe , e ' tane , apʉne pʉra ikupʉ uya kuru tasa ' tʉuya rʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' tʉnkɨ ' ma ' san pana airɨ , inurunpa iya poken pʉra iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And immediately the king sent an executioner , and commanded his head to be brought : and he went and beheaded him in the prison ,
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya inke pʉra i ' pairʉkanin ennoko ' pʉ , Isaan i ' pai rʉ ' pʉ ne ' to ' pe iya . Itɨ ' pʉ pariki ' si ta ' , mɨrɨpan uya Isaan i ' pairʉka ' pʉ .

text: And brought his head in a charger , and gave it to the damsel : and the damsel gave it to her mother .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya inee ' pʉ parapi po , mɨrɨpan uya itʉrʉ ' pʉ uri ' san ena ' , mɨrɨpan uya itʉrʉ ' pʉ tʉsan ena ' .

text: And when his disciples heard of it , they came and took up his corpse , and laid it in a tomb .
text2: Mɨrɨ tetai ' , Isaan poitorʉ rʉ ' san uyee ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya itekepu arɨ ' pʉ , iu ' na ' tɨto ' pe tʉuya ' nokon tɨ ' akasa ' uruwai ' pe ya ' .

text: And the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus , and told him all things , both what they had done , and what they had taught .
text2: Enno ' sa ' kon enna ' posa ' amʉra ' pʉ Sises woi , mɨrɨpan kon uya tanporo tʉnkupʉ ' pʉ kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' enupa ' pʉ tʉuya ' nokon nɨ ekama ' pʉ .

text: And he said unto them , Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place , and rest a while : for there were many coming and going , and they had no leisure so much as to eat .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , tu ' ke rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' uye ' pɨtʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' utɨpɨtʉ esi ' pʉ , Sises mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ipoitorʉ ton enta ' nato ' a ' tai pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ uriya ' , to ' pɨ ' ta ' pʉ iya , “ Utɨnpai ' nokon mɨ airɨ rɨ tʉ ' kena ' pɨ yau e ' nɨ poken mɨrɨ koro ' tau ɨumoronkapʉ kon pa , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they departed into a desert place by ship privately .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ utɨn pɨ ' kanau yau tʉ ' kena ' pɨ pata ya ' .

text: And the people saw them departing , and many knew him , and ran afoot thither out of all cities , and outwent them , and came together unto him .
text2: Tu ' kan kon nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' uya to ' ene ' pʉ , to ' i ' tu ' pʉ to ' uya kamoro pe . Mɨrɨpan kon eka ' tumʉ ' pʉ tanporo pata ton apai ' ne irawɨrɨ a ' mun poro , mɨrɨpan kon uya pata eporo ' pʉ to ' rawɨrɨ .

text: And Jesus , when he came out , saw much people , and was moved with compassion toward them , because they were as sheep not having a shepherd : and he began to teach them many things .
text2: Sises ekanwakasa ' uya tu ' ke anpisin pe ka ' pon amʉ ' ensa ' a ' tai , ipan pe rɨ to ' pɨ ' isentu ' ma ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra to ' esi ' pʉ karimeru amʉ ' esi tʉpa ' simanin ke pʉra kasa . Mɨrɨpan kon enupa pɨ ' iye ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ tu ' kan pɨ ' rɨ .

text: And when the day was now far spent , his disciples came unto him , and said , This is a desert place , and now the time is far passed :
text2: Pata uko ' mansa ' a ' tai , ipoitorʉ ton uyee ' pʉ ipiya ' , mɨrɨpan kon uya , “ Pata uko ' manka ' sa ' kuru rɨ man , ɨnnon sa ' ne serɨ pata ko , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: Send them away , that they may go into the country round about , and into the villages , and buy themselves bread : for they have nothing to eat .
text2: “ Ka ' pon amʉ ' enno ' kɨ a ' ko pan parɨ umɨ ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ eke iwa ton pata amʉ ' ya ' ne , tiwano ' kon pe tenta ' nato ' kon ipɨ ' e ' mato ' pe to ' uya , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: He answered and said unto them , Give ye them to eat . And they say unto him , Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread , and give them to eat ?
text2: E ' tane to ' eikʉ ' pʉ iya , “ Ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon pe rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ to ' irepatɨ ' to ' enta ' nato ' ike ke , ” ta ' pʉ iya . Ta ' pʉ to ' uya ipɨ ' , “ Mɨrɨ uya 8 kaisa rɨ kapʉi ka ' pon e ' tʉrawasomasa ' epe ' pʉ mo ' ka mɨrɨ ! Mɨrɨ kaisa rɨ ken pe ' ennoko pʉreti pɨ ' to ' ewe ' to ' pe ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: He saith unto them , How many loaves have ye ? go and see . And when they knew , they say , Five , and two fishes .
text2: Sises uya to ' ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ kaisa rɨ rʉ ' kwɨ pʉreti nai ɨpiyau ' nokon ? Apʉne entantɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya . To ' uya ensa ' a ' tai , “ 5 kaisaron nʉ ' kwɨ pʉreti mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ asa ' ron kon nʉ ' kwɨ moro ' amʉ ' man , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya ipɨ ' .

text: And he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ tʉpoitorʉ ton pɨ ' , “ Ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉranʉ ' pɨ ' tɨ ' tamu ' kuru ' ke ' ne mɨrɨpan kon ereutapɨ ' to ' pe wana ' pona , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they sat down in ranks , by hundreds , and by fifties .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' ereutapɨtʉ ' pʉ tamu ' kuru ' ke ' ne 100 kaisa rɨ ' ne mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ 50 kaisa rɨ ' ne .

text: And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes , he looked up to heaven , and blessed , and brake the loaves , and gave them to his disciples to set before them ; and the two fishes divided he among them all .
text2: Mɨrɨpan Sises uya 5 kaisaron itekiino pʉreti mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ asa ' ron kon nʉ ' kwɨ moro ' amʉ ' anʉmʉ ' pʉ . Ka ' ta ' tenu tʉtʉse tenki ta ' pʉ iya Papa pɨ ' , i ' kwɨ ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ iya . Itʉrʉ ' pʉ iya tʉpoitorʉ ton uya ekanto ' pe ka ' pon amʉ ' ena ' . Mɨrɨ kasa rɨ marɨ asa ' ron kon nʉ ' kwɨ moro ' amʉ ' kupʉ ' pʉ iya to ' kaisa rɨ to ' e ' to ' pe .

text: And they did all eat , and were filled .
text2: Tanporon kon nɨ enta ' na ' pʉ ta ' wetapɨ ' se ,

text: And they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments , and of the fishes .
text2: mɨrɨpan ipoitorʉ ton uya 12 kaisa rɨ pa ' siki ' ti pʉreti mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ moro ' amʉ ' tonpa ' pʉ e ' nonkasa ' anuku ' pʉ .

text: And they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men .
text2: Warawoti ' si amʉ ' pʉreti pɨ ' iyenta ' nasa ' kon tu ' kanoro esi ' pʉ 5 , 000 kaisa rɨ .

text: And straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship , and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida , while he sent away the people .
text2: Inke pʉra tʉpoitorʉ ton ekanwa ' tɨto ' pe kanau ya ' ikuu ' pʉ iya , to ' utɨto ' pe tʉrawɨrɨ Pe ' saita pona , anpisin enno ' tane tʉuya .

text: And when he had sent them away , he departed into a mountain to pray .
text2: To ' nɨmɨ tʉpo , wʉ ' pona itɨ ' pʉ ɨpʉremai ' .

text: And when even was come , the ship was in the midst of the sea , and he alone on the land .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai ko ' mamʉ pe pata enaka ' tane , kanau esi ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri aporo ' po . Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , Sises esi ' pʉ tikin sarɨ a ' mun po .

text: And he saw them toiling in rowing ; for the wind was contrary unto them : and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them , walking upon the sea , and would have passed by them .
text2: Tʉpoitorʉ ton utanpokʉma ene ' pʉ iya , tʉkanwa kon i ' kura i ' se , apʉne pʉra a ' setun uya to ' kota ' ma esi ' pʉ to ' winɨkʉi ' tʉuyepʉ ke . Awanakʉi ' , 3 a ' kʉra ' mɨrɨ pe pʉra 6 a ' kʉra ' rɨ to ' piya ' iyee ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri pʉro ' po . To ' rɨ entaka iya esi ' pʉ .

text: But when they saw him walking upon the sea , they supposed it had been a spirit , and cried out :
text2: E ' tane parau ku ' pɨri pʉro ' po isarɨ ene tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , a ' kwarʉ ' pʉ pe to ' uya ekama ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon upirorʉnpɨtʉ ' pʉ ,

text: For they all saw him , and were troubled . And immediately he talked with them , and saith unto them , Be of good cheer : it is I ; be not afraid .
text2: apʉne pʉra tanporo ensa ' tʉuya ' nokon pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan kon etʉipɨtʉ ' pʉ ipan pe . Inke pʉra Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Meruntɨ pe e ' tɨ ' ! Urɨ rɨ . Ketʉipɨ ' tʉu , ” ta ' pʉ iya .
