text2: Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen weyu pe te ' ton to ' ena ' ɨyeseru enpoikanin pe , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' apurɨto ' ipɨkɨrɨ pe kanan , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him .
text2: Mʉre sanon nin si usewansiuka ' pʉ mɨrɨ Simiyan usaurokʉ pɨ ' , ipɨ ' .

text: And Simeon blessed them , and said unto Mary his mother , Behold , this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel ; and for a sign which shall be spoken against ;
text2: Simiyan uya to ' pʉrema ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ Meri , isan pɨ ' , “ Pʉse rɨ mʉre esi Papa Nanʉmʉ ' pʉ , tʉron kon ma ' tanʉ ' nin pe , tʉron kon nɨrɨ pika ' tɨnin pe , tu ' kan kon nɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pata awon kon . Tensen pe iyesi Papa winɨpaino tu ' kan kon nɨ newa ' nomanʉ ton tʉmaimu kon ke .

text: ( Yea , a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also , ) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed .
text2: Mɨrɨpan tu ' kan kon nɨ usenuminkato ' usenpoikato ' oton . Mɨrɨpan pɨrɨu kasa kuru pokoi uya ɨyewan pokato ' oton , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And there was one Anna , a prophetess , the daughter of Phanuel , of the tribe of Aser : she was of a great age , and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity ;
text2: Moro kanan si uri ' san pu ' kena ' esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ , Ana itese ' , Panuwerʉ ensi , Aisarʉ ko ' tonpa . No ' sami ' si pe iyesi ' pʉ . 7 kaisa rɨ rɨken wʉipiya iko ' mansa ' rʉ ' pʉ temari ' mai ' .

text: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years , which departed not from the temple , but served God with fastings and prayers night and day .
text2: Mɨrɨpan nin si uko ' mansa ' 84 kaisa rɨ wʉipiya tʉtaan ' pʉ uma ' ta ' pʉ pata ' pʉ yau . Tʉutɨsen pen nɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' use ' mato ' , ɨpʉremato ' iwʉ ' tapai , wʉi kaisa rɨ tʉwɨpʉremasen Papa pɨ ' , useruman pɨ ' tenta ' nai ' pʉra te ' sen .

text: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord , and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai kuru si iyee ' pʉ mɨrɨ to ' poi rɨ , mɨrɨpan uya tenki ta ' pʉ Papa pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan usaurokʉ ' pʉ pʉse rɨ mʉre pɨ ' tu ' kan kon pana ya ' tenuri ' san Papa uya Surusiran pon kon pika ' tɨ ton ennoko i ' se te ' san .

text: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord , they returned into Galilee , to their own city Nazareth .
text2: Isose ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Meri uya tanporon nɨ Itepuru winon Main enuka ' nʉ ' sa ' a ' tai , to ' enna ' po ' pʉ tʉpata ' se ' kon ya ' Nasare ' pona , Kiyarari yau te ' sen .

text: And the child grew , and waxed strong in spirit , filled with wisdom : and the grace of God was upon him .
text2: Mɨrɨpan mʉre usemo ' ka ' pʉ pana ' pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ emiya ' pokena ' pe , Papa uya wakʉ nonkasa ' esi ' pʉ ipona .

text: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover .
text2: Wʉipiya kaisa rɨ Sises sanon utɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ Surusiran pona To ' Epoi Itɨ ' pʉ Weyu Rʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' .

text: And when he was twelve years old , they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast .
text2: 12 kaisa rɨ wʉipiya Sises enasa ' a ' tai , to ' utɨ ' pʉ iweyu rʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' , tʉutɨpɨ ' to ' kon kasa rɨ .

text: And when they had fulfilled the days , as they returned , the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem ; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it .
text2: Mɨrɨ pata ' pʉ pe , tʉsanon enna ' po koro ' tau , iye ' nɨmɨ ' pʉ Surusiran po to ' wanmʉra rɨ .

text: But they , supposing him to have been in the company , went a day ' s journey ; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance .
text2: Tʉtonpa ton pokon pe na ' kɨ iyesi tukai ' to ' utɨ ' pʉ tikin nɨ wʉi rɨ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , iwarinpa pɨ ' to ' e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' koro ' tau .

text: And when they found him not , they turned back again to Jerusalem , seeking him .
text2: Eporo tʉuya ' nokon kasa pʉra , to ' enna ' po ' pʉ Surusiran pona iwarinpase ' na .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days they found him in the temple , sitting in the midst of the doctors , both hearing them , and asking them questions .
text2: Osorʉwau wʉi pata ' pʉ pe , to ' uya eporo ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' use ' mato ' , ɨpʉremato ' iwʉ ' pʉ ' kʉ tau . Iyereutasa ' esi ' pʉ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan koro ' tau to ' eta pɨ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' nɨrɨ ekama ' popɨtʉ pɨ ' .

text: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers .
text2: Tanporo eta pɨ ' te ' san usewansiuka ' pʉ tanporon nɨ i ' tu iya pɨ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ei ' pɨtʉ iya pɨ ' .

text: And when they saw him , they were amazed : and his mother said unto him , Son , why hast thou thus dealt with us ? behold , thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing .
text2: Isanon uya ensa ' a ' tai , to ' kanan usewansiuka ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan isanon uya ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ Mooi , ɨ ' rɨto ' pe serɨ kasa ina ku ' sa ' auya ? Ipan pe ina ewankamasa ' auya serɨ , mɨrɨpan pɨ ' ina uya awarinpa , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he said unto them , How is it that ye sought me ? wist ye not that I must be about my Father ' s business ?
text2: “ Ɨ ' rɨto ' pe uwarinpa auya ' nokon ? Ukʉipʉnʉ iwʉ ' tau pe ' esi tukai ' i ' tu auya ' nokon pʉra iyesi ' pʉ ? ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them .
text2: E ' tane mɨrɨ ta iya to ' ka ' nʉkʉ to ' uya pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And he went down with them , and came to Nazareth , and was subject unto them : but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart .
text2: Mɨrɨpan enna ' po ' pʉ to ' a ' kɨrɨ Nasare ' pona mɨrɨ yau si to ' maimu awɨrɨ iyesi ' pʉ . Isan usenuminkapɨtʉ ' pʉ serɨ ton pɨ ' tewan yau .

text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature , and in favour with God and man .
text2: Sises usemo ' ka ' pʉ emiya ' pokena ' pe . Papa mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' enu yau kuru rɨ iyesi ' pʉ .

text: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar , Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea , and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee , and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis , and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene ,
text2: 15 kaisa rɨ wʉipiya pata ' pʉ pe Taipiriyas ena ' pʉ pata Ron epuru pe , Ponsiyas Paire ' esi ' pʉ Isutiya kopʉnaai pe , Era ' esi ' pʉ Kiyarari esa ' pe , itakon Piri ' esi ' pʉ Itureya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Tʉra ' konai ' tes esa ' pe , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Raiseniyas esi ' pʉ Apirini esa ' pe .

text: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests , the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Anas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Kaya ' pas esi ' pʉ use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan epuru pe . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Main uyee ' pʉ Papa winon , Sakaraya mumu , Isaan itese ' piya ' , rɨmono ' tau iyesi koro ' tau .

text: And he came into all the country about Jordan , preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins ;
text2: Itɨ ' pʉ Isotan tuna piyawɨron pata ya ' ne , makoi apai era ' tɨn pe epa ' taisiman nɨto ' makoi pɨ ' usentu ' man nɨto ' pe ekareei ekama pɨ ' .

text: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet , saying , The voice of one crying in the wilderness , Prepare ye the way of the Lord , make his paths straight .
text2: Iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' kasa pu ' kena ' Aisaya maimu karetaai yau , “ Rɨmono ' tau ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨ ' nɨ , ‘ Itepuru e ' ma ikonekatɨ ' ; to ' sa rɨ ite ' ma ikonekatɨ ' .

text: Every valley shall be filled , and every mountain and hill shall be brought low ; and the crooked shall be made straight , and the rough ways shall be made smooth ;
text2: Yaranta amʉ ' ipe ' tɨpɨ ' tɨ ' , wʉ ' amʉ ' , i ' kʉrʉ amʉ ' inu ' tɨpɨ ' tɨ ' . Oipa ' nan asanta ton ikonepɨ ' tɨ ' to ' sa rɨ . Tarantaranpa ' nan asanta ton ikonepɨ ' tɨ ' ekayu pe ' ne .

text: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God .
text2: Tanporon kon uya , Papa uya tʉpika ' tɨsa ' kon , ento ' oton mɨrɨ , ’ ” tawon .

text: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him , O generation of vipers , who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come ?
text2: Isaan uya ta ' pʉ anpisin ton ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' tʉpa ' taisimato ' kon pe iya tʉpiya ' tʉuye ' san pɨ ' , “ Ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon ɨsɨ ton ɨkʉi munkɨ ton ! Ɨnʉ ' uya apana ' tɨsa ' kon ayainʉmʉ kon pa nʉye ' ai ' ne ' kota ' man nɨto ' piyapai ?

text: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance , and begin not to say within yourselves , We have Abraham to our father : for I say unto you , That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham .
text2: Epetatɨ ' ɨyera ' tɨsa ' kon amakooi kon apai ekamanin ke . Ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon pe rɨ , ‘ Epʉra ' an esi ina kʉipʉnʉ pe , ’ ta pɨ ' kepiya ' tɨtʉu . Apʉne pʉra apana ' tɨ uya ' nokon serɨ , serɨ ton tɨ ' apai Papa uya Epʉra ' an munkɨ oton kon koneka mɨrɨ .

text: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees : every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down , and cast into the fire .
text2: Wa ' ka man yʉi amʉ ' mi ' airɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporon yʉi amʉ ' tepetasen pen a ' tɨto ' oton nɨ mɨrɨ , mɨrɨpan eno ' ma apo ' ya ' , ” ta ' pʉ Isaan uya .

text: And the people asked him , saying , What shall we do then ?
text2: “ Ɨ ' rɨ ken si kupʉ ina uya , Papa uya tʉkota ' ma kon namai ' ? ” tukai ' anpisin ka ' pon amʉ ' uya ekama ' po ' pʉ .

text: He answereth and saith unto them , He that hath two coats , let him impart to him that hath none ; and he that hath meat , let him do likewise .
text2: Isaan uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ kʉrɨ asa ' rɨ na ' ne ' ipon uya , isakon tʉto ' pe iyesi ipon pʉn ena ' , kʉrɨ kanan ti ' kiyari ke na ' ne ' uya mɨrɨ rɨ marɨ ku ' to ' pe iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Then came also publicans to be baptized , and said unto him , Master , what shall we do ?
text2: Pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan nɨ kanan utɨ ' pʉ Isaan uya tʉpa ' taisimato ' kon pe . To ' uya ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ti ' sa , ɨ ' rɨ ken si kupʉ ina uya ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he said unto them , Exact no more than that which is appointed you .
text2: “ Mɨrɨ airɨ imo ' katɨ ' tasa ' na ' ne ' awɨrɨ rɨ , mʉmo ' katʉi ' itentai pen , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him , saying , And what shall we do ? And he said unto them , Do violence to no man , neither accuse any falsely ; and be content with your wages .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ soisa amʉ ' uya ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ kanan ken si kupʉ ina uya ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya . To ' eikʉ ' pʉ iya , “ Ka ' pon amʉ ' kʉsa ' kwarʉkatʉu to ' pʉrataai pɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ kasi pe rɨ to ' kʉseseru ' tɨtʉu . Mɨrɨ rɨ ɨpʉrataai kon mepoyatʉi ' ne ' pɨ ' rɨ pori ' pe e ' tɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And as the people were in expectation , and all men mused in their hearts of John , whether he were the Christ , or not ;
text2: Isaan uya i ' tu ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' enurikʉ Kʉrai enupɨkɨrɨ serɨ pe rɨ iyepʉ tukai ' . Ka ' pon amʉ ' usenuminka ' pʉ , “ Isaan pe ' esi Kʉrai pe ? ” tukai ' .

text: John answered , saying unto them all , I indeed baptize you with water ; but one mightier than I cometh , the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose : he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire :
text2: Isaan uya tanporo to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Apa ' taisima uya ' nokon serɨ tuna ke , e ' tane ka ' pon meruntɨ kuru uye ' to ' oton , isapatooi euka uya pokena ' pen nɨ . Apa ' taisima iya ' nokon mɨrɨ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ ke mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ apo ' ke .

text: Whose fan is in his hand , and he will throughly purge his floor , and will gather the wheat into his garner ; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable .
text2: Sara ' sara ' pan ti ' kiyari pi ' pɨ menkato ' iya ike esi itemiyatʉ yau i ' kwato ' tʉuya apon akorokato ' pe tʉuya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ta ' nasi , wi ' amʉranʉkʉ iya tiwʉ ' ta ' , e ' tane ipi ' pɨ rʉ ' pʉ po ' tɨ iya tʉusenkʉ ' sen pen apo ' ke , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people .
text2: Tu ' kan winɨ rɨ Isaan usi ' tu ' pʉ , wakʉ ekareei ekama pɨ ' to ' uya apurɨto ' pe .

text: But Herod the tetrarch , being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip ' s wife , and for all the evils which Herod had done ,
text2: E ' tane Isaan uya kopʉna Era ' esereme ' sa ' a ' tai , iyakon no ' pʉ Eratiyas wenai mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporon nɨ ɨri ton inkuu ' pʉ pɨ ' ,

text: Added yet this above all , that he shut up John in prison .
text2: tanporo serɨ ton pirikʉ ' pʉ Era ' uya : pariki ' si ta ' Isaan a ' kopɨtʉ ' pʉ iya .

text: Now when all the people were baptized , it came to pass , that Jesus also being baptized , and praying , the heaven was opened ,
text2: Tanporo ka ' pon amʉ ' epa ' taisimaka ' sa ' a ' tai , Sises rɨ nɨrɨ epa ' taisima ' pʉ . Iyɨpʉrema koro ' tau , ka ' uta ' koka ' pʉ

text: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him , and a voice came from heaven , which said , Thou art my beloved Son ; in thee I am well pleased .
text2: Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ u ' tɨ ' pʉ tʉpun ke ipona wako ' wa kasa . Main uyee ' pʉ Epʉn awonsi ' kɨ , “ Umu ɨmɨrɨ , uni ' nʉnkanʉ ; ɨpɨ ' pori ' pe e ' ai ' ipan pe , ” tawon .

text: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age , being ( as was supposed ) the son of Joseph , which was the son of Heli ,
text2: Sises e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ Papa uya tʉtʉrawasooi ' tɨ ' pʉ kupʉ pɨ ' , 30 e ' to ' airɨ rɨ iwʉipiyaai esii ' ma . Isose ' mumu tato ' ipɨ ' . Isose ' esi ' pʉ Irai mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi , which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Janna , which was the son of Joseph ,
text2: Irai esi ' pʉ Ma ' ta ' mu pe . Ma ' ta ' esi ' pʉ Ripai mu pe . Ripai esi ' pʉ Merʉkai mu pe . Merʉkai esi ' pʉ Isana mu pe . Isana esi ' pʉ Isose ' mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Amos , which was the son of Naum , which was the son of Esli , which was the son of Nagge ,
text2: Isose ' esi ' pʉ Ma ' ta ' tayas mu pe . Ma ' ta ' tayas esi ' pʉ Emos mu pe . Emos esi ' pʉ Ne ' an mu pe . Ne ' an esi ' pʉ E ' sʉrai mu pe . E ' sʉrai esi ' pʉ Nakei mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Maath , which was the son of Mattathias , which was the son of Semei , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Nakei esi ' pʉ Meya ' mu pe . Meya ' esi ' pʉ Ma ' ta ' tayas mu pe . Ma ' ta ' tayas esi ' pʉ Semeyai mu pe . Semeyai esi ' pʉ Isose ' mu pe . Isose ' esi ' pʉ Isuta mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Joanna , which was the son of Rhesa , which was the son of Zorobabel , which was the son of Salathiel , which was the son of Neri ,
text2: Isuta esi ' pʉ Isowanan mu pe . Isowanan esi ' pʉ Iri ' sa mu pe . Iri ' sa esi ' pʉ Userupaperʉ mu pe . Userupaperʉ esi ' pʉ Siya ' tiyerʉ mu pe . Siya ' tiyerʉ esi ' pʉ Nirai mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Melchi , which was the son of Addi , which was the son of Cosam , which was the son of Elmodam , which was the son of Er ,
text2: Nirai esi ' pʉ Merʉkai mu pe . Merʉkai esi ' pʉ Atai mu pe . Atai esi ' pʉ Kosan mu pe . Kosan esi ' pʉ Erʉmatan mu pe . Erʉmatan esi ' pʉ Ɨrʉ mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Jose , which was the son of Eliezer , which was the son of Jorim , which was the son of Matthat , which was the son of Levi ,
text2: Ɨrʉ esi ' pʉ Isa ' suwa mu pe . Isa ' suwa esi ' pʉ Eriyesa mu pe . Eriyesa esi ' pʉ Isorin mu pe . Isorin esi ' pʉ Ma ' ta ' mu pe . Ma ' ta ' esi ' pʉ Ripai mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Simeon , which was the son of Juda , which was the son of Joseph , which was the son of Jonan , which was the son of Eliakim ,
text2: Ripai esi ' pʉ Simiyan mu pe . Simiyan esi ' pʉ Isuta mu pe . Isuta esi ' pʉ Isose ' mu pe . Isose ' esi ' pʉ Isonan mu pe . Isonan esi ' pʉ Eraiya ' kin mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Melea , which was the son of Menan , which was the son of Mattatha , which was the son of Nathan , which was the son of David ,
text2: Eraiya ' kin esi ' pʉ Mireya mu pe . Mireya esi ' pʉ Mina mu pe . Mina esi ' pʉ Ma ' ta ' ta mu pe . Ma ' ta ' ta esi ' pʉ Ne ' tan mu pe . Ne ' tan esi ' pʉ Tepi ' mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Jesse , which was the son of Obed , which was the son of Booz , which was the son of Salmon , which was the son of Naasson ,
text2: Tepi ' esi ' pʉ Ise ' si mu pe . Ise ' si esi ' pʉ Ope ' mu pe . Ope ' esi ' pʉ Powas mu pe . Powas esi ' pʉ Sarʉman mu pe . Sarʉman esi ' pʉ Neyasan mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Aminadab , which was the son of Aram , which was the son of Esrom , which was the son of Phares , which was the son of Juda ,
text2: Neyasan esi ' pʉ Aminatapu mu pe . Aminatapu esi ' pʉ A ' min mu pe . A ' min esi ' pʉ Arʉni mu pe . Arʉni esi ' pʉ Esuran mu pe . Esuran esi ' pʉ Peres mu pe . Peres esi ' pʉ Isuta mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Jacob , which was the son of Isaac , which was the son of Abraham , which was the son of Thara , which was the son of Nachor ,
text2: Isuta esi ' pʉ Seko ' mu pe . Seko ' esi ' pʉ Aisi ' mu pe . Aisi ' esi ' pʉ Epʉra ' an mu pe . Epʉra ' an esi ' pʉ Tera mu pe . Tera esi ' pʉ Ne ' orʉ mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Saruch , which was the son of Ragau , which was the son of Phalec , which was the son of Heber , which was the son of Sala ,
text2: Ne ' orʉ esi ' pʉ Seru ' mu pe . Seru ' esi ' pʉ Reeu mu pe . Reeu esi ' pʉ Perekʉ mu pe . Perekʉ esi ' pʉ Ipɨrʉ mu pe . Ipɨrʉ esi ' pʉ Sera mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Cainan , which was the son of Arphaxad , which was the son of Sem , which was the son of Noe , which was the son of Lamech ,
text2: Sera esi ' pʉ Kenan mu pe . Kenan esi ' pʉ Arʉpa ' satʉ mu pe . Arʉpa ' satʉ esi ' pʉ Isen mu pe . Isen esi ' pʉ Nowa mu pe . Nowa esi ' pʉ Rame ' mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Mathusala , which was the son of Enoch , which was the son of Jared , which was the son of Maleleel , which was the son of Cainan ,
text2: Rame ' esi ' pʉ Me ' tusera mu pe . Me ' tusera esi ' pʉ Iino ' mu pe . Iino ' esi ' pʉ Isaretʉ mu pe . Isaretʉ esi ' pʉ Mararerʉ mu pe . Mararerʉ esi ' pʉ Kenan mu pe .

text: Which was the son of Enos , which was the son of Seth , which was the son of Adam , which was the son of God .
text2: Kenan esi ' pʉ Inos mu pe . Inos esi ' pʉ Se ' mu pe . Se ' esi ' pʉ Atan mu pe . Atan esi ' pʉ Papa mu pe .

text: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan , and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness ,
text2: Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ ke tʉutarʉ ' tɨi ' , Sises enna ' po ' pʉ Isotan apai , mɨrɨpan arɨ ' pʉ Iya ' kwarʉ uya rɨmono ' ta ' .

text: Being forty days tempted of the devil . And in those days he did eat nothing : and when they were ended , he afterward hungered .
text2: 40 kaisa rɨ wʉi Makoi uya i ' tupɨ ' to ' yau pe iyesi ' pʉ na ' ne ' . Iyenta ' na ' pʉ pen mɨrɨ ton wʉi a ' tai , mɨrɨpan iu ' matʉ a ' tai , iwan pe iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And the devil said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , command this stone that it be made bread .
text2: Makoi uya ta ' pʉ Sises pɨ ' , “ Papa Mumu pe ɨwesi yau , se tɨ ' pɨ ' pʉreti pe enakɨ ka ' kɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Jesus answered him , saying , It is written , That man shall not live by bread alone , but by every word of God .
text2: Sises uya eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Iye ' menukasa ' : ‘ Ka ' pon esi tʉuko ' mansen pʉreti pɨ ' rɨken pen , ’ tawon , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And the devil , taking him up into an high mountain , shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time .
text2: Makoi uya arɨ ' pʉ ka ' tawon wʉ ' pona . Mɨrɨpan uya inke pʉra tanporo eke ton pata enpoika ' pʉ itenu ya ' .

text: And the devil said unto him , All this power will I give thee , and the glory of them : for that is delivered unto me ; and to whomsoever I will I give it .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ Ɨrepa uya mɨrɨ tanporo to ' meruntɨrʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wakʉ pe to ' e ' to ' ke , apʉne pʉra urepa ' pʉ ike pe iyesi pɨ ' ; mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ɨnrepapai e ' to ' rɨ repa uya ike .

text: If thou therefore wilt worship me , all shall be thine .
text2: Mɨrɨ pɨ ' si , upɨ ' ɨwɨpʉremasa ' yau , tanporon nɨ esi ɨiwano ' pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Jesus answered and said unto him , Get thee behind me , Satan : for it is written , Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God , and him only shalt thou serve .
text2: Sises uya eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Iye ' menukasa ' : ‘ Itepuru , Papa , itese ' pɨ ' ɨwe ' to ' pɨ ' rɨken ɨpʉrema ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ kʉrɨ rɨ rɨken poitorʉ pe e ' kɨ , ’ tawon , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he brought him to Jerusalem , and set him on a pinnacle of the temple , and said unto him , If thou be the Son of God , cast thyself down from hence :
text2: Makoi uya arɨ ' pʉ Surusiran pona mɨrɨpan uya Papa ena ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' use ' mato ' , ɨpʉremato ' iwʉ ' ka ' tawon inakapu putu po iye ' mʉ ' sa ' kato ' pe ikupʉ ' pʉ . “ Papa Mumu pe ɨwesi yau , ata ' mo ' kakɨ serɨ awonsi ' kɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya ipɨ ' ,

text: For it is written , He shall give his angels charge over thee , to keep thee :
text2: “ apʉne pʉra iye ' menukasa ' : “ ‘ Tinserʉʉi apiyo ' ma iya ɨpɨ ' wakʉ pe to ' e ' to ' pe ɨyerasu pe .

text: And in their hands they shall bear thee up , lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone .
text2: Temiyatʉ kon yau to ' uya ayanʉmʉ , tɨ ' pona a ' ta wɨnɨ auya namai ' , ’ tukai ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , It is said , Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God .
text2: Sises uya eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Tasa ' iya : ‘ Itepuru , Papa , itese ' pɨ ' ɨwe ' to ' kʉsi ' tupɨtʉi , ’ tawon , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when the devil had ended all the temptation , he departed from him for a season .
text2: Tanporo si i ' tupɨtʉ u ' ma ' sa ' a ' tai , Makoi uya inɨmɨ ' pʉ tʉron nɨ a ' taino pe .

text: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee : and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about .
text2: Sises enna ' po ' pʉ Kiyarari pona Iya ' kwarʉ meruntɨrʉ yau , mɨrɨpan ekareei utɨ ' pʉ mɨ awɨrɨ rɨ tanporo pata poro .

text: And he taught in their synagogues , being glorified of all .
text2: To ' enupa ' pʉ iya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ton tau . Tanporon kon uya apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: And he came to Nazareth , where he had been brought up : and , as his custom was , he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day , and stood up for to read .
text2: Itɨ ' pʉ Nasare ' pata pona , tʉusemo ' ka ' pʉ ya ' . Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' , te ' pɨ ' to ' kasa rɨ Sapa ' a ' tai . Mɨrɨpan e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ Papa Maimu ekamai ' .

text: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias . And when he had opened the book , he found the place where it was written ,
text2: Pu ' kena ' Aisaya nʉmenuka ' pʉ kareta amon tʉrʉ ' pʉ itena ' . Ara ' ka ' pʉ iya se tawon e ' menukasa ' airɨ :

text: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me , because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor ; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted , to preach deliverance to the captives , and recovering of sight to the blind , to set at liberty them that are bruised ,
text2: “ Papa A ' kwarʉ man uyau . Papa uya uyanʉnsa ' wakʉ ekareei ekamato ' pe uya entu ' manin nan ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' . Uyenno ' sa ' iya serɨ ekamase ' na a ' sisa ' kon ponaro ' pe . Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tenku ' na ' nan e ' to ' pe ennin pe . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , kamoro ɨri pe to ' nʉkupʉnʉ ton pika ' tɨnin pe .

text: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord .
text2: Uyenno ' sa ' iya ka ' pon amʉ ' pika ' tɨto ' tʉuya weyu ekamase ' na , ” tawon .

text: And he closed the book , and he gave it again to the minister , and sat down . And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him .
text2: Te ' nonkasa ' a ' tai , tʉkaretaai e ' mepɨtʉ ' pʉ iya . Mɨrɨpan na ' po ' pʉ iya itʉrawasomanin ena ' . Mɨrɨ tʉpo iyereuta ' pʉ to ' enupase ' na . Tanporon kon esi ' pʉ enpɨtʉ pɨ ' .

text: And he began to say unto them , This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Serɨ pe metatʉune ' uta ' ku ' tɨsa ' si man , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And all bare him witness , and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth . And they said , Is not this Joseph ' s son ?
text2: Tanporo etanin nʉ ' san usaurokʉ ' pʉ wakʉ pe ipɨ ' . Mɨrɨpan to ' usewansiuka ' pʉ wakʉ imaimu pɨ ' . “ Isose ' mu pen pe ' pʉse rɨ ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he said unto them , Ye will surely say unto me this proverb , Physician , heal thyself : whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum , do also here in thy country .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Serɨ pu ' kena ' ton maimu enpoika auya ' nokon upɨ ' tukai ' si ' tui , ‘ Ta ' ta , ɨiwano ' pe ɨsepi ' tɨ ' . ’ Mɨrɨ a ' tai si , ta auya ' nokon upɨ ' , ‘ Apʉne ken si , ina neta ' pʉ Ka ' paneyan po ɨnkuu ' pʉ , iku ' kɨ serɨ apata yau , ’ ta auya ' nokon , si ' tui . ”

text: And he said , Verily I say unto you , No prophet is accepted in his own country .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ , “ I ' napairon ekama uya ɨpɨ ' nokon , ipata ' se ' yau , pu ' kena ' nama pʉra iyesi .

text: But I tell you of a truth , many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias , when the heaven was shut up three years and six months , when great famine was throughout all the land ;
text2: Pu ' kena ' Iraisa esi a ' tai , tu ' kan kon itaan ' pʉ ima ' tasa ' rʉ ' san esi ' pʉ Esuwerʉ po . Mɨrɨ a ' tai si , ipʉra non aipʉta ' pʉ osorʉwau wʉipiya entai rɨ . Iwankan pe pata tʉku ' se iyesi ' pʉ .

text: But unto none of them was Elias sent , save unto Sarepta , a city of Sidon , unto a woman that was a widow .
text2: Papa uya Iraisa ennoko pʉra iyesi ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' piya ' , e ' tane ennoko ' pʉ iya Sera ' pa ' pon itaan ' pʉ ima ' tasa ' rʉ ' pʉ piya ' , Saitan nono pona .

text: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet ; and none of them was cleansed , saving Naaman the Syrian .
text2: Pu ' kena ' Irai ' sa esi a ' tai , Esuwerʉ po tu ' ke rɨ erekʉ ' pa ' nan esi ' pʉ . E ' tane rɨ , tikin nan nɨ epi ' tɨsa ' iya pʉra iyesi . Neman nɨken epi ' tɨ ' pʉ iya , Siriya pon , Esuwerʉ pon pen , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And all they in the synagogue , when they heard these things , were filled with wrath ,
text2: To ' uya imaimu etasa ' a ' tai , tanporo Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tau te ' san usakorota ' pʉ ipan pe .

text: And rose up , and thrust him out of the city , and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built , that they might cast him down headlong .
text2: To ' e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan enpa ' ka ' pʉ to ' uya pata apai . To ' uya arɨ ' pʉ wʉ ' e ' pi pona , Nasare ' apon pona eno ' mase ' na soronpan yawɨrɨ ,

text: But he passing through the midst of them went his way ,
text2: e ' tane iyera ' tɨ ' pʉ to ' piyapai , mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ .

text: And came down to Capernaum , a city of Galilee , and taught them on the sabbath days .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai iu ' tɨ ' pʉ Ka ' paneyan pona , Kiyarari yau te ' sen pata pona . Mɨrɨpan Sapa ' a ' tai ka ' pon amʉ ' enupa pɨ ' iyepiya ' tɨ ' pʉ .

text: And they were astonished at his doctrine : for his word was with power .
text2: To ' usewansiuka ' pʉ enupan nɨto ' iya pɨ ' , apʉne pʉra meruntɨ pe inekamanʉ esi pɨ ' .

text: And in the synagogue there was a man , which had a spirit of an unclean devil , and cried out with a loud voice ,
text2: Moro warawo ' esi ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tau , makoi a ' kwarʉ yen . Eke pe ikɨ ' pɨ ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ ,

text: Saying , Let us alone ; what have we to do with thee , thou Jesus of Nazareth ? art thou come to destroy us ? I know thee who thou art ; the Holy One of God .
text2: “ Ɨɨɨɨ ! Sises , Nasare ' pon , ɨ ' rɨ pe ina ku ' se ' na ɨuye ' sa ' ? Ina ma ' tanʉ ' se ' na pe ' ɨuye ' sa ' ? Kɨnyi ' tuyai ' ɨmɨrɨ kʉrɨ rɨ — Wakʉ Ye ' Papa iwano ' ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hold thy peace , and come out of him . And when the devil had thrown him in the midst , he came out of him , and hurt him not .
text2: “ E ' pana e ' kɨ ! Epa ' kakɨ iyapai ! ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya e ' se ' ne ' pe ipɨ ' . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , makoi a ' kwarʉ uya warawo ' eno ' ma ' pʉ tu ' kan kon koro ' tau . Iyepa ' ka ' pʉ iyapai e ' ne ' pe pʉra rɨ tʉku ' se .

text: And they were all amazed , and spake among themselves , saying , What a word is this ! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits , and they come out .
text2: Tanporo ka ' pon amʉ ' usewansiuka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon usekama ' popɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ si serɨ usenupan nɨto ' ? Pana ' pan , meruntɨ ke makoi a ' kwarʉ apiyo ' ma iya , mɨrɨpan kon epa ' ka ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about .
text2: Mɨrɨpan ekareei utɨ ' pʉ siya rɨ mɨrɨ awɨro ' nan awɨrɨ .

text: And he arose out of the synagogue , and entered into Simon ' s house . And Simon ' s wife ' s mother was taken with a great fever ; and they besought him for her .
text2: Sises utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' apai Saiman pata ' se ' ya ' . Saiman ewo ' pʉ esi ' pʉ ipan pe e ' kɨɨi ' man pɨ ' . Mɨrɨpan Sises ekama ' po ' pʉ to ' uya epi ' tɨto ' pe iya .

text: And he stood over her , and rebuked the fever ; and it left her : and immediately she arose and ministered unto them .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sises e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ ite ' kwe ' piyau . Mɨrɨpan uya pana ' pe ikɨɨi ' manin pɨ ' , “ Ereuta ' ! ” ta ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , iyereuta ' pʉ . Inke pʉra rɨ iye ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ to ' mʉta ' napai ' .

text: Now when the sun was setting , all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him ; and he laid his hands on every one of them , and healed them .
text2: Pata uko ' mansa ' a ' tai , ka ' pon amʉ ' uya takuru ' kena ' nan nee ' pʉ Sises piya ' . Mɨrɨpan uya temiyatʉ ke to ' a ' pɨ ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' kaisa rɨ ' ne , to ' epi ' tɨ ' pʉ iya .

text: And devils also came out of many , crying out , and saying , Thou art Christ the Son of God . And he rebuking them suffered them not to speak : for they knew that he was Christ .
text2: Mɨrɨ enta ' rɨ , makoi a ' kwarʉ ton epa ' kapɨtʉ ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' apai . Makoi a ' kwarʉ yen ton ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Papa Mumu Ɨmɨrɨ ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya . E ' se ' ne ' pe to ' eseremekʉ ' pʉ iya , to ' usaurokʉ namai ' . To ' e ' paka ' nʉkʉ ' pʉ iya , apʉne pʉra Kʉrai pe ti ' tu to ' uya wenai .

text: And when it was day , he departed and went into a desert place : and the people sought him , and came unto him , and stayed him , that he should not depart from them .
text2: Pata ema ' tane , Sises utɨ ' pʉ tʉ ' kenan pata ya ' . Ka ' pon amʉ ' esi ' pʉ iwarinpa pɨ ' . Mɨrɨpan eposa ' tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , ereutanʉkʉ i ' se to ' esi ' pʉ , itɨ namai ' .

text: And he said unto them , I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also : for therefore am I sent .
text2: E ' tane , “ Wakʉ Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ ekareei ekamato ' uya esi tʉron nɨ ton pata yau ' ne rɨ marɨ , apʉne pʉra mɨrɨto ' pe uyenno ' sa ' pe iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee .
text2: Mɨrɨpan esi ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ton Isutiya pon tau ' ne itekare ekama pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And it came to pass , that , as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God , he stood by the lake of Gennesaret ,
text2: Tʉron nɨ a ' tai , Sises e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' esi ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri Isenesere ' e ' pi po . Ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉrasa ' esi ' pʉ a ' ko pe iwoi , Papa Maimu ekama iya etase ' na .

text: And saw two ships standing by the lake : but the fishermen were gone out of them , and were washing their nets .
text2: Parau ku ' pɨri e ' pi po , asa ' rɨ kanau ene ' pʉ iya , moro ' a ' sinin nan kanwa ' pʉ . Moro ' a ' sinin nʉ ' san uya tʉpunwerʉ kon korʉkapɨtʉ esi ' pʉ .

text: And he entered into one of the ships , which was Simon ' s , and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land . And he sat down , and taught the people out of the ship .
text2: Sises ekanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ Saiman kanwa ya ' . Mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ Saiman pɨ ' , “ Akanwa a ' tu ' makɨ parau ku ' pɨri e ' pi apai , ” ta ' pʉ iya . Mɨrɨ apai , a ' mun po te ' san enupa ' pʉ iya .

text: Now when he had left speaking , he said unto Simon , Launch out into the deep , and let down your nets for a draught .
text2: Sises e ' nonkasa ' a ' tai ka ' pon amʉ ' enupa tʉpo , ta ' pʉ iya Saiman pɨ ' , “ Miyarɨ parɨ kanau akɨ i ' nawon ya ' parɨ . Mɨrɨpan ɨpunwerʉ kon eno ' ma kon pa tuna ka ' moro ' amʉ ' a ' si kon pa , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Simon answering said unto him , Master , we have toiled all the night , and have taken nothing : nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net .
text2: Mɨrɨpan e ' tane , Saiman uya ta ' pʉ Sises pɨ ' , “ Uyepuru , ewarupɨ nau ina rɨ nʉsi ' tui to ' a ' si i ' se ipan pe , e ' tane ina uya to ' a ' si pʉn nɨ . E ' tane pʉra , tʉpunwerʉ kon tʉrʉ ina uya , amaimu awɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when they had this done , they inclosed a great multitude of fishes : and their net brake .
text2: To ' uya si itʉrʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya tu ' ke rɨ moro ' amʉ ' a ' si ' pʉ to ' punwerʉ ekaraka poken nɨ .

text: And they beckoned unto their partners , which were in the other ship , that they should come and help them . And they came , and filled both the ships , so that they began to sink .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon uya tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' tʉron nɨ kanau yawon kon kɨ ' ma ' pʉ tʉpika ' tɨnin kon pe . Mɨrɨpan kon uyee ' pʉ , to ' uya si asa ' rɨ rɨ marɨ tʉkanwa kon pe ' tɨ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan kon kanwa e ' sʉnkaiwa ' pʉ rɨ .

text: When Simon Peter saw it , he fell down at Jesus ' knees , saying , Depart from me ; for I am a sinful man , O Lord .
text2: Saiman Pi ' ta uya se e ' kupʉ to ' ka ' nʉ ' sa ' a ' tai , iye ' sekunka ' pʉ Sises enupɨkɨrɨ . “ Enta upiyapai . Ɨpiyau esi poken pʉra man , apʉne pʉra tʉmakooi ke esi pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ Saiman uya ipɨ ' ,

text: For he was astonished , and all that were with him , at the draught of the fishes which they had taken :
text2: apʉne pʉra tʉtonpa ton amʉ ' pokon pe tʉusewansiukasa ' kon pɨ ' tʉna ' si ' san kon moro ' amʉ ' tense .

text: And so was also James , and John , the sons of Zebedee , which were partners with Simon . And Jesus said unto Simon , Fear not ; from henceforth thou shalt catch men .
text2: Sepiti munkɨ amʉ ' , Isens , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isaan , usewansiuka ' pʉ nɨrɨ , Saiman tonpa pe te ' san . Sises uya ta ' pʉ Saiman pɨ ' , “ Kenari ' nʉmʉi , serɨ si ' kɨrɨpai ka ' pon amʉ ' nin si a ' sinin pe ɨwesi mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when they had brought their ships to land , they forsook all , and followed him .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon uya tʉkanwa kon amʉ ' pi ' si ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ parau ku ' pɨri e ' pi pona . Tanporon nɨ tʉnɨnse to ' utɨ ' pʉ ipɨkɨrɨ .

text: And it came to pass , when he was in a certain city , behold a man full of leprosy : who seeing Jesus fell on his face , and besought him , saying , Lord , if thou wilt , thou canst make me clean .
text2: Pata ton tonpa yau , Sises esi koro ' tau , erekʉ ' pan ka ' pon uyee ' pʉ ipiya ' . Sises ensa ' tʉuya a ' tai , ita ' mo ' ka ' pʉ non pona itemʉ ' eta ' kwanʉnse ipɨ ' , “ Uyepuru , ɨnku ' pai ɨwesi yau , wakʉ pe ukupʉ auya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he put forth his hand , and touched him , saying , I will : be thou clean . And immediately the leprosy departed from him .
text2: Sises uya temiyatʉ ɨnka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya a ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Ɨnku ' pai rɨ e ' ai ' . Wakʉ pe e ' kɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya . Inke pʉra rɨ , iterekʉ usepi ' tɨ ' pʉ .

text: And he charged him to tell no man : but go , and shew thyself to the priest , and offer for thy cleansing , according as Moses commanded , for a testimony unto them .
text2: Sises uya ta ' pʉ , “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ kʉ ' pana ' tɨi , e ' tane enta ɨsenpoikata Papa ena ' use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin ena ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨuse ' mato ' pe te ' sen , Mosi ' uya tasa ' na ' ne ' awɨrɨ mʉtʉrʉi ' , ɨyekorʉkasa ' pɨ ' , ekamanin pe to ' pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him : and great multitudes came together to hear , and to be healed by him of their infirmities .
text2: Mɨrɨpan e ' tane , itekareei useta ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ wenai , tu ' kan kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ etase ' na mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨsepi ' tɨpɨ ' se ' na teparan kon apai .

text: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness , and prayed .
text2: E ' tane Sises utɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ ɨpʉremase ' na tʉ ' kenan ya ' .

text: And it came to pass on a certain day , as he was teaching , that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by , which were come out of every town of Galilee , and Judaea , and Jerusalem : and the power of the Lord was present to heal them .
text2: Tʉron nɨ a ' tai , ka ' pon amʉ ' enupa pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ . Pari ' si amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan iye ' pɨ ' sa ' kon tanporon nɨ eke iwa pata ton Kiyarari po ' nan apai , Isutiya , Surusiran winɨ ' ne rɨ ereutasa ' esi ' pʉ . Papa uya imeruntɨrʉ ke irepasa ' esi ' pʉ e ' ne ' ton epi ' tɨnin pe .

text: And , behold , men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy : and they sought means to bring him in , and to lay him before him .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ , ite ' kwe ' po ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' ka ' pon nee ' pʉ to ' uya . To ' usi ' tu ' pʉ inepʉ i ' se Sises piya ' , epi ' tɨto ' pe iya .

text: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude , they went upon the housetop , and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus .
text2: Apʉne pʉra anpisin pe ka ' pon amʉ ' esi pɨ ' ikupʉ tʉuya ' nokon pʉra iyesi i ' tusa ' tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , to ' ekainʉmʉ ' pʉ ɨutɨ nakapu pona . Mɨrɨpan kon uya inɨpon mo ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' uya inu ' tɨ ' pʉ iteuta yai , anpisin ton aporo ' pona , Sises poi rɨ .

text: And when he saw their faith , he said unto him , Man , thy sins are forgiven thee .
text2: Sises uya tʉtonpa kon epi ' tɨ tʉuya tukai ' apurɨto ' to ' uya ensa ' a ' tai , “ Utonpa , amakooi pɨ ' usentu ' mayai ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' pɨ ' .

text: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason , saying , Who is this which speaketh blasphemies ? Who can forgive sins , but God alone ?
text2: Pari ' si amʉ ' , Main pɨ ' enupanin nan nɨrɨ , usenuminka ' pʉ tiwano ' kon pe , “ Ɨnʉ ' pʉse rɨ ka ' pon Papa sapema pe rɨ tʉusauro ' sen ? Papa rɨken Kʉrɨ rɨ makoi pɨ ' tʉusentu ' masen ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts , he answering said unto them , What reason ye in your hearts ?
text2: Sises uya to ' usenuminkato ' i ' tu ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan uya , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' se ton pɨ ' ɨusenuminka kon ? Serɨ kasa ɨusenuminka kon poken pʉra man .

text: Whether is easier , to say , Thy sins be forgiven thee ; or to say , Rise up and walk ?
text2: Nai esi sa ' man pe pʉra iwa : ‘ Amakooi pɨ ' usentu ' ma , ’ ta ; mɨrɨ pe pʉra , ‘ E ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' , asakɨ , ’ ta katɨ ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' pɨ ' ?

text: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins , ( he said unto the sick of the palsy , ) I say unto thee , Arise , and take up thy couch , and go into thine house .
text2: Ka ' pon , Papa winon uya enpoikato ' pe iyesi ipiyau meruntɨ esi serɨ non po makoi ton pɨ ' tʉusentu ' masen pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya , Pari ' si amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan pɨ ' nɨrɨ . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , ta ' pʉ iya ipu ' tɨka ' sa ' pɨ ' , “ E ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' , ɨye ' kwe ' anʉnkɨ , enna ' po ' apata ' se ' ya ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And immediately he rose up before them , and took up that whereon he lay , and departed to his own house , glorifying God .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , iye ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ .

text: And they were all amazed , and they glorified God , and were filled with fear , saying , We have seen strange things to day .
text2: Tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' usewansiuka ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan kon uya Papa apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ . To ' enari ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ , “ Serɨ pe , eke Papa tʉrawasooi e ' kupʉ ensa ' man , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And after these things he went forth , and saw a publican , named Levi , sitting at the receipt of custom : and he said unto him , Follow me .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Sises utɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin kopʉna iwano ' pe ene ' pʉ , Ripai itese ' . Iyereutasa ' esi ' pʉ pʉrata amʉranʉ ' to ' iwʉ ' tau . “ Uya ' kɨrɨ utɨnpai , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya ipɨ ' .

text: And he left all , rose up , and followed him .
text2: Ripai e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , tanporon nɨ nɨmɨ ' pʉ iya , iya ' kɨrɨ itɨ ' pʉ .

text: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house : and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Ripai uya eke enta ' nan kupʉ ' pʉ Sises iwano ' pe tiwʉ ' tau . Anpisin pe pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan , tʉron kon nɨ nɨrɨ esi ' pʉ enta ' nan pɨ ' to ' pokon pe .

text: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples , saying , Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners ?
text2: E ' tane Pari ' si amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan uya ta ' pʉ Sises poitorʉ ton pɨ ' , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' ɨyenta ' na kon pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan kopʉna iwano ' pe pokon pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉmakooikena ' nan pokon pe ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , They that are whole need not a physician ; but they that are sick .
text2: Sises uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Atu ' pe te ' san esi ta ' ta i ' se pʉra . Takuru ' kena ' nan nɨken esi tepi ' tɨnin kon i ' se .

text: I came not to call the righteous , but sinners to repentance .
text2: Ipokena ' ton kɨ ' mai ' uye ' sa ' pen , e ' tane tʉmakooikena ' nan era ' tɨto ' pe tʉmakooi kon apai , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they said unto him , Why do the disciples of John fast often , and make prayers , and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees ; but thine eat and drink ?
text2: Ta ' pʉ to ' uya ipɨ ' , “ Isaan poitorʉ ton useruma tenta ' nai ' pʉra , to ' ɨpʉrema nɨrɨ ɨsipɨkɨrɨ , mɨrɨ kasa rɨ Pari ' si amʉ ' poitorʉ ton . E ' tane , ɨpoitorʉ ton enta ' na , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he said unto them , Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast , while the bridegroom is with them ?
text2: Sises uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Ka ' pon emari ' ma piyau te ' san , useruma pʉra iyesi tenta ' nai ' pʉra , to ' piyau iyesi koro ' tau .

text: But the days will come , when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them , and then shall they fast in those days .
text2: E ' tane iweyu uye ' to ' oton temari ' masen kasa te ' sen anʉnto ' oton ipoitorʉ ton piyapai ; mɨrɨ a ' tai to ' userumato ' oton tenta ' nai ' pʉra , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he spake also a parable unto them ; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old ; if otherwise , then both the new maketh a rent , and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old .
text2: Tʉron nɨ panton ekama ' pʉ iya to ' enupa pe , penaro ' pokon pe emenna ' pe to ' enupato ' tʉuya utoi ' ma namai ' , “ Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ emenna ' pe te ' sen pon apai takʉ ' se pon pooi ' pɨ a ' si ' tɨ pʉra iyesi . Ikupʉ iya pe iyesi yau , emenna ' pon a ' si ' sa ' usene ɨri pe ipooi ' pɨ pɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ emenna ' pon ma ' tanʉ ' sa ' iya pe iyesi .

text: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles ; else the new wine will burst the bottles , and be spilled , and the bottles shall perish .
text2: Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ emenna ' waain amuku pʉra iyesi penaro ' itenpʉ ' pʉ ya ' . Ikupʉ iya yau , ten i ' moi iya . Iye ' kwamʉ , iten nɨ si uma ' ta .

text: But new wine must be put into new bottles ; and both are preserved .
text2: Emenna ' waain amu ' to ' pe iyesi emenna ' iten ya ' .

text: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new : for he saith , The old is better .
text2: Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ penaro ' ensi tʉpo emenna ' waain ensi pʉra iyesi , ‘ Penaro ' esi wakʉ pe kuru upona , ’ ta iya , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya .

text: And it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first , that he went through the corn fields ; and his disciples plucked the ears of corn , and did eat , rubbing them in their hands .
text2: Tʉron nɨ Sapa ' a ' tai , Sises utɨ ' pʉ a ' nai ' e ' kwa nawɨrɨ . Ipoitorʉ ton e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ iye ' suruupɨ ' sa ' i ' kwɨ ' pɨtʉ pɨ ' . To ' uya isoko ' soko ' ma ' pʉ temiya kon yau , mɨrɨpan kon uya ɨku ' pʉ .

text: And certain of the Pharisees said unto them , Why do ye that which is not lawful to do on the sabbath days ?
text2: Serɨ ensa ' tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , Pari ' si amʉ ' uya Sises ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' Main uya tʉku ' sen pen nɨ Sapa ' a ' tai tasa ' rʉ ' pʉ kupʉ auya ' nokon Sapa ' a ' tai ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And Jesus answering them said , Have ye not read so much as this , what David did , when himself was an hungred , and they which were with him ;
text2: Sises uya to ' eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Kin Tepi ' nʉkupʉ ' pʉ pe ' etasa ' auya ' nokon pʉra nai ? Tʉpoitorʉ ton pokon pe iwan pe tesi kon a ' tai ,

text: How he went into the house of God , and did take and eat the shewbread , and gave also to them that were with him ; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone ?
text2: Esuwerʉ amʉ ' use ' mato ' , ɨpʉremato ' iwʉ ' ta ' iyewomʉ ' pʉ , ipʉremasa ' pʉreti tʉyu oton tepose iyenta ' na ' pʉ , Main uya Papa ena ' use ' man nɨto ' tʉrawasomanin nan yu pe rɨken te ' sen tasa ' ɨku ' pʉ iya , e ' tane rɨ mɨrɨ uya imakoima ' pʉ pen . Tʉtonpa ton nɨrɨ repa ' pʉ iya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said unto them , That the Son of man is Lord also of the sabbath .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Ka ' pon , Papa winon esi Sapa ' Epuru pe rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And it came to pass also on another sabbath , that he entered into the synagogue and taught : and there was a man whose right hand was withered .
text2: Tʉron nɨ kanan Sapa ' a ' tai , itɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' to ' enupase ' na . Mɨrɨ yau , ka ' pon esi ' pʉ enwo ' ne ' itemiyatʉ yaipʉtasa ' amʉrasa ' .

text: And the scribes and Pharisees watched him , whether he would heal on the sabbath day ; that they might find an accusation against him .
text2: Pari ' si amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan esi ' pʉ Sises enpɨtʉ pɨ ' eseru ' tɨto ' pe tʉuya ' nokon . A ' ko pe enpɨtʉ pɨ ' to ' esi ' pʉ Sapa ' a ' tai ka ' pon epi ' tɨ iya ene i ' se .

text: But he knew their thoughts , and said to the man which had the withered hand , Rise up , and stand forth in the midst . And he arose and stood forth .
text2: E ' tane Sises uya to ' usenuminkato ' i ' tu ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ itemiyatʉ yaipʉtasa ' amʉrasa ' pɨ ' , “ E ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' tanporon kon rau , ” ta ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' e ' soto ' ka ' pʉ to ' rau .

text: Then said Jesus unto them , I will ask you one thing ; Is it lawful on the sabbath days to do good , or to do evil ? to save life , or to destroy it ?
text2: Mɨrɨpan a ' tai Sises uya ta ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨyekama ' po uya ' nokon . Nai esi Main awɨrɨ Sapa ' a ' tai tʉku ' sen pe : Wakʉ kupʉ mɨrɨ pe pʉra ɨri kupʉ katɨ ? Ka ' pon pika ' tɨ , ima ' tanʉkʉ katɨ ? ”

text: And looking round about upon them all , he said unto the man , Stretch forth thy hand . And he did so : and his hand was restored whole as the other .
text2: Tanporo to ' ene ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan uya ta ' pʉ warawo ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨyemiyatʉ ɨnka ' ! ” Ikupʉ ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan emiyatʉ enna ' po ' pʉ tesi ' pʉ ya ' .

text: And they were filled with madness ; and communed one with another what they might do to Jesus .
text2: E ' tane , ipan pe Pari ' si amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan usakorota ' pʉ . “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iku ' pai nai ? ” tukai ' to ' usaurokʉ ' pʉ .

text: And it came to pass in those days , that he went out into a mountain to pray , and continued all night in prayer to God .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai ' ne , Sises utɨ ' pʉ wʉ ' poi rɨ ɨpʉremai ' , ewarupɨ nau ɨpʉreman pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ Papa pɨ ' pata tema ' kwai ' .

text: And when it was day , he called unto him his disciples : and of them he chose twelve , whom also he named apostles ;
text2: Pata ema ' sa ' a ' tai , tʉpoitorʉ ton kɨ ' ma ' pʉ iya . 12 kaisa rɨ to ' anʉmʉ ' pʉ iya , itekare ekamai ' enno ' sa ' kon pe to ' koneka ' pʉ iya .

text: Simon , ( whom he also named Peter , ) and Andrew his brother , James and John , Philip and Bartholomew ,
text2: To ' ese ' esi ' pʉ : Saiman ( Pi ' ta tukai ' inese ' tɨ ' pʉ ) , iyakon Anturu , Isens , Isaan , Piri ' , Pa ' taramiu ,

text: Matthew and Thomas , James the son of Alphaeus , and Simon called Zelotes ,
text2: Ma ' siu , Tamas , Isens ( Arʉ ' piyas mumu ) , Saiman ( Usera ' tukai ' tesa ' sen ) ,

text: And Judas the brother of James , and Judas Iscariot , which also was the traitor .
text2: Isutas ( Isens mu ) , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isutas Eskariya ' , eparankanin pe iyena ' pʉ na ' ne ' .

text: And he came down with them , and stood in the plain , and the company of his disciples , and a great multitude of people out of all Judaea and Jerusalem , and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon , which came to hear him , and to be healed of their diseases ;
text2: To ' a ' kɨrɨ iu ' tɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan e ' soto ' ka ' pʉ rɨmon po . Tu ' ke rɨ anpisin pe ipoitorʉ ton esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ yau mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tu ' ke rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' Isutiya , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Surusiran winon kon uye ' sa ' esi ' pʉ . Tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ parau e ' pi Taya , Saitan winon kon .

text: And they that were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed .
text2: To ' uyee ' pʉ etase ' na , ɨsepi ' tɨse ' na teparan kon apai ' ne . Makoi a ' kwarʉ yen pe te ' san usepi ' tɨ ' pʉ .

text: And the whole multitude sought to touch him : for there went virtue out of him , and healed them all .
text2: Tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' usi ' tu ' pʉ a ' pɨtʉ i ' se , apʉne pʉra meruntɨ epa ' ka pɨ ' piyapai , mɨrɨpan uya tanporo to ' epi ' tɨpɨtʉ pɨ ' .

text: And he lifted up his eyes on his disciples , and said , Blessed be ye poor : for yours is the kingdom of God .
text2: Tʉpoitorʉ ton enei ' ma ta ' pʉ iya , “ Pori ' pe ɨwesi kon , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon entu ' ma ' na ' ne ' nan , apʉne pʉra Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe esi pɨ ' ɨiwano ' kon pe .

text: Blessed are ye that hunger now : for ye shall be filled . Blessed are ye that weep now : for ye shall laugh .
text2: Pori ' pe ɨwesi kon , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon serɨ pe iwan pe na ' ne ' nan , apʉne pʉra aya ' wetato ' oton kon . Pori ' pe ɨwesi kon , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon serɨ pe nʉkaranyai ' ne ' nan , apʉne pʉra auta ' kɨrɨto ' oton kon .

text: Blessed are ye , when men shall hate you , and when they shall separate you from their company , and shall reproach you , and cast out your name as evil , for the Son of man ' s sake .
text2: “ Pori ' pe ɨwesi kon , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon ka ' pon amʉ ' newaruma ' tɨnʉ ton , tʉpokon pe ɨwesi kon i ' se pʉra to ' esi a ' tai , asapema kon a ' tai , ɨyese ' kon eno ' ma a ' tai ɨri tukai ' , Ka ' pon , Papa winon uriya ' .

text: Rejoice ye in that day , and leap for joy : for , behold , your reward is great in heaven : for in the like manner did their fathers unto the prophets .
text2: Ipan pe mepori ' matʉi ' , pori ' pe ɨwesi kon pɨ ' me ' sanʉnpɨ ' tʉi ' mɨrɨ wʉi a ' tai , apʉne pʉra eke rɨ ɨyepe ' pʉ kon esi pɨ ' Epʉn po . Apʉne pʉra mɨrɨ kasa rɨ to ' kʉipʉnʉ ton uya pu ' kena ' ton ku ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: But woe unto you that are rich ! for ye have received your consolation .
text2: “ E ' tane ɨsɨ yau me ' atʉi ' ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon ipʉrataaikena ' ton , apʉne pʉra wakʉ epoka ' sa ' auya ' nokon pɨ ' .

text: Woe unto you that are full ! for ye shall hunger . Woe unto you that laugh now ! for ye shall mourn and weep .
text2: Ɨsɨ yau me ' atʉi ' , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon tʉuta ' re ' tɨsan , apʉne pʉra iwan pe ɨwe ' to ' oton kon . Ɨsɨ yau me ' atʉi ' , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon tʉuta ' kɨrɨsan , apʉne pʉra tʉuta ' kwarʉkai ' aukaranto ' oton kon .

text: Woe unto you , when all men shall speak well of you ! for so did their fathers to the false prophets .
text2: “ Ɨsɨ yau me ' atʉi ' , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon wakʉ pe ka ' pon amʉ ' usaurokʉ a ' tai ɨpɨ ' nokon , mɨrɨ na ' ne ' kasa to ' tɨpiya ton uya ennakanin nan pu ' kena ' amʉ ' ku ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨ .

text: But I say unto you which hear , Love your enemies , do good to them which hate you ,
text2: “ E ' tane ekama uya ɨpɨ ' nokon uyetayatʉi ' ne ' nan : ɨyeyaton kon i ' nʉnkatɨ ' , ɨyewaruma ' tɨnin kon pɨ ' wakʉ iku ' tɨ ' .

text: Bless them that curse you , and pray for them which despitefully use you .
text2: Kamo apa ' nʉ ' nin nan kon pona ɨpʉrematɨ ' , ɨri pe ɨku ' nin nan kon pona ɨpʉrematɨ ' .

text: And unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the other ; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not to take thy coat also .
text2: Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ ɨwɨnɨ yau ɨye ' peta pɨ ' , iratoi rʉ ' pʉ rɨ marɨ ira ' tɨkɨ iwinɨkʉi ' . Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ ɨpon kon pʉro ' pon anʉmʉ pe iyesi yau , kʉsereutanʉ ' tʉu iyo ' non ɨpon anʉntane iya .

text: Give to every man that asketh of thee ; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask them not again .
text2: Tanporon kon ɨyekama ' poyai ' ne ' nokon irepatɨ ' , ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ ɨiwano ' kon anʉmʉ yau , inna ' pokɨ kʉkatʉu .

text: And as ye would that men should do to you , do ye also to them likewise .
text2: Iku ' tɨ ' tʉron kon pɨ ' , ikupʉ to ' uya i ' se me ' atʉi ' ne ' kasa ɨpɨ ' nokon .

text: For if ye love them which love you , what thank have ye ? for sinners also love those that love them .
text2: “ Ɨi ' nʉnkanin kon nɨken i ' nʉnka auya ' nokon yau , ɨ ' rɨ wakʉ eporo auya ' nokon ? Tʉmakooikena ' nan uya rɨ ti ' nʉnkanin kon i ' nʉnka .

text: And if ye do good to them which do good to you , what thank have ye ? for sinners also do even the same .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ wakʉ kupʉ auya ' nokon yau wakʉ pe ɨku ' nin kon pɨ ' , ɨ ' rɨ wakʉ eporo auya ' nokon ? Tʉmakooikena ' nan uya rɨ mɨrɨ rɨ kupʉ .

text: And if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive , what thank have ye ? for sinners also lend to sinners , to receive as much again .
text2: Itʉrʉ auya ' nokon pe iyesi yau , kamoro inna ' ponin nan pe te ' san ena ' , ɨ ' rɨ wakʉ eporo auya ' nokon ? Tʉmakooikena ' nan uya itʉrʉ tʉmakooikena ' nan ena ' inna ' po to ' uya mɨ tukai ' .

text: But love ye your enemies , and do good , and lend , hoping for nothing again ; and your reward shall be great , and ye shall be the children of the Highest : for he is kind unto the unthankful and to the evil .
text2: E ' tane , ɨyeyaton kon i ' nʉnkatɨ ' , wakʉ iku ' tɨ ' to ' pɨ ' . To ' irepatɨ ' , to ' uya inna ' po enupɨkɨrɨ ɨwesi kon pa pʉra . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ɨyepe ' pʉ kon e ' to ' oton eke pe , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Eke Kuru munkɨ pe ɨwe ' to ' oton kon , apʉne pʉra mannʉ ' pe iyesi tenki tawon nan pen pɨ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨri ton pɨ ' .

text: Be ye therefore merciful , as your Father also is merciful .
text2: Tʉusentu ' masan pe e ' tɨ ' , ɨkʉipʉnʉ kon esi tʉusentu ' masen pe kasa .

text: Judge not , and ye shall not be judged : condemn not , and ye shall not be condemned : forgive , and ye shall be forgiven :
text2: “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ ka ' pon eseru kʉsaimenkatʉu , mɨrɨ a ' tai ɨyeseru kon nɨ nɨrɨ aimenka pen . Ka ' pon kʉseno ' matʉu , mɨrɨ a ' tai ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ eno ' ma pen . Ɨsentu ' matɨ ' , mɨrɨ a ' tai ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon pɨ ' rɨ usentu ' man .

text: Give , and it shall be given unto you ; good measure , pressed down , and shaken together , and running over , shall men give into your bosom . For with the same measure that ye mete withal it shall be measured to you again .
text2: Itʉkɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨyena ' iye ' tʉto ' pe . Wakʉ i ' tuto ' yai , eremuru ' sa ' , itʉntʉnmasa ' , mɨrɨpan anʉ ' sa ' e ' tʉrʉ ' kwa , tʉrʉ mɨrɨ ɨye ' mata pona . Apʉne pʉra i ' tuto ' auya yai , yai ɨyenakan i ' tu mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya .

text: And he spake a parable unto them , Can the blind lead the blind ? shall they not both fall into the ditch ?
text2: Sises uya panton ekama ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' , “ Tenku ' nan uya pe ' tenku ' nan kanan arɨ ? Asa ' rɨ rɨ marɨ pe ' akasa ' ya ' to ' uta ' mo ' ka pen ?

text: The disciple is not above his master : but every one that is perfect shall be as his master .
text2: Tʉusenupasen esi pʉra iyesi mɨrɨ tʉti ' saai entai . E ' tane tanporon kon ipan pe isenupasa ' kon e ' to ' oton tʉti ' saai kon kasa rɨ .

text: And why beholdest thou the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye , but perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye ?
text2: “ Ɨ ' rɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' aiko rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ paranka punu ' pɨ ɨnenpai ɨwesi ɨtonpa enu yawon , eke rɨ paranka e ' tane ɨyenu yau ?

text: Either how canst thou say to thy brother , Brother , let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye , when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye ? Thou hypocrite , cast out first the beam out of thine own eye , and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother ' s eye .
text2: Nai kasa ɨtonpa pɨ ' , ‘ Utonpa , apʉne amuru simo ' kai ' ɨyenu apai , ’ ta auya , ɨyenu awon nɨ paranka ene auya pen nɨ e ' tane ? Ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon wakʉ pe te ' ku ' san , wapiya ɨyenu apai paranka imo ' kaka ' kɨ , mɨrɨ a ' tai wakʉ pe ene auya ɨtonpa enu apai amuru mo ' ka pa , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya .

text: For a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit ; neither doth a corrupt tree bring forth good fruit .
text2: To ' enupa pɨ ' rɨ Sises esi ' pʉ , ta ' pʉ iya , “ Wakʉ yʉi epeta pʉra iyesi mɨrɨ ɨri pe , mɨrɨ pe pʉra ɨri yʉi epeta pʉra iyesi mɨrɨ wakʉ pe .

text: For every tree is known by his own fruit . For of thorns men do not gather figs , nor of a bramble bush gather they grapes .
text2: Ikaisa rɨ iteperu pɨkɨrɨ yʉi usi ' tu mɨrɨ . Ka ' pon amʉ ' uya pi ' pʉipɨtʉ pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ tikʉ kenan e ' kwa apai , mɨrɨ pe pʉra kʉre ' ɨmɨ ' nɨ ton ye ' apai .

text: A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good ; and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is evil : for of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaketh .
text2: Wakʉ ka ' pon uya wakʉ usentɨsa ' tewan yawon enpa ' ka mɨrɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨri ka ' pon uya ɨri usentɨsa ' tewan yawon enpa ' ka mɨrɨ . Apʉne pʉra itewan yau te ' sen epe ' tɨsa ' ke inta usaurokʉ mɨrɨ .

text: And why call ye me , Lord , Lord , and do not the things which I say ?
text2: “ Ɨ ' rɨ pɨ ' , ‘ Uyepuru , uyepuru , ’ tukai ' uyesa ' pɨtʉ auya ' nokon , ukayai ' ne ' kupʉi ' ma pʉra rɨ ?

text: Whosoever cometh to me , and heareth my sayings , and doeth them , I will shew you to whom he is like :
text2: Ɨnʉ ' kasa iyesi tukai ' enpoika uya kʉrɨ upiya ' nʉye ' ai ' ne ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ umaimu etayai ' ne ' mɨrɨpan kupʉ pɨ ' na ' ne ' .

text: He is like a man which built an house , and digged deep , and laid the foundation on a rock : and when the flood arose , the stream beat vehemently upon that house , and could not shake it : for it was founded upon a rock .
text2: Ka ' pon uya ɨutɨ amɨ kasa iyesi , i ' na ' akanin nʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨpan uya iyapon nonkasa ' tɨ ' pona . I ' mʉnpʉ uye ' sa ' a ' tai , itapʉ ' netʉ uya mɨrɨ ɨutɨ wɨnɨ ' pʉ e ' tane iwokouka iya poken pʉra iyesi ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra wakʉ pe amɨsa ' pe iyesi pɨ ' .

text: But he that heareth , and doeth not , is like a man that without a foundation built an house upon the earth ; against which the stream did beat vehemently , and immediately it fell ; and the ruin of that house was great .
text2: E ' tane kʉrɨ umaimu eta pɨ ' na ' ne ' mɨrɨpan kupʉ iya pʉra na ' ne ' esi ɨutɨ amɨnin ka ' pon non po iyapon pʉra kasa . I ' mʉnpʉ apʉ ' netʉ uya mɨrɨ ɨutɨ wɨnɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uta ' mo ' ka ' pʉ , ipʉra rɨ tʉuma ' tai ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people , he entered into Capernaum .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' uya eta tane tanporo serɨ ta nonkasa ' tʉuya a ' tai , Sises epa ' ka ' pʉ Ka ' paneyan pona .

text: And a certain centurion ' s servant , who was dear unto him , was sick , and ready to die .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , soisa amʉ ' epuru poitorʉ esi ' pʉ , ipan pe ini ' nʉnkanʉ takuru ' ke kuru , eri ' ka ' nɨ pɨ ' rɨ .

text: And when he heard of Jesus , he sent unto him the elders of the Jews , beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant .
text2: Soisa amʉ ' epuru uya Sises ekareei eta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' epuru ton ennoko ' pʉ ikɨ ' mai ' tʉpoitorʉ epi ' tɨi ' iye ' to ' pe .

text: And when they came to Jesus , they besought him instantly , saying , That he was worthy for whom he should do this :
text2: Sises piya ' tʉuye ' sa ' kon a ' tai , tʉuta ' kwarʉpɨ ' se kuru , “ Tʉpika ' tɨsen ye ' pe kuru pʉse rɨ ka ' pon esi . Ipika ' tɨkɨ kuru ,

text: For he loveth our nation , and he hath built us a synagogue .
text2: apʉne pʉra ina i ' nʉnka iya , ina Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' konekasa ' iya nɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: Then Jesus went with them . And when he was now not far from the house , the centurion sent friends to him , saying unto him , Lord , trouble not thyself : for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof :
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon a ' kɨrɨ Sises utɨ ' pʉ . Ɨnnɨ pʉra rɨ ɨutɨ piyapai iye ' tane , soisa amʉ ' epuru uya tʉtonpa ton ennoko ' pʉ ipana ' tɨse ' na , “ Uyepuru , katanpokʉmai , apʉne pʉra uiwʉ ' ta ' ɨuyepʉ pokena ' pen nɨ urɨ .

text: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee : but say in a word , and my servant shall be healed .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ɨpiya ' kuru rɨ utɨ ta uya pʉn , e ' tane amaimu itʉkɨ , mɨrɨ a ' tai upoitorʉ usepi ' tɨto ' pe .

text: For I also am a man set under authority , having under me soldiers , and I say unto one , Go , and he goeth ; and to another , Come , and he cometh ; and to my servant , Do this , and he doeth it .
text2: Apʉne pʉra urɨ rɨ kʉrɨ rɨ tepuru kenan , soisa amʉ ' esa ' uwo ' noro te ' san . Pʉse pɨ ' , ‘ Enta , ’ ta uya a ' tai , itɨ ; kʉrɨ pɨ ' , ‘ Ɨsi ' kɨ , ’ ta a ' tai , iyepʉ rɨ ; upoitorʉ pɨ ' , ‘ Se iku ' kɨ , ’ ta uya a ' tai , ikupʉ iya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: When Jesus heard these things , he marvelled at him , and turned him about , and said unto the people that followed him , I say unto you , I have not found so great faith , no , not in Israel .
text2: Sises uya serɨ etasa ' a ' tai , isewansiuka ' pʉ ipɨ ' era ' tɨi ' ma anpisin ka ' pon amʉ ' tʉpɨkɨrɨ te ' san winɨkʉi ' ta ' pʉ , “ Ta uya serɨ ɨpɨ ' nokon , ɨnʉ ' rɨ eposa ' uya pʉra rɨ man Esuwerʉ amʉ ' koro ' tau eke rɨ serɨ waraino apurɨto ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they that were sent , returning to the house , found the servant whole that had been sick .
text2: Enno ' sa ' kon nin si , warawo ' amʉ ' enna ' po ' pʉ ɨutɨ ta ' takuru ' kenan usepi ' tɨsa ' tepose .

text: And it came to pass the day after , that he went into a city called Nain ; and many of his disciples went with him , and much people .
text2: Inke pʉra rɨ mɨrɨ pata ' pʉ pe , Sises utɨ ' pʉ Nen itese ' pata pona . Ipoitorʉ ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ anpisin ton ka ' pon amʉ ' utɨ ' pʉ iya ' kɨrɨ .

text: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city , behold , there was a dead man carried out , the only son of his mother , and she was a widow : and much people of the city was with her .
text2: Pata mʉra ' ta eporo iya koro ' tau , eke ' u ' na ' tɨi ' tʉutɨsan epa ' ka eporo ' pʉ iya . Tikin nan nɨ itaan ' pʉ ima ' tasa ' rʉ ' pʉ mʉre warawo ' uma ' tasa ' esi ' pʉ . Anpisin ka ' pon amʉ ' utɨ esi ' pʉ iya ' kɨrɨ .

text: And when the Lord saw her , he had compassion on her , and said unto her , Weep not .
text2: Sises uya ensa ' a ' tai , isentu ' ma ' pʉ ipɨ ' , mɨrɨpan uya , “ Kakaramʉi , ” ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' .

text: And he came and touched the bier : and they that bare him stood still . And he said , Young man , I say unto thee , Arise .
text2: Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ iten a ' pɨ ' se ' na , mɨrɨpan anin nan e ' takʉ ' ka ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan pɨ ' , “ Moineri ' pɨ , e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he that was dead sat up , and began to speak . And he delivered him to his mother .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai eke ' e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan usaurokʉ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan tʉrʉ ' pʉ iya isan ena ' .

text: And there came a fear on all : and they glorified God , saying , That a great prophet is risen up among us ; and , That God hath visited his people .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon enari ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ ipan pe , mɨrɨpan kon uya si Papa apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ . “ Eke pu ' kena ' uye ' sa ' man u ' koro ' ta ' nokon ! Papa uye ' sa ' man tʉmunkɨ ton pika ' tɨse ' na ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea , and throughout all the region round about .
text2: Sises ekareei ekama ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' uya mɨ awɨrɨ rɨ Isutiya poro , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iwoino ' nan pata awɨrɨ ' ne .

text: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things .
text2: Isaan poitorʉ ton uya si tanporo serɨ ton ekama ' pʉ mɨrɨ ipɨ ' . Isaan uya asa ' ron kon tʉpoitorʉ ton kɨ ' ma ' pʉ ,

text: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus , saying , Art thou he that should come ? or look we for another ?
text2: mɨrɨpan kon ennoko ' pʉ iya Itepuru piya ' ekama ' pose ' na , “ Ɨmɨrɨ rɨ pe ' kʉrɨ rɨ tʉuye ' ton ta ' pʉ rʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' , tʉron nɨ rɨ katɨ uyepʉ enupɨkɨrɨ ina e ' to ' nai ? ” tukai ' .

text: When the men were come unto him , they said , John Baptist hath sent us unto thee , saying , Art thou he that should come ? or look we for another ?
text2: Sises piya ' tʉuye ' sa ' kon a ' tai , “ Isaan Pa ' tes uya ina enno ' sa ' ɨpiya ' ɨyekama ' pose ' na , ‘ Ɨmɨrɨ rɨ pe ' kʉrɨ rɨ tʉuye ' ton ta ' pʉ rʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' , tʉron nɨ rɨ katɨ uyepʉ enupɨkɨrɨ ina e ' to ' nai ? ’ ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues , and of evil spirits ; and unto many that were blind he gave sight .
text2: Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , Sises uya ka ' pon amʉ ' epi ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ , paran pokon kon , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ amariwakʉ ' pa ' nan nɨ . Tu ' kan kon nɨ tenku ' na ' nan kupʉ ' pʉ iya ennin pe .

text: Then Jesus answering said unto them , Go your way , and tell John what things ye have seen and heard ; how that the blind see , the lame walk , the lepers are cleansed , the deaf hear , the dead are raised , to the poor the gospel is preached .
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa main anin nʉ ' san eikʉ ' pʉ iya , “ Enna ' potɨ ' Isaan pɨ ' ekamatantɨ ' ɨnene ' pʉ kon , ɨneta ' pʉ kon : tenku ' na ' nan enasa ' ennin nan pe ; ise ' mesa ' kon enasa ' tʉusasan pe ; wereei ' pa ' nan usepi ' tɨsa ' ; etanin nan pen enasa ' etanin nan pe ; eke ' e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' ; wakʉ itekare usekamasa ' man entu ' manin nan pana ya ' .

text: And blessed is he , whosoever shall not be offended in me .
text2: Pori ' pe ka ' pon esi mɨrɨ tʉuta ' mo ' kasen pen unkupʉnʉ uriya ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when the messengers of John were departed , he began to speak unto the people concerning John , What went ye out into the wilderness for to see ? A reed shaken with the wind ?
text2: Isaan maimu anin nʉ ' san enna ' po ' pʉ pata ' pʉ yau , Sises e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ anpisin auro ' ka pɨ ' Isaan pɨ ' , “ Ɨ ' rɨ ense ' na ɨutɨ ' pʉ kon rɨmono ' ta ' ? Wana ' rɨ ari ' ma a ' setun uya ense ' na ?

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A man clothed in soft raiment ? Behold , they which are gorgeously apparelled , and live delicately , are in kings ' courts .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe pʉra iyesi yau , ɨ ' rɨ ken ense ' na ɨutɨ ' pʉ kon ? Wakʉ pe katɨ ka ' pon epontɨpɨ ' sa ' ense ' na ? Kane . Kamoro epe ' kena ' ton pon yau te ' san esi use ' wanpan pɨ ' te ' sen pata esanon iwʉ ' tawon kon .

text: But what went ye out for to see ? A prophet ? Yea , I say unto you , and much more than a prophet .
text2: E ' tane ɨ ' rɨ kuru ken ense ' na ɨutɨ ' pʉ kon ? Pu ' kena ' katɨ ? Ewai ' apana ' tɨ uya ' nokon , pu ' kena ' entaino rɨ .

text: This is he , of whom it is written , Behold , I send my messenger before thy face , which shall prepare thy way before thee .
text2: Pʉse rɨ sa ' ne si kʉrɨ rɨ ko iye ' menukasa ' itekare usauro ' sa ' rʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' , “ ‘ Umaimu ekamanin ennoko uya mɨrɨ arawɨrɨ , ɨye ' ma konekanin pe awapiya , ’ ta ' pʉ rʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' .

text: For I say unto you , Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist : but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he .
text2: Apana ' tɨ uya ' nokon , kamo uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' nentunʉkʉ ' san koro ' tau , ɨnʉ ' rɨ iyentusa ' rʉ ' pʉ pʉra rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ eke Isaan entaino , mɨrɨ e ' tane kʉrɨ aiko pe te ' sen Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe yawon esi eke pe Isaan entai , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya .

text: And all the people that heard him , and the publicans , justified God , being baptized with the baptism of John .
text2: Tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan nɨ uya Sises maimu etasa ' tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , i ' tu ' pʉ Papa eseru esi i ' napairon pe , apʉne pʉra Isaan nʉpa ' taisima ' san pe tesi kon pɨ ' .

text: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves , being not baptized of him .
text2: E ' tane si , Pari ' si amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Main pɨ ' enupanin nan uya Papa nʉkupʉ ' pʉ tiwano ' kon pe ewaruma ' tɨ ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra to ' esi ' pʉ Isaan uya tʉpa ' taisima kon i ' se pʉra .

text: And the Lord said , Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation ? and to what are they like ?
text2: “ Ɨnʉ ' yan kasa ken ka ' pon amʉ ' serɨ a ' taino kon ekama uya ? Ɨnʉ ' yan kasa to ' esi ?

text: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace , and calling one to another , and saying , We have piped unto you , and ye have not danced ; we have mourned to you , and ye have not wept .
text2: Mʉre amʉ ' ereutapɨ ' sa ' kʉrʉpo ' po pata ' se ' yau na ' ne ' tʉukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨ ' san tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' pɨ ' kasa : “ ‘ Sarakuwa turunpa ' pʉ ina uya ɨiwano ' kon pe e ' tane , aumanʉnsa ' kon pʉra iyesi ; eke ' eremu pɨ ' ina userenka ' pʉ e ' tane , aukaransa ' kon pʉra iyesi , ’ tawon nan kasa rɨ .

text: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine ; and ye say , He hath a devil .
text2: Apʉne pʉra Isaan Pa ' tes uyee ' pʉ pʉreti ɨku iya pʉra mɨrɨ pe pʉra waain ensi iya pʉra , mɨrɨpan pɨ ' , ‘ Makoi esi iyau , ’ ta ' pʉ auya ' nokon .

text: The Son of man is come eating and drinking ; and ye say , Behold a gluttonous man , and a winebibber , a friend of publicans and sinners !
text2: Ka ' pon , Papa winon , uyee ' pʉ tenta ' nasen mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ensinin , mɨrɨpan pɨ ' , ‘ Pʉse eke pe tenta ' nasen mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ te ' taripasen , pʉrata amʉranʉ ' nin nan , tʉmakooikena ' nan nɨrɨ tonpa pe iyesi , ’ ta ' pʉ auya ' nokon .

text: But wisdom is justified of all her children .
text2: E ' tane Papa pu ' ketʉ usi ' tu mɨrɨ i ' napai rɨ , tanporo imunkɨ amʉ ' winɨ , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya .

text: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him . And he went into the Pharisee ' s house , and sat down to meat .
text2: Pari ' si amʉ ' tonpa uya Sises kɨ ' ma ' pʉ tʉpiya ' entai ' kwase ' na . Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ itiwʉ ' ta ' tʉteire ' po iyena ' pʉ tepʉrʉ piyau .

text: And , behold , a woman in the city , which was a sinner , when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee ' s house , brought an alabaster box of ointment ,
text2: Mɨrɨ pata yau rɨ , tʉuko ' mansen uri ' san , ɨri pe iteseru iko ' mansa ' , uya Sises enta ' na Pari ' si iwʉ ' tau etasa ' a ' tai , po ' toro arapasta po ' piyun yen nee ' pʉ .

text: And stood at his feet behind him weeping , and began to wash his feet with tears , and did wipe them with the hairs of her head , and kissed his feet , and anointed them with the ointment .
text2: Mɨrɨpan e ' soto ' ka ' pʉ Sises a ' poi winɨ akaramʉi ' ma . Mɨrɨpan e ' torupa ' tɨ ' pʉ , Sises pʉta amanka ' pʉ iya tenu paru ke , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ a ' munaka ' pʉ iya tʉnse ' ke , i ' ta a ' su ' ka ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan pona po ' piyun ma ' pʉ iya .

text: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it , he spake within himself , saying , This man , if he were a prophet , would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him : for she is a sinner .
text2: Mɨrɨ ensa ' tʉuya a ' tai , Pari ' si ikɨ ' manin nʉ ' pʉ uya ti ' nau , “ Pu ' kena ' pe pʉse rɨ ka ' pon esi yau , ta ' pɨ ' nin uri ' san eseru i ' tui ' no ! Ɨri pe iyesi tukai ' , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: And Jesus answering said unto him , Simon , I have somewhat to say unto thee . And he saith , Master , say on .
text2: Sises uya eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Saiman , ayauro ' kato ' uya ike moro man , ” ta ' pʉ iya . “ Ekamakɨ , Ti ' sa , ” ta ' pʉ iya nin si mɨrɨ ipɨ ' .

text: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors : the one owed five hundred pence , and the other fifty .
text2: “ Asa ' ron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uya pʉrata tʉnin ye ' ko ' manʉ ' pɨtʉ esi ' pʉ te ' mai ' pʉra . Tikin nan uya 500 kaisa rɨ pʉrata pun ko ' manʉ ' pɨtʉ esi ' pʉ , isakon uya 50 kaisa rɨ kanan pʉrata pun .

text: And when they had nothing to pay , he frankly forgave them both . Tell me therefore , which of them will love him most ?
text2: To ' uya inna ' poto ' ike pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ . Asa ' rɨ rɨ marɨ to ' pɨ ' , ‘ Tɨwɨ si nesii , ’ ta ' pʉ iya . Nai kʉrɨ uya kuru i ' nʉnka ipan pe ? ” ta ' pʉ iya nin si mɨrɨ Saiman pɨ ' .

text: Simon answered and said , I suppose that he , to whom he forgave most . And he said unto him , Thou hast rightly judged .
text2: Mɨrɨpan eikʉ ' pʉ Saiman uya , “ Eke kuru ipʉrataai ko ' manʉ ' nin nʉ ' pʉ na ' kɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya . “ Ipoken kuru i ' tusa ' auya mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya .

text: And he turned to the woman , and said unto Simon , Seest thou this woman ? I entered into thine house , thou gavest me no water for my feet : but she hath washed my feet with tears , and wiped them with the hairs of her head .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , iyera ' tɨ ' pʉ uri ' san winɨkʉi ' , tai ' ma Saiman pɨ ' , “ Pʉse uri ' san menyan ? Ɨiwʉ ' ta ' uyepʉi , e ' tane u ' tuna ' kwaai ' tɨ auya pʉn u ' ta kumi ' to ' uya ike ke . Mɨrɨ e ' tane tenu paru ke u ' ta amankasa ' iya , tʉnse ' ke a ' munakasa ' iya nɨrɨ .

text: Thou gavest me no kiss : but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet .
text2: Uya ' su ' kasa ' auya pʉra iyesi , uyetupa pe , e ' tane pʉse rɨ uri ' san uya ewomʉ ' pʉ si ' kɨrɨ rɨ , u ' ta a ' su ' ka nonkasa ' pʉra rɨ iyesi .

text: My head with oil thou didst not anoint : but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment .
text2: U ' pai karapaimasa ' auya pʉra rɨ iyesi uyeseru kon yau , e ' tane u ' ta pona po ' piyun masa ' iya .

text: Wherefore I say unto thee , Her sins , which are many , are forgiven ; for she loved much : but to whom little is forgiven , the same loveth little .
text2: Mɨrɨ pɨ ' ta uya ɨpɨ ' , eke rɨ imakooi pɨ ' usentu ' masa ' wenai , eke pe isi ' nʉnkato ' esi . E ' tane si , kʉrɨ mararon imakooi pɨ ' usentu ' masa ' na ' ne ' uya nin si , mara rɨ i ' nʉnkan , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he said unto her , Thy sins are forgiven .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai nin si , ta ' pʉ iya mɨrɨ uri ' san pɨ ' , “ Amakooi ton pɨ ' usentu ' masa ' man , ” ta ' pʉ iya ipɨ ' .

text: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves , Who is this that forgiveth sins also ?
text2: Tʉron kon inkɨ ' ma ' san uya nin si ti ' nau ' nokon , “ Ɨnʉ ' si pʉse makoi pɨ ' tʉusentu ' masen ? ” ta ' pʉ .

text: And he said to the woman , Thy faith hath saved thee ; go in peace .
text2: “ Apʉne pʉra uyapurɨsa ' auya pɨ ' , Papa uya ɨpika ' tɨsa ' man auma ' tato ' apai . Enta si tʉusewankamai ' pʉra , ” ta ' pʉ Sises uya uri ' san pɨ ' .

text: And it came to pass afterward , that he went throughout every city and village , preaching and shewing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God : and the twelve were with him ,
text2: Tʉron nɨ a ' tai , Sises utɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ tʉron nɨ eke iwa ton pata kaisa rɨ ' ne wakʉ Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe ekareei ekama pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ . 12 kaisaron kon ipoitorʉ ton esi ' pʉ iya ' kɨrɨ .

text: And certain women , which had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities , Mary called Magdalene , out of whom went seven devils ,
text2: To ' tonpa pe kanan upinin nɨ pɨ ' uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' makoi a ' kwarʉ yen ton nʉ ' san mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ e ' ne ' ton nʉ ' san Sises nepi ' tɨ ' san esi ' pʉ : Meri , Matara pon , 7 kaisaron kon makoi a ' kwarʉ epa ' kasa ' iyapai rʉ ' pʉ ;

text: And Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod ' s steward , and Susanna , and many others , which ministered unto him of their substance .
text2: mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isowana , Kusa no ' pʉ ( Kusa esi ' pʉ Era ' esen o ' non pe ) , mɨrɨ tʉpo Susana ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tu ' ke rɨ tʉron kon esi ' pʉ . Pʉsamoro uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ Sises pokon pika ' tɨ pɨ ' to ' e ' to ' i ' se ke rɨ tiwano ' kon pe te ' sen apai .

text: And when much people were gathered together , and were come to him out of every city , he spake by a parable :
text2: Tu ' ke kuru rɨ anpisin pe rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉra koro ' tau mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' uyee ' pʉ Sises piya ' ɨse ' ma ' pʉ pe ' ne rɨ eke iwa ton pata ton apai ' ne , serɨ panton ekama ' pʉ iya :

text: A sower went out to sow his seed : and as he sowed , some fell by the way side ; and it was trodden down , and the fowls of the air devoured it .
text2: “ Umɨ pɨ ' te ' sen utɨ ' pʉ kiyari ye ' pɨnse ' na tʉpa ' karakai ' . Ipa ' karaka iya koro ' tau , tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ asanta ta ' . Mɨrɨpan ka ' pon amʉ ' usarɨ uya iwasa ' kapɨtʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan ɨku ' pʉ toron amʉ ' uya .

text: And some fell upon a rock ; and as soon as it was sprung up , it withered away , because it lacked moisture .
text2: Tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ tɨ ' pona . Iya ' ta koro ' tau , iyaipʉtapɨtʉ ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra tuna eporo iya pʉra iyesi wenai .

text: And some fell among thorns ; and the thorns sprang up with it , and choked it .
text2: Tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ tikʉkenan nʉ ' ta ' , mɨrɨpan a ' ta ' pʉ ipokon pe , mɨrɨpan uya ɨwɨtanʉkʉ ' pʉ .

text: And other fell on good ground , and sprang up , and bare fruit an hundredfold . And when he had said these things , he cried , He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Mɨrɨ e ' tane rɨ , tʉron nɨ ton uta ' pokʉ ' pʉ wakʉ non ya ' . Mɨrɨpan a ' ta ' pʉ , iyepeta ' pʉ . Iyepeta ' pʉ eke pe rɨ , 100 kaisa rɨ ite ' kwa e ' to ' airɨ inpɨmɨ ' pʉ entai rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya . Serɨ ta ' pʉ iya a ' tai , ikɨ ' pɨ ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ , “ Kʉrɨ tʉpana ke na ' ne ' etato ' ike , tɨwɨ netai ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And his disciples asked him , saying , What might this parable be ?
text2: Ipoitorʉ ton uya ekama ' po ' pʉ ɨ ' rɨ ta e ' kwa pe serɨ panton esi tukai ' .

text: And he said , Unto you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God : but to others in parables ; that seeing they might not see , and hearing they might not understand .
text2: Ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨnʉ ' ni ' tunʉ pen nɨ ama ' aino Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe i ' tu kon pa ɨyena ' nokon itʉsa ' , e ' tane tʉron kon pana ya ' panton yai usaurokʉ , ‘ Enei ' ma rɨ to ' uya ene pʉra iye ' to ' pe ; etai ' ma rɨ to ' uya ito ' ka ' nʉkʉ pʉra iye ' to ' pe . ’

text: Now the parable is this : The seed is the word of God .
text2: “ Se nin si ta iya e ' kwa pe , panton esi mɨrɨ , ite ' pe na ' ne ' mɨrɨ , Papa Maimu .

text: Those by the way side are they that hear ; then cometh the devil , and taketh away the word out of their hearts , lest they should believe and be saved .
text2: Kamoro asanta tau na ' ne ' nan esi Papa Maimu etanin nan . Mɨrɨpan nin si , makoi uyepʉ to ' ewan yawon main mo ' kai ' , to ' uya apurɨ namai ' , mɨrɨpan kon epika ' tɨ namai ' .

text: They on the rock are they , which , when they hear , receive the word with joy ; and these have no root , which for a while believe , and in time of temptation fall away .
