text: Men and brethren , children of the stock of Abraham , and whosoever among you feareth God , to you is the word of this salvation sent .
text2: “ Utonpa ton Esuwerʉ amʉ ' , Epʉra ' an payan nʉ ' san , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen nɨ nɨrɨ Papa namanin nan , etatɨ ' ! Urɨ ' nokon iwano ' pe kuru Papa uya epika ' tɨn nɨto ' eseru ennoko ' pʉ .

text: For they that dwell at Jerusalem , and their rulers , because they knew him not , nor yet the voices of the prophets which are read every sabbath day , they have fulfilled them in condemning him .
text2: Surusiran pon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' epuru ton uya i ' tu pʉra iyesi ' pʉ pʉse rɨ Sises esi pika ' tɨnin pe tukai ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ pu ' kena ' amʉ ' maimu Sapa ' kaisa rɨ tʉusekamasen to ' ka ' nʉkʉ to ' uya pʉra iyesi ' pʉ , e ' tane pu ' kena ' amʉ ' uya ekama ' pʉ awɨrɨ to ' uya iwɨnɨ ' pʉ .

text: And though they found no cause of death in him , yet desired they Pilate that he should be slain .
text2: Tu ' kan kon nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' usaurokʉ ' pʉ , ‘ Ɨri kupʉ Sises uya , ’ tukai ' , e ' tane iwɨto ' ipɨkɨrɨ oton eporo to ' uya pʉra iyesi ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ rɨ e ' tane , itepuru Paire ' ekama ' po ' pʉ to ' uya ima ' tanʉ ' to ' pe iya .

text: And when they had fulfilled all that was written of him , they took him down from the tree , and laid him in a sepulchre .
text2: Pena rɨ pu ' kena ' ton nekama ' pʉ kupʉ ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' uya mɨrɨ Sises pɨ ' . To ' uya iwɨnɨ ' pʉ . Kurusu ' pona to ' uya ipokapɨtʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan mo ' ka ' pʉ tʉron kon uya kurusu ' poi , mɨrɨpan emaika ' pʉ to ' uya tɨ ' akasa ' uruwai ' pe ya ' .

text: But God raised him from the dead :
text2: E ' tane Papa uya i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ eri ' nɨto ' apai .

text: And he was seen many days of them which came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem , who are his witnesses unto the people .
text2: Inke rɨ isenpoikapɨtʉ ' pʉ ta ' kɨrɨ Kiyarari ponsi ' kɨ Surusiran pona itɨsa ' kon enu ya ' , ka ' pon amʉ ' si ennin nʉ ' san esi mɨrɨ tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' pana ya ' ekama pɨ ' .

text: And we declare unto you glad tidings , how that the promise which was made unto the fathers ,
text2: “ Ina uya kanan si serɨ wakʉ kuru itekare ekama serɨ ɨpɨ ' nokon . ‘ Mɨrɨ kupʉ uya , ’ ta ' pʉ Papa uya utamokori kon pɨ ' uta ' ku ' tɨsa ' rʉ ' pʉ

text: God hath fulfilled the same unto us their children , in that he hath raised up Jesus again ; as it is also written in the second psalm , Thou art my Son , this day have I begotten thee .
text2: urɨ ' nokon , to ' payan non pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ si ku ' sa ' iya Sises ti ' mʉ ' sa ' kase Eren apon yau isakon pe te ' sen Eren uya ekamasa ' kasa , “ ‘ Serɨ pe umu , tikin nan pe kuru ɨwesi mɨrɨ , ɨkʉipʉnʉ pe enasa ' serɨ . ’

text: And as concerning that he raised him up from the dead , now no more to return to corruption , he said on this wise , I will give you the sure mercies of David .
text2: Papa uya tʉmu i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ iyeri ' sa ' apai , mɨrɨpan eri ' to ' oton pen nɨ mɨrɨ enta ' . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' , Papa uya utamokori kon amʉ ' auro ' ka ' pʉ , “ ‘ Ɨpika ' tɨ uya ' nokon kuru mɨrɨ , umunkɨ amʉ ' , Tepi ' auro ' ka ' pʉ uya awɨrɨ rɨ . ’

text: Wherefore he saith also in another psalm , Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption .
text2: Tepi ' uya Kʉrai pɨ ' Papa auro ' kasa ' tʉron nɨ Eren yau , “ ‘ Ikɨtato ' pe uyekepu nonka auya pen , apʉne pʉra wakʉ urɨ , ɨpoitorʉ ukɨta i ' se pʉra ɨwesi . ’

text: For David , after he had served his own generation by the will of God , fell on sleep , and was laid unto his fathers , and saw corruption :
text2: “ Tʉuko ' mamʉ koro ' tau , Tepi ' uya , ikupʉ iya i ' se Papa e ' to ' ku ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ . E ' tane iyerikʉ ' pʉ , ka ' pon uya iu ' na ' tɨ ' pʉ , itamokori ton esi ' pʉ kasa rɨ , mɨrɨpan pun ukɨta ' pʉ .

text: But he , whom God raised again , saw no corruption .
text2: E ' tane kʉrɨ Papa nʉ ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ iyerikʉ ' pʉ yapai ukɨta ' pʉ pen .

text: Be it known unto you therefore , men and brethren , that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins :
text2: “ Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , utonpa ton , i ' tu auya ' nokon i ' se esi Sises poro makoi pɨ ' usentu ' man , usekama ɨpɨ ' nokon .

text: And by him all that believe are justified from all things , from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses .
text2: Kʉrɨ rɨ poro tanporon kon apurɨnin nan ekoneka , tanporon nɨ ekonekan pokena ' pen nɨ ipiyapai , Mosi ' nʉmenuka ' pʉ winɨ .

text: Beware therefore , lest that come upon you , which is spoken of in the prophets ;
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ti ' tui ' e ' tɨ ' , pu ' kena ' amʉ ' nekama ' pʉ e ' kupʉ namai ' ɨpɨ ' nokon :

text: Behold , ye despisers , and wonder , and perish : for I work a work in your days , a work which ye shall in no wise believe , though a man declare it unto you .
text2: “ ‘ Etatɨ ' ɨmiyamoro , Papa sapemanin nan ! Ɨusewansiuka kon mɨrɨ Papa nʉkupʉnʉ tense mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨyeri ' to ' oton kon . Iku ' to ' uya oton aya ' tai ' nokon anapurɨnʉ ton kon pen nɨ ka ' pon uya ekama tane ɨpɨ ' nokon , ’ tawon , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when the Jews were gone out of the synagogue , the Gentiles besought that these words might be preached to them the next sabbath .
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' nɨmɨ koro ' tau , ka ' pon amʉ ' uya to ' kɨ ' ma ' pʉ Sapa ' a ' tai to ' uye ' to ' pe miyarɨ parɨ serɨ ton ekamase ' na .

text: Now when the congregation was broken up , many of the Jews and religious proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas : who , speaking to them , persuaded them to continue in the grace of God .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' e ' nonkasa ' a ' tai , anpisin pe Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen e ' tane Papa namanin nan uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas e ' ma ' pʉka ' pʉ . Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya to ' auro ' ka ' pʉ , Papa uya wakʉ nonkasa ' tʉpona ' nokon awɨrɨ to ' uko ' manto ' pe .

text: And the next sabbath day came almost the whole city together to hear the word of God .
text2: Tʉron nɨ Sapa ' a ' tai , tu ' ke rɨ anpisin pe Antiyo ' pon kon amʉra ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas usaurokʉ etase ' na Itepuru Sises pɨ ' .

text: But when the Jews saw the multitudes , they were filled with envy , and spake against those things which were spoken by Paul , contradicting and blaspheming .
text2: Esuwerʉ amʉ ' ɨkɨnta ' pʉ anpisin pe ka ' pon amʉ ' ene tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , mɨrɨpan kon usaurokʉ ' pʉ ɨri pe Paarʉ pa ' nʉkʉ pe .

text: Then Paul and Barnabas waxed bold , and said , It was necessary that the word of God should first have been spoken to you : but seeing ye put it from you , and judge yourselves unworthy of everlasting life , lo , we turn to the Gentiles .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon maimu eikʉ ' pʉ Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya te ' namai ' pʉra , “ Sises ekareei , Papa winon ekamato ' ina uya pe iyesi wapiya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pɨ ' , e ' tane Papa Maimu ewaruma ' tɨ auya ' nokon , mɨrɨ uya ekama wakʉ tɨwɨrɨ uko ' man nɨto ' eponin nan pe pʉra rɨ tukai ' ɨye ' kupʉ kon .

text: For so hath the Lord commanded us , saying , I have set thee to be a light of the Gentiles , that thou shouldest be for salvation unto the ends of the earth .
text2: Apʉne pʉra Papa uya ina apiyontɨsa ' ina uya iku ' to ' pe , “ ‘ To ' weyu pe ɨyennoko uya serɨ non emʉ ' kaisaron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' pana ' tɨse ' na , to ' pika ' tɨnin pe urɨ esi pɨ ' , ’ tukai ' , ” ta ' pʉ Paarʉ uya .

text: And when the Gentiles heard this , they were glad , and glorified the word of the Lord : and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed .
text2: Mɨrɨ eta Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen uya a ' tai , to ' epori ' ma ' pʉ . Papa Maimu inamato ' uya . Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen , Papa nanʉmʉ ' san tʉpiyau to ' e ' to ' pe uya Sises ekareei apurɨ ' pʉ .

text: And the word of the Lord was published throughout all the region .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Itepuru maimu utɨ ' pʉ tanporo mɨrɨ nono awɨrɨ .

text: But the Jews stirred up the devout and honourable women , and the chief men of the city , and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and expelled them out of their coasts .
text2: Mɨrɨ e ' tane tʉron kon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' epuru ton uya , eke ton pe te ' san ka ' pon amʉ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Papa namanin nan uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas ewaruma ' tɨto ' pe ikupʉ ' pʉ . Kamoro Esuwerʉ amʉ ' uya tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' auro ' ka ' pʉ Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas kota ' mato ' pe to ' uya . Mɨrɨpan kon uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas enpa ' ka ' pʉ tʉnono kon apai .

text: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them , and came unto Iconium .
text2: Mɨrɨpan Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya ti ' ta kon poi non tɨutɨ ' pʉ pata nɨmɨi ' ma , Papa uya to ' nonkasa ' ekamanin pe , mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ Ai ' koniyan pona , Antiyo ' ponsi ' kɨ .

text: And the disciples were filled with joy , and with the Holy Ghost .
text2: Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , Sises apurɨnin nan uta ' kwarʉ ' tɨ ' pʉ pori ' ke mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ ke .

text: And it came to pass in Iconium , that they went both together into the synagogue of the Jews , and so spake , that a great multitude both of the Jews and also of the Greeks believed .
text2: Te ' to ' kon kasa rɨ Ai ' koniyan po , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas pokon utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' , mɨrɨpan kon uya wakʉ pe pori ' ma ' kuru rɨ itekare ekama ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan tu ' ke rɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen nɨ nɨrɨ ena ' pʉ Sises apurɨnin nan pe .

text: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles , and made their minds evil affected against the brethren .
text2: E ' tane Esuwerʉ amʉ ' itekare apurɨnin nan pen uya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen tʉrʉnka ' pʉ ɨri pe to ' pɨ ' to ' e ' ku ' to ' pe .

text: Long time therefore abode they speaking boldly in the Lord , which gave testimony unto the word of his grace , and granted signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas pokon uya wʉi apɨtʉ ' pʉ inke rɨ . Enari ' mʉra Sises ekareei ekama pɨ ' to ' esi ' pʉ , i ' napai rɨ wakʉ nonkasa ' iya ekareei esi enpoikanin pe , to ' repa ' pʉ iya winɨ to ' meruntɨrʉ ke , i ' tuto ' ipɨkɨrɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ a ' kwarʉpɨ ' nin ku ' to ' pe to ' uya .

text: But the multitude of the city was divided : and part held with the Jews , and part with the apostles .
text2: Kamoro Ai ' koniyan po tʉuko ' mansan epantakapɨ ' sa ' esi ' pʉ ; tʉron kon uya enno ' sa ' kon apurɨ ' pʉ , tʉron kon uya tʉron kon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' apurɨ ' pʉ .

text: And when there was an assault made both of the Gentiles , and also of the Jews with their rulers , to use them despitefully , and to stone them ,
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usaurokʉ ' pʉ Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas kota ' mato ' , tepuru kon pokon pe to ' e ' kama ' pʉ , tɨ ' ke to ' wɨto ' pe tʉuya ' nokon .

text: They were ware of it , and fled unto Lystra and Derbe , cities of Lycaonia , and unto the region that lieth round about :
text2: E ' tane Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya etasa ' esi ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ tʉron nɨ pata pona , Restʉra , Terʉpi , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iwoino ' nan pata pona , Rai ' koniya pata yau .

text: And there they preached the gospel .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau tesi kon a ' tai , itekare ekama pɨ ' to ' esi ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' .

text: And there sat a certain man at Lystra , impotent in his feet , being a cripple from his mother ' s womb , who never had walked :
text2: Restʉra po ka ' pon esi ' pʉ ise ' mepɨ ' sa ' i ' ta . Iyentusa ' a ' tai , mɨrɨ kasa rɨ iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan usarɨ pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ .

text: The same heard Paul speak : who stedfastly beholding him , and perceiving that he had faith to be healed ,
text2: Paarʉ usaurokʉ Itepuru Sises pɨ ' etapɨtʉ pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ . Paarʉ uya enpɨtʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan ene ' pʉ iya Itepuru Sises uya kuru upika ' tɨ tukai ' apurɨ ' pʉ iya .

text: Said with a loud voice , Stand upright on thy feet . And he leaped and walked .
text2: Mɨrɨpan Paarʉ uya , “ E ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' , utonpa ! ” ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' tʉukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnse . Mɨrɨ etasa ' tʉuya a ' tai , iye ' sanʉmʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan usarɨ ' pʉ wakʉ pe .

text: And when the people saw what Paul had done , they lifted up their voices , saying in the speech of Lycaonia , The gods are come down to us in the likeness of men .
text2: Paarʉ nʉkupʉ ' pʉ tense , papa amʉ ' tato ' pe rɨ Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas kupʉ ' pʉ to ' uya . Tʉmaimu kon , Rai ' koniya pon kon maimu yau to ' ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Apʉne , entɨ ' ! Pʉsamoro ka ' pon amʉ ' esi mɨrɨ papa amʉ ' pe , e ' tane ka ' pon amʉ ' pe to ' era ' tɨsa ' , mɨrɨpan kon u ' tɨsa ' ka ' winɨpai upika ' tɨse ' na ' nokon ! ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And they called Barnabas , Jupiter ; and Paul , Mercurius , because he was the chief speaker .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , Panapas esakʉ ' pʉ to ' uya Isus tukai ' , “ Eke pe iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan Paarʉ esakʉ ' pʉ to ' uya Ɨrʉmes tukai ' , apʉne pʉra tʉusauro ' sen pe iyesi pɨ ' .

text: Then the priest of Jupiter , which was before their city , brought oxen and garlands unto the gates , and would have done sacrifice with the people .
text2: Eke pata mʉra ' ta yau rɨ to ' use ' mato ' , ɨpʉremato ' iwʉ ' esi ' pʉ Isus itese ' tepuru kon apurɨse ' na ka ' pon amʉ ' utɨto ' ita ' . Mɨrɨpan to ' use ' mato ' tʉrawasomanin uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas nʉkupʉ ' pʉ eta ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan uya asa ' rɨ paka amʉ ' nee ' pʉ , pata ipʉrʉ to ' i ' mʉ woi , to ' use ' mato ' tʉrawasomanin , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' esi ' pʉ paka amʉ ' ɨnwɨpai Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas apurɨ pe tenta ' nato ' kon pe .

text: Which when the apostles , Barnabas and Paul , heard of , they rent their clothes , and ran in among the people , crying out ,
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya to ' e ' kamasa ' i ' tu ' pʉ paka amʉ ' wɨnɨ pɨ ' tapurɨ kon pe to ' po ' tɨto ' pe tʉuya ' nokon , mɨrɨpan kon uya tʉpon kon pʉro ' pon karapɨtʉ ' pʉ , “ Kane ! ” ta tʉuya ' nokon e ' kwa pe . To ' eka ' tumʉ ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' koro ' ta ' tʉukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉi ' ma ' nokon ,

text: And saying , Sirs , why do ye these things ? We also are men of like passions with you , and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities unto the living God , which made heaven , and earth , and the sea , and all things that are therein :
text2: “ Ina tonpa ton , mɨrɨ kʉ ' ku ' tʉu ! Ka ' pon amʉ ' rɨ marɨ ina , awarai ' nokon nɨ marɨ ! Emenna ' itekare wakʉ kuru ekamai ' ina uye ' sa ' ɨpɨ ' nokon . Tʉron kon ika ' sa ' ton piyapai era ' tɨtɨ ' ; i ' napairon Papa piya ' era ' tɨtɨ ' ! To ' uya ɨpika ' tɨ kon pʉra iyesi . Kʉrɨ rɨ esi Papa pe , tanporon non koneka ' pʉ iya tanporo ipo te ' sen . Non koneka ' pʉ iya , parau , tuna ton , ka ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporo urɨ ' nokon .

text: Who in times past suffered all nations to walk in their own ways .
text2: Pena rɨ ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen esi ' pʉ i ' se rɨ ɨwe ' to ' kon apurɨ pɨ ' Papa uya rɨ ɨyenpɨtʉ ' pʉ kon , apʉne pʉra ti ' tu auya ' nokon pʉra iyesi pɨ ' .

text: Nevertheless he left not himself without witness , in that he did good , and gave us rain from heaven , and fruitful seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness .
text2: E ' tane si , tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' enu ya ' isenpoikasa ' , kʉrɨ rɨ uya wakʉ ton ke repan nɨsa ' tukai ' i ' tu kon pa . Wakʉ ton nɨ ku ' sa ' iya ɨiwano ' kon pe : tuna enno ' sa ' iya ; tʉweyu a ' tai iyepetato ' pe ɨi ' kiyari kon ku ' sa ' iya ; eke pe rɨ kiyari ke ɨrepasa ' iya ' nokon ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ pori ' pe ɨku ' sa ' iya ' nokon , ” ta ' pʉ Paarʉ uya .

text: And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people , that they had not done sacrifice unto them .
text2: To ' usaurokʉ eta ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' uya e ' tane rɨ , to ' ereutanʉkʉ i ' se to ' e ' tane paka amʉ ' wɨnɨ to ' uya namai ' , to ' ereutanʉkʉ to ' uya poken pʉra iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And there came thither certain Jews from Antioch and Iconium , who persuaded the people , and , having stoned Paul , drew him out of the city , supposing he had been dead .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' Antiyo ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Ai ' koniyan pon kon uyee ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya tʉwinɨkʉi ' nokon to ' mo ' ka ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan kon uya tɨ ' ke Paarʉ wɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ . Iyeri ' sa ' pe tekamai ' , to ' uya ipi ' sikʉ ' pʉ pata apai .

text: Howbeit , as the disciples stood round about him , he rose up , and came into the city : and the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe .
text2: E ' tane Sises apurɨnin nan utɨ ' pʉ Paarʉ piya ' . To ' amʉra ' pʉ iwoi . Iye ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan enna ' po ' pʉ pata pona to ' a ' kɨrɨ . Iyema ' sa ' yau , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas utɨ ' pʉ Terʉpi pona Restʉra ponsi ' kɨ .

text: And when they had preached the gospel to that city , and had taught many , they returned again to Lystra , and to Iconium , and Antioch ,
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , to ' uko ' mamʉ ' pʉ Sises ekareei Papa Maimu ekama pɨ ' . Tu ' kan kon nɨ kupʉ ' pʉ to ' uya Sises apurɨnin nan pe . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , enna ' pon pɨ ' to ' e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ Restʉra pona mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Ai ' koniyan pona mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Antiyo ' pona .

text: Confirming the souls of the disciples , and exhorting them to continue in the faith , and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Pata kaisarɨ rɨ Sises apurɨnin nan epopɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya . To ' meruntɨtanʉkʉ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon auro ' ka ' pʉ to ' uya itekare pɨ ' to ' pori ' ma pe , Sises rɨ apurɨ pɨ ' to ' uko ' manto ' pe . “ Urɨ ' nokon ekota ' mato ' pe iyesi Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe ya ' epa ' kan nɨto ' pe , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And when they had ordained them elders in every church , and had prayed with fasting , they commended them to the Lord , on whom they believed .
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya so ' si epuru pe te ' ton kon anʉmʉ ' pʉ . Tʉwɨpʉremai ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tenta ' nai ' pʉra tʉuserumai ' to ' tʉrʉ ' pʉ to ' uya to ' napurɨnʉ Itepuru ena ' .

text: And after they had passed throughout Pisidia , they came to Pamphylia .
text2: Pi ' sitiya itese ' pata poro tʉutɨ kon tʉpo , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas utɨ ' pʉ Panperiya pona .

text: And when they had preached the word in Perga , they went down into Attalia :
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon uya Pɨrʉka itese ' pata eporo ' pʉ , to ' uya Papa Maimu ekama ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , to ' utɨ ' pʉ parau e ' pi pona , to ' uya A ' tariya itese ' pata eporo ' pʉ .

text: And thence sailed to Antioch , from whence they had been recommended to the grace of God for the work which they fulfilled .
text2: A ' tariya ponsi ' kɨ kanau yau , parau kau to ' utɨ ' pʉ Antiyo ' pona rɨ marɨ te ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ kon ya ' . Mɨrɨ yau , to ' tʉrʉ ' pʉ Papa uya wakʉ nonkasa ' ya ' to ' tʉrawasooi to ' uya enuka ' nʉ ' sa ' na ' ne ' si ku ' nin pe to ' e ' to ' pe .

text: And when they were come , and had gathered the church together , they rehearsed all that God had done with them , and how he had opened the door of faith unto the Gentiles .
text2: Antiyo ' pona tʉuye ' sa ' kon a ' tai , tanporo apurɨnin nan amʉranʉkʉ ' pʉ to ' uya . Papa nʉkupʉ ' pʉ tʉporo ' nokon ekama ' pʉ to ' uya to ' pɨ ' , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen uya apurɨto ' pe ikupʉ ' pʉ iya rʉ ' pʉ .

text: And there they abode long time with the disciples .
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas pokon uko ' manpɨtʉ ' pʉ Antiyo ' po inke rɨ kapʉi tenno ' pɨ ' se , Sises pɨ ' enupasa ' kon mɨrɨ pata yawon kon piyau .

text: And certain men which came down from Judaea taught the brethren , and said , Except ye be circumcised after the manner of Moses , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Tʉron kon Sises apurɨnin nan utɨ ' pʉ Isutiya yapai Antiyo ' pona tʉtonpa kon enupase ' na , “ Ɨyun kon pi ' pɨ puturʉkasa ' auya ' nokon a ' tai rɨken , Mosi ' nekama ' pʉ awɨrɨ , Papa uya ɨpika ' tɨ kon , ” tase ' na .

text: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them , they determined that Paul and Barnabas , and certain other of them , should go up to Jerusalem unto the apostles and elders about this question .
text2: Serɨ uya , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas pokon sakoropa ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan pɨ ' to ' pokon pe to ' e ' sei ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas anʉmʉ ' pʉ to ' uya tʉron kon apurɨnin nan pokon pe , to ' utɨto ' pe Surusiran pona , enno ' sa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ so ' si epuru ton ense ' na to ' utɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ pɨ ' .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: Apurɨnin nan uya to ' ennoko ' pʉ . To ' utɨ koro ' tau Pini ' siya , Sameriya yawɨrɨ , Sises apurɨnin nan auro ' ka ' pʉ to ' uya , “ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen enasa ' man Sises apurɨnin nan pe , ” tukai ' . Tanporon kon epori ' ma ' pʉ ipan pe eta tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: To ' uye ' sa ' a ' tai Surusiran pona , to ' ereutanʉkʉ ' pʉ apurɨnin nan uya , enno ' sa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ so ' si epuru ton uya . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas uya to ' pɨ ' ekama ' pʉ tanporo Papa nʉkupʉ ' pʉ tʉporo ' nokon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen koro ' tau .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sises apurɨnin nan Pari ' si amʉ ' tonpa ton e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya ta ' pʉ , “ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen yun pi ' pɨ puturʉkato ' pe kuru rɨ iyesi mɨrɨ . Mosi ' nekama ' pʉ main apurɨto ' pe to ' uya ekama auya ' nokon kuru mɨrɨ to ' pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Serɨ pɨ ' ɨsenuminkase ' na itekare ekamai ' enno ' sa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ so ' si epuru ton amʉra ' pʉ .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Inke kuru tʉusaurokʉ kon tʉpo , Pi ' ta e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ , ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' , “ Utonpa ton , i ' tu auya ' nokon pena Papa uya uyanʉmʉ ' pʉ ɨ ' koro ' tapai ' nokon , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen uya itekare etato ' pe urɨ winɨ , to ' uya apurɨto ' pe nɨrɨ .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Papa , tanporon usenuminkato ' i ' tunin uya enpoika ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen anʉmʉ tʉuya Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ tʉrʉ tʉuya winɨ to ' pona , urɨ ' nokon pɨ ' ikupʉ ' pʉ tʉuya kasa .

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Tʉron nɨ pe uku ' sa ' iya ' nokon pʉra rɨ iyesi kamoro piyapai . To ' ewan korʉka ' pʉ iya to ' uya apurɨto ' winɨ .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ pe ken si iyesi pɨ ' Papa i ' tupɨtʉ i ' se ɨwesi kon ? Sa ' man pe rɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen apurɨnin nan kupʉ i ' se ɨwesi kon mɨrɨ , urɨ ' nokon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ukʉipʉnʉ kon nʉkupʉ ' pʉ pen nɨ .

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: Kane ! Apurɨ Itepuru Sises uya wakʉ nonkasa ' poro epika ' tɨn nɨsa ' , to ' kasa rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Tanporo iyamʉrasa ' kon esi ' pʉ e ' pana Panapas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Paarʉ eta pɨ ' i ' tuto ' ipɨkɨrɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ a ' kwarʉpɨ ' nin ku ' sa ' Papa uya tʉporo ' nokon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen koro ' tau ekama tane to ' uya .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: To ' e ' nonkasa ' a ' tai , Isens usaurokʉ ' pʉ , “ Utonpa ton , uyetatɨ ' .

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Saiman nekamayan ko upɨ ' nokon , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen pɨ ' ‘ aiko ’ tato ' tʉuya enpoika Papa uya , to ' tonpa ton anʉmʉ tʉuya winɨ tʉmunkɨ pe to ' e ' to ' pe .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Serɨ si esi serɨ pena pu ' kena ' amʉ ' nʉmenuka ' pʉ awɨrɨ . Iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' kasa :

text: After this I will return , and will build again the tabernacle of David , which is fallen down ; and I will build again the ruins thereof , and I will set it up :
text2: “ ‘ Serɨ tʉpo , enna ' poto ' oton Tepi ' iwʉ ' rʉ ' pʉ uta ' mo ' kasa ' konekase ' na , mɨrɨpan a ' motasa ' amɨ uya emenna ' pe , inna ' po uya pena iyesi ' pʉ kasa .

text: That the residue of men might seek after the Lord , and all the Gentiles , upon whom my name is called , saith the Lord , who doeth all these things .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ka ' pon amʉ ' tonpa rʉ ' san uya Itepuru warinpato ' pe , tanporo kamoro Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen urɨ iwano ' pe to ' esi , tasa ' Itepuru uya , serɨ ku ' nin nʉ ' pʉ uya ’

text: Known unto God are all his works from the beginning of the world .
text2: Pena rɨ isi ' tusa ' rʉ ' pʉ serɨ .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: “ Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , mɨrɨ pɨ ' ekonekasa ' man : sa ' man pe iku ' pai pʉra man Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen pona nera ' tɨyai ' ne ' nan Papa winɨkʉi ' .

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' to ' ena ' imenukapai ' nokon , to ' auro ' kapai ' nokon ɨri kiyari ika ' sa ' ena ' itʉsa ' pɨ ' to ' enta ' na namai ' ; tekumai ' makoi tʉku ' se pʉra to ' e ' to ' pe ; terupatu ' kai ' iwɨsa ' o ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ mʉnʉ ' pan pɨ ' to ' enta ' na namai ' .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Papa uya Mosi ' repa ' pʉ ike Main ekama pɨ ' ka ' pon amʉ ' nʉko ' manyan pena si ' kɨrɨ rɨ , Sapa ' kaisa rɨ usenupan nɨto ' iwʉ ' tau pata kaisarɨ rɨ serɨ pʉ ' kʉ pona rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , enno ' sa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ so ' si epuru ton , tanporo so ' si tawon kon pona rɨ nɨrɨ , wakʉ pe poken iyesi ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' anʉnto ' pe to ' uya tʉ ' koro ' tapai ' nokon , mɨrɨpan kon uya to ' ennoko ' pʉ Antiyo ' pona Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas a ' kɨrɨ . Asa ' ron kon anʉmʉ ' pʉ to ' uya : Isutas , Pa ' sapas tato ' ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas , tʉtonpa kon epuru pe te ' san .

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon enau kareta ennoko ' pʉ to ' uya se tawon si : “ Ina , enno ' sa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ so ' si epuru ton , ɨrunan kon uya , ‘ Miyarɨ ' nokon , ’ ina tonpa ton pe iyenasa ' kon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen Antiyo ' , Siriya , Siri ' siya pon kon .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: Ina uya etasa ' man ina nennoko ' san pen nɨ utɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ ya ' amanenpase ' na ' nokon , ɨusenuminkato ' kon tʉmanenpai ' .

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: Mɨrɨ wenai , tanporo ina e ' kupʉ ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' anʉmʉ pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan kon ennoko ' pʉ ina uya ɨmiyamoro piya ' , Panapas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Paarʉ pokon a ' kɨrɨ ,

text: Men that have hazarded their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: ka ' pon amʉ ' tʉuma ' tato ' kon pɨ ' tenari ' nʉnsan pen nɨ pena iyepa ' kaka ' sa ' kon nɨ mɨrɨ yai , uyepuru kon Sises Kʉrai ese ' wenai .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: “ Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ina uya Isutas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas ennoko mɨrɨ , kareta ina nʉmenuka ' pʉ enpoikase ' na tʉnta kon yai .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: Wakʉ poken iyesi ' pʉ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ina pona , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon pona e ' tape ' ne ' rɨ tʉrʉ namai ' i ' se e ' nɨto ' entai rɨ .

text: That ye abstain from meats offered to idols , and from blood , and from things strangled , and from fornication : from which if ye keep yourselves , ye shall do well . Fare ye well .
text2: Papa tato ' pe ipɨ ' ika ' sa ' ena ' use ' man nɨsa ' rʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' kenta ' natʉu ; mɨrɨ pona mʉn pɨ ' kenta ' natʉu , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ o ' erupatu ' kasa ' rʉ ' pʉ nɨrɨ ; tekumai ' nɨrɨ ke ' makoimatʉu . Wakʉ pe ɨwesi kon mɨrɨ serɨ ton apanama ' pʉ kon awɨron pe ɨwesi kon yau . Ɨisirɨ ina ne ' nonkayan , wakʉ pe si tanporo mɨko ' mantʉi ' , ” tawon .

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Asakɨrɨ ' nan kon warawo ' amʉ ' ennoko ' pʉ to ' uya Antiyo ' pata pona . To ' amʉrasa ' a ' tai tanporo so ' si ta ' , kareta tʉrʉ ' pʉ to ' uya to ' ena ' ,

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: mɨrɨpan ekama to ' uya a ' tai , to ' epori ' ma ' pʉ tʉpika ' tɨnin kon pe main esi pɨ ' .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Sairas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Isutas , pu ' kena ' pe te ' san uya eke pe rɨ to ' pika ' tɨ ' pʉ . Meruntɨ pe rɨ tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' kupʉ ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: To ' uko ' mamʉ tʉpo mɨrɨ yau , to ' tonpa ton uya to ' ennoko ' pʉ tʉusewankamai ' pʉra to ' utɨto ' pe tenno ' nin nʉ ' san kon piya ' .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: Mɨrɨ e ' tane , Sairas ekoneka ' pʉ mɨrɨ yau rɨ tʉuko ' manto ' pe .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: E ' tane Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panapas pokon e ' nɨmɨ ' pʉ Antiyo ' po . Mɨrɨ yau , tu ' kan kon pokon pe esii ' ma enupan pɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Itepuru Sises maimu ekama pɨ ' rɨ to ' esi ' pʉ .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ uya ta ' pʉ Panapas pɨ ' , “ Enna ' ponpai utonpa kon amʉ ' ka ' kʉranpase ' na tanporo pata kaisarɨ Itepuru Maimu ekama ne ' taine ' awɨrɨ , ikupʉ to ' uya ense ' na , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Panapas esi ' pʉ Isaan , Ma ' tukai ' tesa ' sen arɨ i ' se ta ' kɨrɨ ' nokon ,

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: e ' tane Paarʉ pona ipoken pʉra iyesi ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra tʉnɨnsa ' iya ' nokon pɨ ' Panperiya yau iye ' tʉrawasoma pʉra iyesi ' pʉ to ' a ' kɨrɨ .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Ipan pe ɨsɨ pe to ' e ' sei ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ wenai , to ' e ' nonka ' pʉ ɨsipiyapai ; Panapas uya Ma ' anʉmʉ ' pʉ tisakon pe . To ' utɨ ' pʉ kanau yau Sai ' pʉras pona ;

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: e ' tane Paarʉ uya Sairas anʉmʉ ' pʉ . Sises apurɨnin nan uya to ' tʉrʉ ' pʉ Itepuru uya wakʉ nonkasa ' ya ' . Mɨrɨpan kon nin si utɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: To ' utɨ ' pʉ Siriya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Siri ' siya awɨrɨ , apurɨnin nan meruntɨtanʉkʉ pɨ ' .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas pokon utɨ ' pʉ Siri ' siya itese ' pata ponsi ' kɨ Terʉpi pona , mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ Restʉra pona Sises apurɨnin Temu ' ti itese ' pata ' se ' ya ' . Isan esi ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' tonpa pe , Sises apurɨnin , e ' tane ikʉipʉnʉ esi ' pʉ Kiri ' pe .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Itekare apurɨnin nan , Restʉra mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Ai ' koniyan pon kon uya , “ Wakʉ kʉrɨ rɨ Temu ' ti , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: Ta ' kɨrɨ tʉron nɨ pata ya ' ne Temu ' ti mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas anapai Paarʉ esi ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya Temu ' ti yun pi ' pɨ puturʉka ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ kupʉ ' pʉ iya , Temu ' ti uya ekamʉra mɨrɨ pata yau te ' san Esuwerʉ amʉ ' e ' kupʉ emapu ' tɨ namai ' , apʉne pʉra Esuwerʉ pe pʉra ikʉipʉnʉ esi uya iku ' sa ' pe pʉra to ' uya i ' tu ' pʉ .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , pata kaisa rɨ to ' usarɨ ' pʉ . Surusiran pon kon enno ' sa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ so ' si epuru ton nʉkoneka ' pʉ main Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen napurɨ ton pe iku ' sa ' ekama pɨ ' to ' esi ' pʉ pata kaisa rɨ .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Mɨrɨ pɨ ' , Sises apurɨnin nan umeruntɨta ' pʉ apurɨto ' tʉuya ' nokon yau , mɨrɨpan kon epirikʉ ' pʉ tu ' ke rɨ wʉi kaisa rɨ .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itonpa ton utɨ ' pʉ Pʉrekiya nono poro mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Kare ' siya itese ' pata epose ' na , apʉne pʉra Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ esi ' pʉ Sises ekareei ekama to ' uya i ' se pʉra Eisa po .

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iya ' kɨrɨ te ' san uya Maisa itese ' pata eposa ' a ' tai , Pi ' tiniya itese ' pata ya ' itɨpai to ' esi ' pʉ , e ' tane Sises A ' kwarʉ esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ ya ' to ' utɨ i ' se pʉra .

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , to ' utɨ ' pʉ to ' sarɨ rɨ Maisa poro , mɨrɨpan kon epa ' ka ' pʉ Tʉrowas pona .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: Ewarupɨ nau , Papa uya ka ' pon Ma ' sitoniya pon ento ' pe Paarʉ enu a ' kwaka ' pʉ . Ka ' pon e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' ene ' pʉ iya ata ' kwarʉkase ' na , “ Ma ' sitoniya pona ina ipika ' tɨtanʉ ' kɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Paarʉ enu uta ' kwaka ' pʉ tʉpo , inke pʉra rɨ Ma ' sitoniya pona tʉutɨto ' kon pe ina e ' kama ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra ina uya i ' tu ' pʉ Papa esi mɨrɨ yau ina uya itekare ekama i ' se tukai ' .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Ina ekanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ kanau ya ' Tʉrowas po , mɨrɨpan parau nɨ ' kwɨrɨ ' nʉkʉ ' pʉ ina uya opa ' wʉ Samo ' tʉres itese ' pona . Iyema ' sa ' yau , ina utɨ ' pʉ Niya ' pores itese ' pata pona kanau yau .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , ina utɨ ' pʉ makʉi ' Piri ' pai itese ' pata pona , Roman amʉ ' neporo ' pʉ . Eke pe kuru serɨ pata esi ' pʉ Ma ' sitoniya po . Inke rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ wʉi ina uko ' manpɨtʉ ' pʉ Piri ' pai yau .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Ina utɨ ' pʉ pata apai tuna tʉu ' tɨsen e ' pi pona Sapa ' a ' tai , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' ɨpʉremato ' pata ' se ' eporo i ' se ina esi ' pʉ . Ina ereutapɨtʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan usauro ' nɨ pɨ ' ina e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ mɨrɨ yau , iyamʉrasa ' kon uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' pokon pe .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , tikin nan to ' tonpa ina maimu eta pɨ ' te ' sen esi ' pʉ , Retiya itese ' , Taya ' tira itese ' pata winon , tʉtariren pon atʉ kʉrʉpo ' poma pɨ ' te ' sen . Retiya esi ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' tonpa pen nɨ , e ' tane rɨ Papa pɨ ' tʉwɨpʉremasen pe iyesi ' pʉ . Paarʉ nekamanʉ Sises ekareei apurɨto ' pe iya Itepuru uya itewan a ' koka ' pʉ .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Retiya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itiwʉ ' tau te ' san pa ' taisima ina uya tʉpo , tiwʉ ' ta ' ina kɨ ' ma ' pʉ iya . “ Itepuru Sises apurɨnin pe esi tukai ' i ' tu auya ' nokon pɨ ' si , uiwʉ ' ta ' ɨsi ' tɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya . Ina utɨto ' pe tiwʉ ' ta ' ina kuu ' pʉ iya .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Tʉron nɨ a ' tai , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' ɨpʉremato ' ya ' ina utɨ a ' tai , to ' poitorʉ pe te ' sen uri ' san eporo ' pʉ ina uya , makoi a ' kwarʉ yen pe iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan esi ' pʉ pena rɨ te ' ku ' ton i ' tunin pe . Itesa ' pe te ' san uya eke pe pʉrata eporo esi ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra ka ' pon amʉ ' uya e ' ma ' pʉ to ' ena ' te ' ku ' sen ekamato ' pe iya .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Pʉse rɨ uri ' san uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itonpa ton e ' ma ' pʉkapɨtʉ ' pʉ inke ɨkɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉi ' ma , “ Pʉsamoro ka ' pon amʉ ' esi Eke Papa poitorʉ ton pe , mɨrɨpan kon uya epika ' tɨn nɨto ' eseru ekama ! ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Inke rɨ mɨrɨ ta pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ Paarʉ tanpokʉmai ' , mɨrɨpan era ' tɨ ' pʉ makoi a ' kwarʉ yen winɨkʉi ' , mɨrɨpan uya , “ Sises Kʉrai ese ' yau ayauro ' ka uya , pʉse uri ' san apai epa ' ka ' ! ” ta ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , makoi a ' kwarʉ epa ' ka ' pʉ iyapai .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: Itesanon uya serɨ enta ' tʉpʉrataai kon epoto ' iya oton pen tukai ' i ' tusa ' a ' tai , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas a ' si ' pʉ to ' uya . To ' pi ' sikʉ ' pʉ to ' uya kʉrʉpo ' po pɨ ' e ' nɨto ' pata ' se ' ya ' eke ton pata esanon piya ' .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Roman amʉ ' epuru ton piya ' to ' arɨ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon uya , “ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pʉsamoro , e ' tane upata ' se ' kon yawon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' anpokʉma to ' uya .

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: Utonpa kon amʉ ' enupa to ' uya urɨ ' nokon Roman amʉ ' nʉkupʉnʉ pen nɨ ku ' to ' pe to ' uya , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , anpisin ton ka ' pon amʉ ' e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ to ' tonpa pe Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas ewa ' noma pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan itepuru ton uya soisa amʉ ' apiyontɨ ' pʉ to ' pon kara ' pɨ ' to ' pe to ' uya , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' ari ' po ' pɨ ' to ' pe to ' uya .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Ɨsɨ pe to ' ari ' po ' pɨtʉ tʉpo , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas a ' si ' pʉ to ' uya pariki ' si ta ' . Itepuru ton uya to ' a ' sinin auro ' ka ' pʉ , wakʉ pe to ' erasuntɨto ' pe iya .

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Main etasa ' tʉuya a ' tai , i ' na ' kuru to ' ennin uya to ' ewonnʉkʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya yʉi akʉ ' pɨ ' sa ' yai ' ne to ' pʉrakon amʉ ' enpa ' kapɨtʉ ' pʉ , ti ' si kon amʉ ' amapɨtʉ to ' uya namai ' .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: Anomʉra ' a ' tai , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas esi ' pʉ eke pe ɨpʉreman pɨ ' . To ' userenka ' pʉ Papa apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya , tʉron kon a ' sisa ' kon esi ' pʉ to ' etapɨtʉ pɨ ' .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , pana ' pe tʉrʉ ' pʉnʉ esi ' pʉ , pariki ' si usi ' ki ' ma ' pʉ mɨrɨ , iyapon nɨ usi ' ki ' ma ' pʉ . Inke pʉra rɨ , pariki ' si mʉra ' ta amʉ ' uta ' kokapɨtʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ a ' sisa ' kon auronpɨ ' to ' ike i ' sen amʉ ' emo ' kapɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , a ' sisa ' kon esa ' upaka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan mʉra ' ta amʉ ' uta ' kokapɨ ' sa ' tense , tʉsuparaai mo ' ka ' pʉ tʉutapurukato ' pe ike , apʉne pʉra a ' sisa ' kon utɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ tukai ' tʉusenuminka ke .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: “ Ɨiwano ' pe rɨ , katapurukai , tanporo rɨ serɨ yau ina man ! ” tukai ' nin si Paarʉ ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨ .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Tʉweyu nin si i ' se a ' sinin ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨtʉ ' pʉ mɨrɨ , mɨrɨpan ewomʉ ' pʉ Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas pokon rakʉi ' iye ' sekunka ' pʉ e ' tɨtɨtɨ ' kai ' ma .

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: To ' enpa ' ka ' pʉ iya pariki ' si tapai , mɨrɨpan kon pɨ ' , “ Ɨ ' rɨ kuru tʉku ' se epika ' tɨto ' pe iyesi ? ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon uya , “ Itepuru Sises apurɨkɨ ɨyepika ' tɨ pa , ɨmɨrɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨiwʉ ' tau te ' san , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya ipɨ ' .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas uya Itepuru Sises ekareei ekama ' pʉ a ' sinin mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itiwʉ ' tawon kon pɨ ' .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai rɨ , a ' sinin uya to ' arɨ ' pʉ to ' ari ' po ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ pata ' pʉ korʉkase ' na . Inke pʉra rɨ mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas uya kʉrɨ rɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itiwʉ ' tawon kon pa ' taisima ' pʉ .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas arɨ ' pʉ a ' sinin uya tiwʉ ' ta ' to ' a ' re ' tɨi ' . Papa apurɨ tʉuya pɨ ' nin si ipan pe pori ' pe iyesi ' pʉ mɨrɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itonpa ton nɨ nɨrɨ .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Mɨrɨ ema ' sa ' yau , itepuru ton uya pʉresiman amʉ ' ennoko ' pʉ a ' sinin piya ' . “ Tɨwɨ kamoro ka ' pon amʉ ' nʉtɨi , ” tawon main esa ' pe .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas pɨ ' , “ Itepuru amʉ ' uya uyapiyontɨsa ' man ɨyenno ' to ' kon pe uya , mɨrɨpan yau entantɨ ' rɨ si , tʉusewankamai ' pʉra , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: E ' tane Paarʉ uya pʉresiman amʉ ' maimu eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Ɨri ku ' sa ' ina uya pʉra rɨ iye ' tane , soisa amʉ ' uya anpisin koro ' tau ina ari ' po ' pɨ ' to ' pe to ' uya , to ' auro ' ka ' pʉ ! Roman amʉ ' ina e ' tane pariki ' si ta ' ina a ' si ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon esi ama ' ai ina ennoko i ' se . Kane ! Tɨwɨ Roman amʉ ' epuru ton nʉyepʉi ina enpa ' kai ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , pʉresiman amʉ ' epuru ton enna ' po ' pʉ Paarʉ maimu rʉ ' pʉ ekamai ' Roman amʉ ' epuru ton pɨ ' . Roman amʉ ' ina , tasa ' Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas uya etasa ' tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , to ' usenari ' pa ' pʉ .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' ɨri pe rɨ ina e ' sa ' man tase ' na . Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas enpa ' ka ' pʉ to ' uya pariki ' si tapai , mɨrɨpan kon pɨ ' , “ Entantɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: Pariki ' si tapai tepa ' ka kon tʉpo , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas pokon utɨ ' pʉ Retiya iwʉ ' ta ' , mɨrɨpan kon e ' seporo ' pʉ tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' pokon pe . To ' auro ' ka tʉpo to ' pori ' ma pe , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas utɨ ' pʉ Piri ' pai apai .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas utɨ ' pʉ Anpi ' pores mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ A ' poroniya pata ton awɨrɨ . Tesaroni ' ka pata eposa ' to ' uya a ' tai , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' eporo ' pʉ to ' uya mɨrɨ pata yau .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: Te ' pɨ ' to ' kasa rɨ , Paarʉ utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' osorʉwau Sapa ' kaisa rɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' auro ' ka pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ iye ' menukasa ' itekare ke .

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Enpoika pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ Kʉrai ekota ' mato ' pe iyesi ' pʉ , ima ' tato ' pe iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨ tʉpo iye ' mʉ ' sa ' kato ' pe terikʉ ' pʉ apai iyesi ' pʉ nɨrɨ . “ Pʉse rɨ Sises kanyauro ' kayatʉi ' ne ' esi mɨrɨ Kʉrai pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Tʉron kon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' ena ' pʉ Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas pokon tonpa pe , tu ' kan kon nɨ Kiri ' amʉ ' Papa namanin nan pokon pe rɨ nɨrɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉnamai ' te ' san uri ' sami ' si amʉ ' rɨ nɨrɨ .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: E ' tane tʉron kon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' ɨkɨnta ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ɨri iteseru ton ka ' pon amʉ ' kan to ' utɨ ' pʉ kʉrʉpo ' po pɨ ' e ' nɨ pata ' se ' apai . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉranʉkʉ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon uya usewankaman nɨto ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨpan kon utɨ ' pʉ Ise ' sʉn iwʉ ' ta ' Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas warinpai ' , to ' ne ' to ' pe tʉuya ' nokon tu ' kan kon ka ' pon amʉ ' koro ' ta ' .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: E ' tane Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas eporo ' pʉ to ' uya pen . Mɨrɨ wenai , Ise ' sʉn pi ' sikʉ ' pʉ to ' uya . Tʉron kon nɨrɨ Sises apurɨnin nan ne ' sa ' nɨrɨ to ' uya esi ' pʉ eke ton itepuru ton piya ' . Tu ' kan kon ka ' pon amʉ ' ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ , “ Pʉsamoro manenpanin ku ' nin nan pata yau uye ' sa ' man serɨ yau .

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Ise ' sʉn uya to ' ereutanʉ ' sa ' tʉpiyau . Tu ' kan nɨ kupʉ ' pʉ to ' uya kin Sisa uya tasa ' poro pʉra . Ta to ' uya moro man tʉron nɨ kin , Sises tukai ' tesa ' sen ta to ' uya , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: Serɨ etasa ' pata epuru mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ anpisin ka ' pon amʉ ' uya a ' tai , to ' e ' sakoropa ' pʉ .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Ise ' sʉn mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uya pʉrata tʉto ' pe to ' kupʉ ' pʉ itepuru ton uya to ' nonkato ' pe to ' utɨto ' pe aka ' ne ' pe .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Ewarupɨ uye ' sa ' pe rɨ , to ' tonpa ton uya Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas ennoko ' pʉ Pereya pata pona . Pereya pata eposa ' tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sairas pokon utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Pereya pon kon Esuwerʉ amʉ ' esi wakʉ pe parɨ iteseru , ɨsenupapai parɨ Tesaroni ' ka pon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' entai , ipan pe Sises ekareei ɨnetapai to ' esi ' pʉ . Tɨwɨrɨ wʉi kaisa rɨ iye ' menukasa ' itekare warinpa pɨ ' to ' esi ' pʉ , i ' napai rɨ pe ' Paarʉ uya tenupato ' kon esi tukai ' .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Tu ' ke kuru Esuwerʉ amʉ ' uya itekare apurɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ eke ton Kiri ' pasi ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ warawoti ' si amʉ ' uya nɨrɨ apurɨ ' pʉ .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: Paarʉ uya Pereya po Papa Maimu ekama tukai ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' Tesaroni ' ka pon kon uya etasa ' a ' tai , to ' kanan utɨ ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' tʉrʉnkase ' na .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: E ' tane inke pʉra Paarʉ ennoko ' pʉ itonpa ton uya tʉron nɨ pata ya ' , e ' tane Sairas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Temu ' ti pokon uko ' manpɨtʉ ' pʉ Pereya po rɨ .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: Paarʉ apʉrʉnpanin nʉ ' san uya arɨ ' pʉ A ' tens itese ' eke pata pona , mɨrɨpan kon enna ' po ' pʉ Pereya pona Paarʉ maimu esa ' pe , “ Inke pʉra parɨ Sairas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Temu ' ti pokon uya uyepoto ' pe , ” tawon .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: To ' enupɨkɨrɨ Paarʉ esi koro ' tau A ' tens po , ipan pe rɨ ekamʉra iye ' kupʉ ' pʉ ika ' sa ' ton ɨpʉreman nɨto ' ton ipɨ ' ene tʉuya a ' tai mɨrɨ pata yau .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tau , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen Papa namanin nan pokon pe usauro ' nɨ pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ kʉrʉpo ' po pɨ ' e ' nɨto ' yau rɨ nɨrɨ , mɨrɨ ya ' tʉutɨpɨ ' san pokon pe wʉi kaisa rɨ .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Tʉron kon enupanin nan , E ' pi ' kuriyan tato ' ton ipɨ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron kon Si ' towi ' tato ' kon esi ' pʉ ipokon pe e ' sei ' pɨ ' nɨ pɨ ' inapurɨnʉ ton pɨ ' . Tʉron kon pʉsamoro uya , “ Ɨ ' rɨ si ta pʉse iya ' kwarʉ pʉn ka ' pon uya ? ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya . Tʉron kon uya ta ' pʉ , “ Tʉron nɨ papa pɨ ' ɨpʉreman nɨto ' pe enupan nɨ iya , tʉron nɨ pata awon kon kasa , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya . Serɨ ta ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' uya , apʉne pʉra wakʉ Sises e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ ekareei ekama Paarʉ uya pɨ ' .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ nee ' pʉ to ' uya Areyo ' pakas itese ' pata ' se ' ya ' . Mɨrɨ yau , “ Ina auro ' ka ' serɨ emenna ' ɨyekareei ke , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya ipɨ ' .

text: For thou bringest certain strange things to our ears : we would know therefore what these things mean .
text2: “ Ɨyekareei man ina netapɨtʉnʉ pe pʉra rɨ ; mɨrɨ wenai , ɨ ' rɨ kuru ta auya e ' kwa pe iyesi tukai ' ina pɨ ' enpoikakɨ , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: ( Tanporo A ' tens mɨrɨ tʉpo ka ' kʉran amʉ ' mɨrɨ yau tʉuko ' mansan esi ' pʉ tʉweyu kon enno ' pɨtʉ pɨ ' emenna ' itekare pɨ ' usauro ' nɨ pɨ ' . )

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ ka ' pon amʉ ' amʉrasa ' koro ' tau , Areyo ' pakas pata ' se ' yau , “ A ' tens pon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' ! Ɨyene uya ' nokon tanporo rɨ ɨpʉreman iya ' kwarʉ pe me ' atʉi ' ,

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: apʉne pʉra tanporo pata yau upinimʉ koro ' tau , ɨwɨpʉremato ' kon yau ene pɨ ' ɨuse ' mato ' kon apon eporo ' pʉ uya . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' iye ' menukasa ' ensa ' uya man , ‘ Ti ' tusen pen nɨ Papa ena ' , ’ tawon . Serɨ pe si ɨni ' tunʉ kon pen nɨ ɨpʉreman nɨto ' ipɨ ' ekareei ekama uya serɨ ɨpɨ ' nokon .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: “ Papa , non konekanin nʉ ' pʉ , tanporon Epʉn mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ non esi itiwano ' pe , mɨrɨpan uko ' mamʉ pen ka ' pon namɨ ' pʉ temiyatʉ ke ɨutɨ tau .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Papa esi mɨrɨ ka ' pon uya tʉrepa enupɨkɨron pen , apʉne pʉra tanporon nɨ i ' se iye ' to ' esi ipiyau , apʉne pʉra Papa kʉrɨ rɨ tanporon kon nɨ repanin uko ' man nɨ a ' kwarʉ ke .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Tikin nan Papa nʉkaa ' pʉ ka ' pon winɨ , tu ' ke ka ' pon amʉ ' epamʉ ' pʉ serɨ non po , serɨ non emʉ ' poro ' ne to ' uko ' manto ' pe . Pata weyu ton koneka ' pʉ iya iye ' to ' awɨrɨ ' ne . Pata ton nɨrɨ iye ' to ' airɨ ' ne ka ' pon uko ' manto ' yau pe ' ne .

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: Serɨ kupʉ ' pʉ iya , to ' uya tʉwarinpato ' pe , to ' uya rɨ iwarinpa tʉuya ' nokon koro ' tau epoto ' pe , ɨnnɨ pʉra rɨ Papa e ' tane upiyapai ' nokon .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: ‘ Kʉrɨ rɨ uriya ' uko ' man nɨ , upinin nɨ , nurɨne e ' nɨ . ’ Imenukanin , ɨtonpa kon pe te ' sen uya , ‘ Urɨ ' nokon kamoro ipayan nʉ ' san , ’ tasa ' na ' ne ' kasa rɨ .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: “ Papa nʉkoneka ' san pe e ' nɨ wenai , usenuminkan poken pʉra iyesi ika ' sa ' pe iyesi tukai ' ; korʉ , tɨ ' , mɨrɨ pe pʉra sirʉpa , ka ' pon nʉkoneka ' pʉ ɨpʉreman nɨto ' pe e ' tane nurɨne pʉra iyesi .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Pena a ' tai , ka ' pon amʉ ' uya ti ' tu pʉra iyesi pɨ ' , Papa uya to ' enpɨtʉ ' pʉ , ɨ ' rɨ pe to ' tʉku ' se pʉra rɨ . E ' tane si serɨ pe , mɨ yawɨron kon nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' , ‘ Amakooi kon apai era ' tɨka ' tɨ ' ! ’ ta iya .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Apʉne pʉra tikin nɨ wʉi tʉweyu ku ' sa ' iya ka ' pon amʉ ' eseru aimenkato ' tʉuya weyu pe , serɨ ku ' ton ka ' pon epoka ' sa ' Papa uya tiwano ' pe ka ' pon amʉ ' uya apurɨto ' pe . Papa uya tʉnanʉmʉ ' pʉ enpoikasa ' to ' enu ya ' , i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka tʉuya winɨ iyerikʉ ' pʉ apai , ” ta ' pʉ Paarʉ uya .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' uya iyeri ' sa ' kon e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ ta iya eta a ' tai , isapema pe to ' uta ' kɨrɨ ' pʉ , e ' tane tʉron kon uya , “ Serɨ ekareei parɨ ɨnetapai ina man , ” ta ' pʉ .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ epa ' ka ' pʉ usauro ' nɨto ' pata apai .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: Tu ' kan kon pen nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' ena ' pʉ Paarʉ pɨkɨron kon pe , mɨrɨpan kon uya nɨrɨ Sises apurɨ ' pʉ . To ' koro ' tau Sises apurɨnin pe iyenasa ' ese ' esi Tayano ' siyas , Areyo ' pakas itese ' konsʉrʉ amʉ ' tonpa pe te ' sen , Tamares itese ' nɨrɨ uri ' san , mɨrɨ tʉpo tʉron kon uya rɨ nɨrɨ Sises apurɨ ' pʉ .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Serɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ uya A ' tens nɨmɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan tʉpo Koren pata pona itɨ ' pʉ .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , A ' kira itese ' , Esuwerʉ eporo ' pʉ iya , Pontas pon , pena pʉra iye ' sa ' kon I ' tari pata winɨpai tʉno ' pʉ Pʉre ' sira a ' kɨrɨ , apʉne pʉra Roman pata epuru Kʉrautiyas itese ' uya tanporo Esuwerʉ amʉ ' epa ' kato ' pe tasa ' pɨ ' . Paarʉ utɨ ' pʉ A ' kira mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Pʉre ' sira ense ' na .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: Tʉkasa ta ' porin ton ka ' pɨ ' nin pe to ' esi wenai , to ' piyau e ' tʉrawasoman pɨ ' iko ' mamʉ ' pʉ .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: Tɨwɨrɨ Sapa ' kaisa rɨ ' ne Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Kiri ' amʉ ' pokon pe itekare pɨ ' usauro ' nɨ pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ , Sises esi pika ' tɨnin pe enno ' sa ' tukai ' to ' enu ya ' enpoika i ' se tesi wenai .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Sairas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Temu ' ti uye ' sa ' a ' tai Paarʉ piya ' Ma ' sitoniya pata apai , Paarʉ uya tʉweyu ennoko ' pʉ itekare rɨken ekama pɨ ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pɨ ' , Sises , kʉrɨ rɨ Kʉrai , tukai ' enpoika ' pʉ iya .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: E ' tane Esuwerʉ amʉ ' e ' sara ' tɨ a ' tai ɨri pe , ipa ' nʉkʉ pe Paarʉ pɨ ' usauro ' nɨ pɨ ' , Paarʉ uya tʉpon tɨutɨ ' pʉ , Papa uya to ' nonkasa ' ekamanin pe . “ Ɨiwano ' kon pe rɨ aumakoita kon ɨmʉnʉ kon utɨ emapu ' tɨ auya ' nokon ke , urɨ iwano ' pe pʉra iye ' to ' oton Papa uya ɨponi ' sima kon a ' tai . Serɨ apai utɨto ' oton Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen piya ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ utɨ ' pʉ Ti ' tiyas Isa ' su ' tas , Esuwerʉ pen iwʉ ' ta ' itekare ekamai ' . Ti ' tiyas Isa ' su ' tas esi ' pʉ Papa pɨ ' tʉwɨpʉremasen pe , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' piyawon itiwʉ ' .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Kiri ' pas , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' epuru , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itiwʉ ' tau te ' san uya Sises apurɨ ' pʉ . Tu ' ke itekare etanin nʉ ' san Koren pon kon uya apurɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon epa ' taisima ' pʉ .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Tʉron nɨ a ' tai ewarupɨ nau , Itepuru Sises uya Paarʉ auro ' ka ' pʉ itenu uta ' kwakasa ' yau , “ Enari ' ke ' kesii . Asauro ' kɨ rɨ . E ' pana kesii ,

text: For I am with thee , and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee : for I have much people in this city .
text2: apʉne pʉra aya ' kɨrɨ e ' ai ' ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ ɨwɨnɨ pen mɨrɨ , apʉne pʉra tu ' ke ka ' pon amʉ ' man serɨ pata yau uyapurɨnin nan , ” tukai ' .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Paarʉ uko ' mamʉ ' pʉ tikin nɨ wʉipiya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ 6 kaisa rɨ kapʉi ipona Papa maimu ke to ' enupa pɨ ' .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Kariyo esi a ' tai Roman amʉ ' kopʉnaai pe , A ' kaya pata epuru pe a ' samʉtʉ ya ' tʉwenai , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' uya Paarʉ a ' si ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon uya inee ' pʉ ko ' tʉ pɨ ' e ' nɨ iwʉ ' ta ' .

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: “ Pʉse rɨ ka ' pon uya ka ' pon amʉ ' auro ' ka Papa pɨ ' to ' ɨpʉremato ' pe Main uya mɨrɨ kasa tasa ' pʉra rɨ iye ' tane , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: Paarʉ e ' sara ' tɨ rawɨrɨ usauro ' nɨ pɨ ' , Kariyo uya ta ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pɨ ' , “ Ɨri kuru rɨ , ipokena ' pen kuru rɨ ku ' sa ' Paarʉ uya wenai , ausaurokʉ kon a ' tai amaimu kon setai ' no .

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: E ' tane se pe rɨ usekama ' popɨ ' nɨ main ton pɨ ' mɨrɨ tʉpo ɨiwano ' kon ɨyeseru kon , ɨiwano ' kon pe rɨ ɨnkoneka ' pʉ kon pɨ ' rɨ ɨwesi kon wenai , ɨiwano ' kon pe ikonekatɨ ' . Serɨ waraino ɨyeseru kon aimenka uya pʉra man , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Kariyo uya to ' enpa ' ka ' pʉ .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Mɨrɨpan kon era ' tɨ ' pʉ , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' epuru a ' sise ' na , Sostenes itese ' , mɨrɨpan arɨ ' pʉ to ' uya ko ' tʉ pɨ ' e ' nɨto ' iwʉ ' tapai , mɨrɨpan ari ' po ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya ko ' tʉ pɨ ' e ' nɨto ' iwʉ ' pʉrorooi po . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' Kariyo usewankama ' pʉ pen nɨ .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: Paarʉ uko ' mamʉ ' pʉ inke rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ Koren pata po . Mɨrɨ yau , tʉtonpa ton tʉnɨnse itɨ ' pʉ kanau epotorʉ ' pʉ yau Siriya pona . Tʉutɨ rawɨrɨ , ti ' pai kiriri ' ka ' pʉ iya , Papa auro ' kasa ' tʉuya pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan a ' kɨrɨ Pʉre ' sira mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ A ' kira e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ itonpa pe .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: To ' uya E ' pe ' sas eporo ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ yau , Paarʉ uya Pʉre ' sira mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ A ' kira nɨmɨ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ yau , itɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' , itekare pɨ ' asauro ' se ' na Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pokon pe .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Inke parɨ iko ' manto ' pe to ' uya ekama ' po tane , e ' pai pʉra iyesi ' pʉ .

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: E ' tane tʉutɨkapʉ a ' tai , “ Papa eseru pe iyesi yau , uyepʉ kanan mɨrɨ ɨpiya ' nokon , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , iyekanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ kanau ya ' , mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ E ' pe ' sas poi .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Paarʉ uya Sisariya eposa ' a ' tai , iyekanwaka ' pʉ , “ Miyarɨ ! ” ka ' se ' na Sises apurɨnin nan pɨ ' Surusiran pona , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iu ' tɨ ' pʉ Antiyo ' pona .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Antiyo ' po inke rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ kanan tesi tʉpo , itɨ ' pʉ kanan mɨrɨ apai . Mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ Kare ' siya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Pʉresiya nono awɨrɨ ' ne , mɨrɨpan uya Sises apurɨnin nan meruntɨtanʉkʉ ' pʉ .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Mɨrɨ koro ' tau , A ' poros , Esuwerʉ pe te ' sen , Arisantiriya pon uyee ' pʉ E ' pe ' sas pona . Wakʉ pe kuru tʉusauro ' sen ye ' , iye ' menukasa ' itekare i ' tunin pe iyesi ' pʉ .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Papa eseru awɨrɨ kuru enupasa ' pe iyesi ' pʉ . Pana ' pe kuru nɨrɨ tʉusauro ' sen pe iyesi ' pʉ , iye ' to ' poro kuru Itepuru Sises eseru pɨ ' enupanin pe kuru nɨrɨ iyesi ' pʉ . Isaan Pa ' tes ekareei epa ' taisiman tawon nɨken i ' tunin pe iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: A ' poros e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ enari ' mʉra Sises ekareei ekama pɨ ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' tau . Pʉre ' sira mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ A ' kira uya etasa ' a ' tai , to ' uya ikɨ ' ma ' pʉ tiwʉ ' kon ta ' . Mɨrɨ pata yau , wakʉ pe parɨ Papa eseru enpoika ' pʉ to ' uya ipana ya ' .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: A ' poros esi a ' tai ɨtɨpai A ' kaya pata pona , E ' pe ' sas awon kon to ' tonpa ton uya ipori ' ma ' pʉ miyarɨ parɨ itɨto ' pe . To ' uya kareta menuka ' pʉ , mɨrɨ yau te ' san Sises apurɨnin nan ena ' to ' uya ereutanʉ ' to ' pe . Ipan pe kuru pata eporo iya a ' tai , kamoro wakʉ nonkasa ' winɨ apurɨnin pe iyenasa ' kon pika ' tɨnin pe iyesi ' pʉ ,

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: apʉne pʉra pana ' pe tʉusaurokʉ winɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' a ' kɨrɨ ipoken pʉra to ' e ' sa ' tukai ' . Iye ' menukasa ' itekare winɨpai enpoika ' pʉ iya Sises esi Kʉrai pe tukai ' .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: A ' poros esi koro ' tau Koren po , Paarʉ uya makʉi ' tʉutɨsen asanta anʉmʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan epa ' ka ' pʉ E ' pe ' sas pona . Mɨrɨ yau , Sises apurɨnin nan eporo ' pʉ iya ,

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: mɨrɨpan uya to ' ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ pe ' mepotantʉu Sises apurɨsa ' auya ' nokon a ' tai ? ” tukai ' . “ Kane , Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ esi moro tukai ' ina uya i ' tusa ' pʉra rɨ man , ” tukai ' to ' uya imaimu eikʉ ' pʉ .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: Paarʉ uya to ' ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Ɨ ' rɨ waraino epa ' taisiman nɨto ' ke ɨyepa ' taisima ' pʉ kon ? ” tukai ' . “ Isaan Pa ' tes uya epa ' taisiman nɨto ' ke ka ' pon amʉ ' enupa ' pʉ poro ina epa ' taisimasa ' , ” tukai ' to ' uya imaimu eikʉ ' pʉ .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: Paarʉ uya to ' maimu eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Isaan uya pa ' taisiman nɨto ' esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ makoi yapai ka ' pon amʉ ' era ' tɨto ' pe , to ' auro ' ka ' pʉ iya te ' ma ' pʉ pe tʉuye ' sen Sises tapurɨi ' to ' e ' to ' pe , ” ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Serɨ etasa ' to ' uya a ' tai , to ' epa ' taisima ' pʉ Sises ese ' yau .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: Paarʉ uya temiyatʉ ton nonka ' pʉ a ' tai to ' pona , Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ uyee ' pʉ to ' pona ' ne . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , to ' usaurokʉ ' pʉ tʉron nɨ ton main yai ' ne , mɨrɨpan kon uya Papa Maimu ekama ' pʉ .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: 12 kaisa rɨ iye ' to ' airɨ rɨ to ' esi ' pʉ .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: Paarʉ utɨ ' pʉ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' usenupato ' iwʉ ' ta ' E ' pe ' sas po , mɨrɨpan usaurokʉ ' pʉ enari ' mʉra osorʉwau kapʉi kaisa rɨ . To ' pɨ ' ipatakapɨtʉ ' pʉ iya , to ' uya ito ' ka ' nʉkʉ i ' se tesi wenai , Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe pɨ ' .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: E ' tane tʉron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' ena ' pʉ main ɨnetapai pʉra . To ' uya tewan kon sa ' mantanʉkʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon usaurokʉ ' pʉ ɨri pe Ite ' ma awɨron kon pɨ ' tu ' kan kon ka ' pon amʉ ' koro ' tau . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' si Paarʉ uya to ' nɨmɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya Sises pɨ ' enupasa ' kon arɨ ' pʉ ta ' kɨrɨ , mɨrɨpan kon esi ' pʉ tʉusenupa kon pe usauro ' pɨ ' nɨ pɨ ' tɨwɨrɨ wʉi kaisa rɨ Tiranas sikuruui tau .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: Serɨ kupʉ ' pʉ Paarʉ uya mɨrɨ asa ' rɨ wʉipiya kaisa rɨ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , tu ' kan kon nʉ ' kwɨ rɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Kiri ' amʉ ' , eke Eisa awɨrɨ tʉuko ' mansan uya Itepuru ekareei eta ' pʉ .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: E ' pe ' sas po Paarʉ esi a ' tai , eke tʉrawaso e ' kupʉ emapu ' tɨ ' pʉ Papa uya iporo .

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Enki ' sa amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ pon ton nɨ Paarʉ napurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ rɨ apɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya e ' ne ' ton piya ' to ' epi ' tɨpɨ ' nin pe . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , to ' eparan apai to ' usepi ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ , makoi a ' kwarʉ uya to ' nonkapɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau nɨrɨ , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' esi ' pʉ pata kaisa rɨ makoi a ' kwarʉ pa ' kapɨtʉ pɨ ' , Itepuru ese ' tesa ' pɨ ' se makoi a ' kwarʉ pa ' ka i ' se usi ' tupɨ ' nɨ pɨ ' to ' esi ' pʉ . Ta to ' uya , “ Itepuru Sises ese ' yau , Paarʉ itekareei nekamanʉ pe na ' ne ' , kʉrɨ rɨ ese ' yau epa ' ka ' , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: 7 kaisaron kon Sʉ ' kepa , use ' man nɨto ' Papa ena ' tʉrawasomanin nan epuru pe te ' sen munkɨ amʉ ' uya serɨ ku ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: E ' tane , makoi a ' kwarʉ uya to ' maimu eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Sises si ' tuyai ' , Paarʉ nɨrɨ si ' tuyai ' , e ' tane ɨnʉ ' yan ken ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon ? ” tukai ' .

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ka ' pon makoi a ' kwarʉ yen pe te ' sen e ' sanʉmʉ ' pʉ 7 kaisaron kon ka ' pon amʉ ' pona to ' entai tenai ' , ɨsɨ pe kuru rɨ to ' wɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ iya to ' pon ton tʉkarapɨ ' se , mɨrɨpan kon ainʉmʉ ' pʉ itiwʉ ' tapai , mʉn ennokoi ' ma .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Serɨ etasa ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Kiri ' amʉ ' tʉuko ' mansan E ' pe ' sas po uya a ' tai , ipan pe enari ' ke ' to ' ena ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ipan pe kuru Itepuru Sises ese ' nama ' pʉ to ' uya imeruntɨrʉ wenai .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Tu ' kan kon Sises apurɨnin nan pe iyenasa ' kon e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ uye ' nɨ pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan kon uya tʉmakooi kon ekama ' pʉ tʉron kon apurɨnin nan pana ya ' .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Tu ' kan kon piyai ' san amʉ ' eseru kupʉ pɨ ' iko ' mansa ' kon uya tu ' kan nɨ ɨri ekareei apon kareta amʉranʉkʉ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan po ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya annau . Pʉrata pe kareta ton epe ' i ' tu ' pʉ to ' uya a ' tai , 50 , 000 kaisa rɨ sirʉpa pun pe iyepa ' ka ' pʉ .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Serɨ winɨ Itepuru Sises ekareei utɨ ' pʉ miyarɨ rɨ pata yau , mɨrɨpan nɨrɨ usemo ' ka ' pʉ meruntɨ pe kuru .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Serɨ ton e ' kupʉ ' pʉ tʉpo , Paarʉ e ' kama ' pʉ utɨn pɨ ' Surusiran pona , Ma ' sitoniya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ A ' kaya poro , “ Surusiran pona tʉutɨ ' pʉ tʉpo , utɨ kuru mɨrɨ Ron pata pona , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Asa ' ron kon , Temu ' ti mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Erastas , tʉpika ' tɨnin nan ennoko ' pʉ iya tʉwapiya Ma ' sitoniya pona inke rʉ ' kwɨ parɨ ɨko ' mamʉi ' ma Eisa nono pata yau .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , ipan nɨ anpokʉmanin e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ Ite ' ma awɨron kon pɨ ' .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: E ' pe ' sas po iyesi ' pʉ ka ' pon , Temi ' tʉriyas itese ' , ɨpʉreman Arʉ ' times pɨ ' iwʉ ' ka ' pɨ ' nin sirʉpa ke , mɨrɨpan tonpa ton uya eke pe kuru pʉrata epopɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Temi ' tʉriyas uya tʉtonpa ton kɨ ' ma ' pʉ , mɨrɨ waraino rɨ marɨ itʉrawasooi ton to ' pokon pe tʉusauro ' to ' pe . Ta ' pʉ iya , “ Mi ' tuyatʉu pe ' utonpa ton , serɨ utʉrawasooi kon ikupʉ na ' ne ' winɨ eke pe pʉrata eporo uya ' nokon ?

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Miyarɨ rɨ ensa ' , etasa ' auya ' nokon E ' pe ' sas po rɨken pen , e ' tane siya rɨ Eisa pata awɨrɨ , tu ' kan kon ka ' pon amʉ ' uya apurɨto ' pe Paarʉ uya iku ' sa ' ka ' pon nʉkoneka ' pʉ ɨpʉreman nɨto ' ipɨ ' pe esi papa pe pʉra rɨ ta iya .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Ɨsɨ esi mɨrɨ yau , miyarɨ rɨ Paarʉ uya tato ' apurɨ pɨ ' ka ' pon amʉ ' esi a ' tai , urɨ ' nokon nʉkupʉnʉ enato ' oton tʉnamasen pe pʉra rɨ . Eke kuru uri ' san papa tukai ' tʉku ' sen Arʉ ' times iwʉ ' enato ' oton ka ' pon amʉ ' enu yau pʉra rɨ . Kamo rɨ nɨrɨ ika ' sa ' pɨ ' tʉwɨpʉremasan Eisa pata awɨrɨ ' ne , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ non emʉ ' kaisa rɨ nɨrɨ inamato ' pʉra rɨ iyenato ' oton , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Serɨ ta Temi ' tʉriyas uya eta tʉuya ' nokon a ' tai , to ' ena ' pʉ sakoro ' pe . Ukɨ ' pɨ ' nʉnpɨ ' nɨ pɨ ' to ' e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ , “ Eke kʉrɨ rɨ papa tato ' ipɨ ' pe ika ' sa ' , Arʉ ' times , ɨpʉreman nɨto ' kon ipɨ ' E ' pe ' sas po ! ” tukai ' .

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe rɨ , eke utanpokʉman esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ pata yau . Ka ' pon amʉ ' uya Kayas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Aresta ' kos a ' si ' pʉ , Paarʉ upinimʉ tonpa pe te ' san . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , anpisin ka ' pon amʉ ' enasa ' tikin nɨ uya Kayas mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Aresta ' kos pi ' sikʉ ' pʉ amʉran nɨto ' iwʉ ' ta ' .
