text2: Pu ' kena ' ton uya imenuka ' pʉ Kʉrai kota ' mato ' oton , mɨrɨ tʉpo , iwɨto ' oton , mɨrɨpan te ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ton terikʉ ' pʉ apai iyeri ' sa ' kon e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka tɨpiya pe Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen nɨ nɨrɨ pika ' tɨse ' na to ' weyu ekamai ' , tawon , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: Serɨ airɨ , Paarʉ wanʉ ' tɨpa ' pʉ kopʉna Pesʉ ' tas uya isekama koro ' tau . Ikɨ ' pɨ ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ , “ Ta ' kwarʉ ke pʉra me ' ai ' , Paarʉ ! ” tukai ' . “ Eke pe kuru ɨusenupasa ' ayano ' ma pɨ ' man . Mɨrɨ uya aya ' kwarʉ pʉra ɨku ' sa ' man , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: E ' tane , “ Uya ' kwarʉ pʉra esi pen serɨ , eke tʉnamasen Pesʉ ' tas , ” tukai ' Paarʉ uya imaimu eikʉ ' pʉ . “ E ' tane ukayai ' ne ' esi mɨrɨ i ' napairon pe kuru tʉto ' ka ' nʉ ' sen pe rɨ .

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Serɨ ton ukayai ' ne ' i ' tu ɨmɨrɨ , kin Akʉri ' pa uya mɨrɨ ; mɨrɨ wenai , usaurokʉ kuru rɨ , usaurokʉ nɨrɨ eta auya pe si ' tuyai ' . Sapurɨyai ' serɨ ton iye ' ku ' sa ' Sises pɨ ' i ' tu auya tukai ' , apʉne pʉra tu ' kan kon uya Sises pɨ ' iye ' ku ' sa ' etasa ' pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Paarʉ uya kin Akʉri ' pa ekama ' po ' pʉ , “ Pu ' kena ' ton nʉmenuka ' pʉ pe ' mapurɨyan ? Apurɨ auya pe kuru rɨ si ' tuyai ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: “ Inke pʉra pe ' Kʉri ' san pe enato ' pe ukupʉ auya tukai ' ɨusenuminka ? ” ta ' pʉ Akʉri ' pa uya Paarʉ pɨ ' .

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: “ Inke pʉra rɨ , mɨrɨ pe pʉra inke rɨ , ɨpʉrema serɨ Papa pɨ ' , ɨmɨrɨ rɨken pen e ' tane tanporo kamoro uyeta pɨ ' na ' ne ' nan nɨ marɨ serɨ pe , enato ' pe urɨ na ' ne ' kasa apurɨnin pe , a ' sisa ' pe pʉra rɨken , ” tukai ' Paarʉ uya imaimu eikʉ ' pʉ .

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Kin , kopʉna , Pones , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporon kon to ' a ' kɨrɨ te ' san e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ .

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Itau te ' to ' kon ɨutɨ nɨmɨ ' pʉ to ' uya , asaurokʉi ' ma tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' pokon pe . “ Pʉse rɨ uya ɨri rɨ tʉwɨto ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ta ' sito ' iwenai ku ' sa ' pʉra rɨ iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Akʉri ' pa uya ta ' pʉ Pesʉ ' tas pɨ ' , “ Pʉse rɨ uya Sisa uya tekama ' popɨ ' to ' pe tasa ' pʉra iyesi yau , inonka ' pʉ nesii ' no rɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Ina utɨto ' pe I ' tari pona tukai ' iye ' ku ' sa ' pe iyesi ' pʉ a ' tai , Paarʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron kon a ' sisa ' kon nonka ' pʉ to ' uya soisa amʉ ' epuru , Isuriyas itese ' ena ' , “ tamʉ ' tawon kon Sisa Soisaai Amʉ ' , ” tato ' kon .

text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium , we launched , meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia ; one Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
text2: Kanau epotorʉ ' pʉ ya ' ina ekanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ pata Atʉrami ' tiyan , Eisa awon apai . Kanau tʉutɨsen pe te ' sen ereutapɨtʉ ' pʉ Eisa awo ' nan tʉron nɨ ton nɨ pata ton yau . Aresta ' kos , Sises apurɨnin Tesaroni ' ka winon esi ' pʉ ina tonpa pe , Ma ' sitoniya apaino .

text: And the next day we touched at Sidon . And Julius courteously entreated Paul , and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself .
text2: Mɨrɨ ema ' sa ' yau , Saitan pata eporo ' pʉ ina uya . Mɨrɨ yau , Isuriyas uya Paarʉ auro ' ka ' pʉ mannʉ ' pe te ' se , tʉtonpa ton ense ' na itɨto ' pe inonka ' pʉ iya , i ' se rɨ iye ' to ' ke to ' uya ipika ' tɨto ' pe .

text: And when we had launched from thence , we sailed under Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
text2: Mɨrɨ apai , ina kanan utɨ ' pʉ parau po Sai ' pʉras opa ' wʉ pata winɨkʉi ' , mɨrɨ airɨ tʉtʉi pe iyesi pɨ ' , apʉne pʉra pana ' pe kuru a ' setun uyee ' pʉ ina winɨkʉi ' .

text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
text2: Parau po Siri ' siya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Panperiya poro iwa rɨ ina e ' kwɨrɨtʉ ' pʉ . Ina uya Maira eporo ' pʉ Iri ' siya awon .

text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy ; and he put us therein .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , soisa amʉ ' epuru uya Arisantiriya pata apai kanau uye ' sa ' eta ' pʉ . Utɨn pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ I ' tari winɨkʉi ' , mɨrɨpan ya ' ina kanwa ' tɨ ' pʉ iya .

text: And when we had sailed slowly many days , and scarce were come over against Cnidus , the wind not suffering us , we sailed under Crete , over against Salmone ;
text2: Inke rɨ wʉi tenno ' pɨ ' se tɨnɨn pɨ ' kuru ina utɨ ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Kʉnitas eporo i ' se ina usi ' tu ' pʉ , e ' tane pana ' pe kuru a ' setun uyee ' pʉ ; mɨrɨ wenai , to ' sa rɨ kanau utɨ ' pʉ pen ina utɨto ' ya ' . Kʉri ' opa ' wʉ winɨkʉi ' ina utɨ ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra a ' setun pʉra mɨrɨ poro iyesi pɨ ' , Sarʉmone nono utɨsa ' parau ka ' woi .

text: And , hardly passing it , came unto a place which is called The fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea .
text2: Mɨrɨ apai , ina utama ' pʉ sa ' man yau , pana ' pe rɨ a ' setun esi koro ' tau . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , ina uyee ' pʉ Wakʉ Peya ' tato ' ya ' , a ' ko pe pata Raseya piya ' rɨ .

text: Now when much time was spent , and when sailing was now dangerous , because the fast was now already past , Paul admonished them ,
text2: Oko pe ina esi emapu ' tɨ ' pʉ ɨsɨ pe a ' setun esi uya . Serɨ a ' tai ' ne rɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' useruma weyu pata ' pʉ pe iyesi ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ wenai , Paarʉ uya to ' auro ' ka ' pʉ :

text: And said unto them , Sirs , I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage , not only of the lading and ship , but also of our lives .
text2: “ Utonpa ton , ɨsɨ yau kuru e ' nɨ tukai ' senyai ' . A ' setun uya kanau , apuru , urɨ ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ ma ' tanʉkʉ poken iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship , more than those things which were spoken by Paul .
text2: E ' tane Paarʉ usauro ' to ' uya soisa amʉ ' epuru ewankama ' pʉ pen . “ Kanau anin mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ kanau esa ' uya auro ' kan nɨto ' awɨrɨ , utɨnpai ' nokon , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in , the more part advised to depart thence also , if by any means they might attain to Phenice , and there to winter ; which is an haven of Crete , and lieth toward the south west and north west .
text2: Kanau ereutato ' pata esi ' pʉ wakʉ pe iyau e ' nɨ poken pʉra , komi ' pe pata e ' to ' weyu e ' seposa ' a ' tai , tu ' kan kon uya , “ Miyarɨ rɨ utɨnpai ' nokon nɨ , ” ta ' pʉ . Pini ' kʉs itese ' pata Kʉri ' pon eporo tʉuya ' nokon tukai ' to ' esi ' pʉ , mɨrɨ yau komi ' pe pata e ' to ' weyu enno ' to ' pe tʉuya ' nokon . Serɨ Kʉri ' pata esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ asa ' ron winɨpai ɨsi ' ratoi pe kanau ereutapɨ ' to ' pata ' se ' pe .

text: And when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , loosing thence , they sailed close by Crete .
text2: Mararon A ' setun e ' sara ' tɨsa ' a ' tai uye ' nɨ pɨ ' , i ' se te ' ton kon uya teposa ' kon pe to ' uya ekama ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , wa ' ka pun kanau ku ' nin peten anʉmʉ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan utɨ ' pʉ Kʉri ' ka ' ta poro .

text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind , called Euroclydon .
text2: Inke kuru iye ' sa ' koro ' tau pʉra rɨ , pana ' pan a ' setun , kuranau warai uyee ' pʉ opa ' wʉ pata winɨpai kanau wɨse ' na , Wʉi Enu Enuku Enwo ' netʉ Winon A ' setun tukai ' tesa ' sen .

text: And when the ship was caught , and could not bear up into the wind , we let her drive .
text2: Kanau wɨnɨ ' pʉ iya pana ' pe , miyarɨ rɨ itɨto ' pʉra rɨ iye ' to ' temapu ' tɨi ' . Mɨrɨ pɨ ' , a ' setun uya kanau epotorʉ ' pʉ ato ' pe ina uya inonka ' pʉ .

text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda , we had much work to come by the boat :
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , wʉi enu enuku kamisi winɨkʉi ' aiko Kauta opa ' wʉri awɨrɨ ina utɨ ' pʉ , a ' setun pʉra mɨrɨ awɨrɨ iyesi wenai . Epika ' tɨn nɨto ' kanwa kupʉ poken pʉra iyesi pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ wenai , ina uya anʉmʉ ' pʉ kanau epotorʉ ' pʉ ya ' .

text: Which when they had taken up , they used helps , undergirding the ship ; and , fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands , strake sail , and so were driven .
text2: Kanau anʉmʉ tʉpo , to ' uya si ' na ' ke ewa ' tɨ ' pʉ kanau epotorʉ ' pʉ pona . Enari ' ke ' to ' esi ' pʉ ta ' muna kon Sɨritis wɨ ' sɨpu pona tukai ' . Kanau anin kareku nu ' tɨ ' pʉ to ' uya , tɨnɨn pɨ ' itɨto ' pe .

text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest , the next day they lightened the ship ;
text2: Miyarɨ rɨ pana ' pe a ' setun esi ' pʉ uye ' nɨ pɨ ' . Mɨrɨ ema ' sa ' yau , kanau pʉro ' po te ' sen ka ' pon amʉ ' apuruui ton ma ' kɨrɨ ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship .
text2: Itosorʉwano wʉi a ' tai , kanau apuruui amʉ ' ma ' kɨrɨ ' pʉ to ' uya kanau yapai asi ' ono pe parɨ kanau e ' to ' pe .

text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared , and no small tempest lay on us , all hope that we should be saved was then taken away .
text2: Inke kuru ewarupɨ pe pata esi ' pʉ ; wʉi enu e ' wei ' tɨ pʉra , sirikɨ amʉ ' nɨrɨ usene pʉra , apʉne pʉra a ' setun nɨ esi wenai uye ' nɨ pɨ ' . Inke rʉ ' kwɨ rɨ wakʉ pɨ ' te ' ku ' pɨtʉ kon tʉpo , ina e ' nonka ' pʉ .

text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them , and said , Sirs , ye should have hearkened unto me , and not have loosed from Crete , and to have gained this harm and loss .
text2: Inke ina enta ' nasa ' pʉra ina uko ' mansa ' koro ' tau , Paarʉ e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ to ' pɨ ' tase ' na , “ Utonpa ton , kanyauro ' katantʉune ' utɨnpai ' nokon pʉra Kʉri ' pata apai ukataine ' tetai ' pʉra ɨwesi ' pʉ kon . Epika ' tɨn nɨ nesii ' no , apuru ton nɨ uma ' ta pʉra nesii ' no .

text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer : for there shall be no loss of any man ' s life among you , but of the ship .
text2: E ' tane serɨ pe ɨpɨ ' nokon ta uya pana ' pe aya ' kwarʉ kon nesii , apʉne pʉra ɨnʉ ' rɨ uma ' ta pe pʉra iyesi . Kanau rɨken uma ' tato ' oton .

text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God , whose I am , and whom I serve ,
text2: Nesiine ' ewarupɨ nau , Papa , urɨ na ' ne ' itiwano ' pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ipoitorʉ pe e ' tʉrawasomayai ' ne ' inserʉʉi e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ upiyau .

text: Saying , Fear not , Paul ; thou must be brought before Caesar : and , lo , God hath given thee all them that sail with thee .
text2: ‘ Kenari ' nʉmʉi Paarʉ ! Me ' mʉ ' sa ' kai ' rɨ , ɨyekama ' popɨ ' to ' Sisa uya yau . Papa uya nɨrɨ tʉusentu ' ma wenai kamoro kanau yau iye ' sa ' kon aya ' kɨrɨ pika ' tɨsa ' mɨrɨ . ’

text: Wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for I believe God , that it shall be even as it was told me .
text2: Mɨrɨ wenai utonpa ton , kenari ' nʉntʉu ! Papa apurɨto ' uya esi pɨ ' iye ' kupʉ rɨ inserʉ nekama ' pʉ awɨrɨ . Mɨrɨ kasa kuru inserʉ uya uyauro ' ka ' pʉ mɨrɨ .

text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island .
text2: Mɨrɨ e ' tane rɨ , a ' munan pe man opa ' wʉ tonpa ton pona rɨ ; kanau rɨ uta ' morʉka , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven up and down in Adria , about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country ;
text2: 14 kaisaron wʉi yau , parau Atʉriyati ' po utɨn pɨ ' ina e ' tane , anomʉra ' kanau anin nan uya a ' mun pata eporo tukai ' i ' tu ' pʉ .

text: And sounded , and found it twenty fathoms : and when they had gone a little further , they sounded again , and found it fifteen fathoms .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , i ' tuto ' si ' na ' ton ennasikapɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya . Mɨrɨ a ' tai , to ' uya eporo ' pʉ 120 pi ' i ' nau iyesi tukai ' . Emennʉ ' pʉ iwa to ' uya kanan i ' tukaa ' pʉ ; 90 pi ' i ' nau iyesi tukai ' kanan to ' uya eporo ' pʉ .

text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and wished for the day .
text2: Tɨ ' pona sipa ' sipa uya ina arɨ tukai ' to ' enari ' nʉmʉ ' pʉ . 4 kaisaron ton wa ' ka pun kanau ku ' nin peten eno ' ma ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon enurikʉ ' pʉ pata emakʉ i ' se .

text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship ,
text2: Tapʉrʉnto ' kon pe kanau anin nan uya epika ' tɨn nɨto ' kanwa nu ' tɨ ' pʉ tuna ka ' , kanau a ' sinin ton nu ' tɨ tʉuya ' nokon pe itese ' .

text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , Except these abide in the ship , ye cannot be saved .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai , Paarʉ uya ta ' pʉ soisa amʉ ' epuru pɨ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ soisa amʉ ' pɨ ' rɨ , “ Pʉsamo kanau yau te ' tʉrawasomasan esi a ' tai rɨken kanau yau , ɨyepika ' tɨto ' oton kon mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
text2: Mɨrɨ pɨ ' , soisa amʉ ' uya si ' na ' ton akʉ ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ tuna ka ' epika ' tɨn nɨto ' kanwa uta ' mo ' kato ' pe .

text: And while the day was coming on , Paul besought them all to take meat , saying , This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting , having taken nothing .
text2: Pata emakʉ rawɨrɨ rɨ , tanporo to ' enta ' nato ' pe ta ' pʉ Paarʉ uya . “ 14 kaisa rɨ wʉi ɨwe ' sa ' kon sa ' man yau tenta ' nai ' pʉra , ” ta ' pʉ Paarʉ uya .

text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat : for this is for your health : for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you .
text2: “ Serɨ pe si enta ' natɨ ' ta uya ɨpɨ ' nokon , nurɨne ɨwesi kon pa . Ɨnʉ ' uya rɨ tikin nɨ rɨ ti ' pai i ' po ' eno ' mato ' oton pen mɨrɨ , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he took bread , and gave thanks to God in presence of them all : and when he had broken it , he began to eat .
text2: Serɨ ta ' pʉ tʉuya tʉpo , tʉyu anʉmʉ ' pʉ iya , tenki ta ' pʉ iya Papa pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan pɨ ' iyenta ' na ' pʉ tanporon kon enu airɨ .

text: Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took some meat .
text2: Tanporon kon pori ' ma ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨpan kon nɨrɨ enta ' na ' pʉ .

text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
text2: Tanporo 276 kaisa rɨ ina esi ' pʉ kanau yau .

text: And when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , and cast out the wheat into the sea .
text2: Tanporo i ' se te ' to ' kon pe tenta ' na kon tʉpo , to ' uya a ' nai ' , wi ' tato ' tʉnarɨnʉ kon ma ' kɨrɨ ' pʉ parau ka ' asi ' ono pe kanau enato ' pe .

text: And when it was day , they knew not the land : but they discovered a certain creek with a shore , into the which they were minded , if it were possible , to thrust in the ship .
text2: Pata ema ' sa ' a ' tai , a ' mun pata eposa ' tʉuya ' nokon to ' ka ' nʉkʉ to ' uya pʉra iyesi ' pʉ , e ' tane ikupai yau ite ' pi ene ' pʉ to ' uya . Miyarɨ rɨ kanau arɨ pɨ ' to ' e ' ku ' sa ' pe iyesi a ' tai , iyereuta nesii ' no a ' mun pona .

text: And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves unto the sea , and loosed the rudder bands , and hoised up the mainsail to the wind , and made toward shore .
text2: Wa ' ka pun kanau ku ' nin peten ewa ton akʉ ' pɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan nonka ' pʉ to ' uya parau ka ' . Mɨrɨ a ' tai ' ne rɨ , kanau a ' sito ' ike ewa ton amʉ ' eukapɨtʉ ' pʉ to ' uya . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , iputu pon kanau anin kareku i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ to ' uya , a ' setun uya tato ' kon pe parau ka ' ta pona .

text: And falling into a place where two seas met , they ran the ship aground ; and the forepart stuck fast , and remained unmoveable , but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves .
text2: E ' tane kanau putu a ' muna ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ apai , iye ' wʉrʉuka ' pʉ pen , pana ' pe sipa ' sipa e ' wɨpɨtʉ uya iyaure i ' kwɨtʉ ' pʉ ipʉra .

text: And the soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
text2: Soisa amʉ ' e ' kupʉ ' pʉ a ' sisa ' kon wɨnɨ pɨ ' tʉupɨnʉnse to ' apʉrʉmʉ namai ' ,

text: But the centurion , willing to save Paul , kept them from their purpose ; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea , and get to land :
text2: e ' tane soisa amʉ ' epuru esi ' pʉ Paarʉ ɨnpika ' tɨpai , mɨrɨpan nɨrɨ esi ' pʉ a ' sisa ' kon wɨnɨ soisa amʉ ' uya i ' se pʉra , mɨrɨ pɨ ' to ' ereutanʉkʉ ' pʉ iya . Kamoro tʉupɨnʉnsan pɨ ' , “ Ainʉntɨ ' tuna ka ' ɨupɨnʉmʉ kon pa a ' mun pona , ” ta ' pʉ soisa amʉ ' epuru uya .

text: And the rest , some on boards , and some on broken pieces of the ship . And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
text2: To ' tonpa ton nin si utɨto ' pe to ' pɨkɨrɨ iye ' kwɨ ' pɨ ' sa ' ton paranka pɨ ' tʉuta ' sipɨ ' se , serɨ ta itepuru uya awɨrɨ ina e ' sa ' wenai , a ' mun eporo ' pʉ ina uya wakʉ pe rɨ .

text: And when they were escaped , then they knew that the island was called Melita .
text2: Wakʉ pe kuru ina uya pata eposa ' a ' tai , ina uya Marʉ ' ta itese ' mɨrɨ opa ' wʉ tukai ' i ' tu ' pʉ .

text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness : for they kindled a fire , and received us every one , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
text2: Patawon amʉ ' uya wakʉ pe kuru ina ereutanʉkʉ ' pʉ . Apo ' po ' tɨ ' pʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨpan kon uya ina kɨ ' ma ' pʉ a ' nose ' na , apʉne pʉra tuna pe , ikomi ' pe nɨrɨ pata esi pɨ ' .

text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks , and laid them on the fire , there came a viper out of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
text2: Paarʉ uya apo ' pe te ' ton amʉranʉ ' sa ' a ' tai , ɨsɨ kuru ɨkʉi esi ' pʉ i ' koro ' tau . A ' ne ' uya enpa ' ka ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uta ' si ' pʉ itemiyatʉ pɨ ' .

text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand , they said among themselves , No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he hath escaped the sea , yet vengeance suffereth not to live .
text2: Patawon amʉ ' uya ɨkʉi e ' sinkasa ' ene a ' tai itemiyatʉ pɨ ' , to ' uya ta ' pʉ tiwano ' kon pe , “ Pʉse rɨ ka ' pon esi pe man te ' wɨsen pe , parau apai iyapʉrʉnsa ' e ' tane , kʉrɨ rɨ Papa mɨrɨ waraino kon poni ' simanin uya si ima ' tanʉkʉ pe man , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And he shook off the beast into the fire , and felt no harm .
text2: E ' tane Paarʉ uya ɨkʉi eno ' ma ' pʉ apo ' ya ' , mɨrɨpan esi ' pʉ e ' ne ' pe pʉra rɨ .

text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen , or fallen down dead suddenly : but after they had looked a great while , and saw no harm come to him , they changed their minds , and said that he was a god .
text2: Ka ' pon amʉ ' esi ' pʉ iya ' mamʉ enupɨkɨrɨ , mɨrɨ tʉpo iyerikʉ tukai ' itenupɨkɨrɨ to ' esi ' pʉ . E ' tane inke rɨ itenupɨkɨrɨ tesi kon tʉpo , ɨ ' rɨ rɨ e ' kupʉ pʉra iyesi pɨ ' ipɨ ' , teseru kon ensima ' pʉ to ' uya . “ Papa pe man , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island , whose name was Publius ; who received us , and lodged us three days courteously .
text2: A ' ko pe rɨ mɨrɨ yau iyesi ' pʉ umɨ , eke opa ' wʉ pata epuru , Pa ' piriyas itese ' mainarʉ . Ina ereutanʉkʉ ' pʉ iya tiwʉ ' ta ' osorʉwau wʉi e ' to ' airɨ .

text: And it came to pass , that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux : to whom Paul entered in , and prayed , and laid his hands on him , and healed him .
text2: Ikʉipʉnʉ esi ' pʉ e ' ne ' pe e ' kɨɨi ' man pɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ mʉnʉimɨ pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan piya ' Paarʉ ewomʉ ' pʉ ipʉremai ' , mɨrɨpan uya temiyatʉ nonka ' pʉ ipona , mɨrɨpan epi ' tɨ ' pʉ iya .

text: So when this was done , others also , which had diseases in the island , came , and were healed :
text2: Serɨ e ' ku ' sa ' a ' tai , tʉron kon e ' ne ' ton uyee ' pʉ ipiya ' , mɨrɨpan kon usepi ' tɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ .

text: Who also honoured us with many honours ; and when we departed , they laded us with such things as were necessary .
text2: Ina nama ' pʉ to ' uya tu ' kan winɨ rɨ . Ina utɨto ' e ' seposa ' a ' tai , to ' uya ina repapɨtʉ ' pʉ tu ' kan ke rɨ ina i ' kiyari mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ i ' se ina e ' to ' ton nɨ kanau yau .

text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria , which had wintered in the isle , whose sign was Castor and Pollux .
text2: Osorʉwau kapʉi tʉpo , kanau epotorʉ ' pʉ yau parau po ina utɨ ' pʉ iko ' mansa ' komi ' weyu pe pata esi wenai . Arisantiriya winon pe kanau esi ' pʉ . Kanau putu pɨ ' Munui ' Amʉ ' Papa tato ' ipɨ ' pe yʉi ewa ' pɨ ' sa ' ton esi ' pʉ .

text: And landing at Syracuse , we tarried there three days .
text2: Ina uya Sire ' kiyus eporo ' pʉ . Mɨrɨ yau , osorʉwau wʉi ina uko ' mamʉ ' pʉ .

text: And from thence we fetched a compass , and came to Rhegium : and after one day the south wind blew , and we came the next day to Puteoli :
text2: Mɨrɨ apai , ina kanan utɨ ' pʉ , Resiyan tepose . Mɨrɨ ema ' sa ' yau , wʉi enu enuku kamisi winon pese ' tɨ uyee ' pʉ . Asa ' rɨ wʉi pata ' pʉ pe , Pu ' tiyori eporo ' pʉ ina uya .

text: Where we found brethren , and were desired to tarry with them seven days : and so we went toward Rome .
text2: Mɨrɨ yau , tʉtonpa kon amʉ ' eporo ' pʉ ina uya , mɨrɨpan kon uya ina kɨ ' ma ' pʉ tikin nɨ suntaaka e ' to ' poro ina uko ' manto ' pe tʉpiyau ' nokon . Mɨrɨ kasa ina uya pata Ron eporo ' pʉ .

text: And from thence , when the brethren heard of us , they came to meet us as far as Appiiforum , and The three taverns : whom when Paul saw , he thanked God , and took courage .
text2: To ' uya ina uyepʉ Ron pona tukai ' etasa ' a ' tai , to ' uye ' sa ' esi ' pʉ ɨnnon A ' piyas tepose rɨ , tʉron kon nɨrɨ uye ' sa ' esi ' pʉ Osorʉwau Patatʉse ' tepose ' ne rɨ ina e ' matai . Pʉsamoro eposa ' tʉuya a ' tai , Paarʉ uya Papa pɨ ' tenki ta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan pori ' ma ' pʉ to ' uya mɨrɨ yau .

text: And when we came to Rome , the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard : but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him .
text2: Ina epa ' kasa ' a ' tai Ron pona , tiwano ' pe iko ' manto ' pe to ' uya Paarʉ kupʉ ' pʉ soisa tʉku ' se erasuntɨnin pe .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together : and when they were come together , he said unto them , Men and brethren , though I have committed nothing against the people , or customs of our fathers , yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
text2: Osorʉwau wʉi tʉpo , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' epuru ton kɨ ' ma ' pʉ Paarʉ uya . To ' amʉrasa ' a ' tai , ta ' pʉ iya to ' pɨ ' , “ Utonpa ton , ɨ ' rɨ rɨ ekamʉn mɨrɨ pe pʉra ɨ ' rɨ rɨ penaro ' kon ukʉipʉnʉ kon amʉ ' nekama ' pʉ pen nɨ ku ' sa ' uya pʉra iye ' tane , a ' sisa ' pe e ' ai ' . A ' sisa ' rʉ ' pʉ urɨ Surusiran po . Mɨrɨ tʉpo , Ron pon kon ena ' inonkasa ' rʉ ' pʉ urɨ .

text: Who , when they had examined me , would have let me go , because there was no cause of death in me .
text2: To ' uya uyekama ' popɨtʉ ' pʉ tʉpo , unonkapai to ' esi ' pʉ , apʉne pʉra ɨri ku ' sa ' uya pʉra iyesi ' pʉ uwɨto ' ipɨkɨrɨ .

text: But when the Jews spake against it , I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar ; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of .
text2: Esuwerʉ amʉ ' esi ' pʉ unonka i ' se pʉra , mɨrɨ wenai enno ' sa ' urɨ Sisa uya uyeseru aimenkato ' pe , ɨ ' rɨ rɨ ekamʉn tʉto ' uya pʉra rɨ iye ' tane utonpa ton , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pɨ ' .

text: For this cause therefore have I called for you , to see you , and to speak with you : because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain .
text2: Mɨrɨ wenai , ɨyento ' kon pe uya , ayauro ' kato ' kon pe uya ɨkɨ ' masa ' uya ' nokon mɨrɨ . A ' sisa ' pe e ' ai ' , apʉne pʉra Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pika ' tɨnin pe ekamasa ' rʉ ' pʉ ese ' pɨ ' esi pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And they said unto him , We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee , neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee .
text2: To ' uya imaimu eikʉ ' pʉ , “ Kareta rɨ eposa ' ina uya pʉra man ɨmɨrɨ ekamanin . Ɨnʉ ' yan nɨ uye ' sa ' mɨrɨ apai uya ɨyeseru patakasa ' pʉra rɨ man .

text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest : for as concerning this sect , we know that every where it is spoken against .
text2: E ' tane anapurɨnʉ ɨnetapai ina man , apʉne pʉra serɨ emenna ' iyamʉtʉ yau ɨwe ' to ' esi wakʉ pe pʉra tukai ' tanporon kon usaurokʉ pɨ ' , ” ta ' pʉ to ' uya .

text: And when they had appointed him a day , there came many to him into his lodging ; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God , persuading them concerning Jesus , both out of the law of Moses , and out of the prophets , from morning till evening .
text2: To ' uya tʉweyu kon koneka ' pʉ tʉron nɨ wʉi a ' tai kanan etato ' pe tʉuya ' nokon , mɨrɨpan kon uyee ' pʉ tu ' ke parɨ Paarʉ pata ' se ' ya ' . Awanakʉi ' si ' kɨrɨ iko ' mamʉ pona rɨ , Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe enpoika pɨ ' iyesi ' pʉ to ' pana ya ' , ɨ ' rɨ tukai ' mɨrɨ ya ' ewon nɨto ' esi tukai ' nɨrɨ . Main , Mosi ' winon apai mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron kon nɨ pu ' kena ' ton eseru apai ' ne rɨ to ' uya Sises apurɨto ' pe ikupʉ i ' se iyesi ' pʉ .

text: And some believed the things which were spoken , and some believed not .
text2: Tʉron kon uya inekamanʉ apurɨ ' pʉ , e ' tane tʉron kon uya apurɨ ' pʉ pen .

text: And when they agreed not among themselves , they departed , after that Paul had spoken one word , Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers ,
text2: Ɨsi ' kaisa rɨ to ' ekoneka pʉra iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan kon e ' sara ' tɨ ' pʉ inɨmɨ pɨ ' , iu ' matʉ pe rɨ se tawon ekama iya tʉpo , “ Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ usaurokʉ ' pʉ rɨ i ' napairon pɨ ' ukʉipʉnʉ kon pɨ ' . Ta ' pʉ iya na ' ne ' Aisaya pu ' kena ' awɨrɨ :

text: Saying , Go unto this people , and say , Hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and not perceive :
text2: “ ‘ Enta kamoro ka ' pon amʉ ' piya ' tase ' na to ' pɨ ' , “ Tɨwɨrɨ rɨ eta auya ' nokon , mɨrɨ e ' tane ito ' ka ' nʉkʉ auya ' nokon pʉra rɨ iyesi ; tɨwɨrɨ rɨ ɨyenu kon tʉpɨtʉ auya ' nokon , mɨrɨ e ' tane ene auya ' nokon pʉra iyesi , ” tawon .

text: For the heart of this people is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes have they closed ; lest they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Apʉne pʉra pʉsamoro ka ' pon amʉ ' ewan enasa ' sa ' man pe , tʉpana kon a ' kopɨ ' sa ' to ' uya , tenu kon nɨ a ' kopɨ ' sa ' to ' uya . To ' uya tenu kon ke ene nesii ' no , to ' uya eta tʉpana kon ke nesii ' no , to ' uya tewan kon ke ito ' ka ' nʉkʉ nesii ' no , mɨrɨpan kon era ' tɨ uwinɨkʉi ' nesii ' no to ' epi ' tɨ uya nesii ' no , ’ tawon , ” ta ' pʉ Paarʉ uya .

text: Be it known therefore unto you , that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles , and that they will hear it .
text2: “ Mɨrɨ wenai i ' tu auya ' nokon i ' se e ' ai ' , serɨ epika ' tɨn nɨto ' ekareei esi mɨrɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen iwano ' pe , mɨrɨpan anʉnto ' oton to ' uya , ” ta ' pʉ iya .

text: And when he had said these words , the Jews departed , and had great reasoning among themselves .
text2: ( Serɨ etasa ' Esuwerʉ amʉ ' uya a ' tai , tʉmɨrɨ ' nokon pe rɨ e ' sei ' pɨtʉi ' ma to ' enna ' po ' pʉ . )

text: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house , and received all that came in unto him ,
text2: Asa ' rɨ wʉipiya e ' to ' airɨ , Paarʉ uko ' mamʉ ' pʉ tʉne ' manʉ ɨutɨ tau , tikin nɨ ' ne tʉuye ' san ereutanʉkʉ ' pʉ iya to ' auro ' kato ' pe tʉuya .

text: Preaching the kingdom of God , and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ , with all confidence , no man forbidding him .
text2: Te ' namai ' pʉra , iwa ' kʉ ' pɨ ' nin pʉra Papa e ' to ' esa ' wannɨ pe pɨ ' itekare ekama ' pʉ iya , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Itepuru Sises Kʉrai pɨ ' enupan nʉ ' pʉ iya .

text: Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , called to be an apostle , separated unto the gospel of God ,
text2: Paarʉ , Sises Kʉrai poitorʉ , esa ' sa ' itekare ekamai ' enno ' sa ' pe , imo ' kasa ' wakʉ Papa ekareei iwano ' pe , winɨpaino .

text: ( Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures , )
text2: Serɨ itekare ikupʉ uya tukai ' isaurokʉ ' pʉ rʉ ' pʉ pena pu ' kena ' amʉ ' imaimu pe tʉusauro ' san poro Wakʉ iye ' menukasa ' itekare yau

text: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord , which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh ;
text2: tʉmu pɨ ' , ka ' pon pe te ' to ' yau Tepi ' pa rʉ ' pʉ pe na ' ne ' .

text: And declared to be the Son of God with power , according to the spirit of holiness , by the resurrection from the dead :
text2: Wakʉ pe te ' sen Iya ' kwarʉ poro ekamasa ' rʉ ' pʉ meruntɨ ke Papa Mu pe iye ' mʉ ' sa ' ka winɨ iyerikʉ ' pʉ apai : Sises Kʉrai si uyepuru kon .

text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship , for obedience to the faith among all nations , for his name :
text2: Iporo mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itese ' iwano ' pe wakʉ nonkasa ' eposa ' man innennoko ' san pe e ' nɨto ' pe , ka ' pon amʉ ' ne ' nin pe e ' nɨto ' pe Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen koro ' tapai imaimu awɨron pe to ' e ' to ' pe apurɨto ' to ' uya winɨ .

text: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ :
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ si esi kamoro Sises Kʉrai iwano ' pe ikɨ ' masa ' kon koro ' tau .

text: To all that be in Rome , beloved of God , called to be saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father , and the Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Tanporon kon Ron pon kon enakan Papa ni ' nʉnkanʉ ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ikɨ ' masa ' kon wakʉ ton pe to ' e ' to ' pe : Wakʉ nonkasa ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉusewankamai ' pʉra ɨwe ' to ' kon Papa , ukʉipʉnʉ kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Itepuru Sises Kʉrai winon nesii ɨyenakan kon pe .

text: First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all , that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world .
text2: Wapiya , Papa pɨ ' tenki ta uya Sises Kʉrai poro tanporo ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon pɨ ' , apʉne pʉra apurɨto ' auya ' nokon usekare ' tɨsa ' tanporo non emʉ ' kaisa rɨ .

text: For God is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son , that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers ;
text2: Papa , iyapiyo ' pe e ' to ' tanporo uyewan a ' kɨrɨ Imu ekareei wakʉ ekama uya yau , esi uyekamanin pe inke rɨ uyenu yau ɨkupʉ uya ' nokon

text: Making request , if by any means now at length I might have a prosperous journey by the will of God to come unto you .
text2: ɨpʉrema yau tɨwɨrɨ rɨ ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨpʉrema si serɨ pe rɨ Papa eseru awɨrɨ ite ' ma uta ' kokasa ' e ' to ' pe ɨpiya ' nokon utɨto ' pe .

text: For I long to see you , that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift , to the end ye may be established ;
text2: Ɨyenpai ' nokon esi ɨpika ' tɨto ' kon pe uya iya ' kwarʉ nʉtʉrʉnʉ eponin pe , pana ' pe ɨku ' nin kon pe —

text: That is , that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me .
text2: mɨrɨ si , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ urɨ uya apurɨto ' winɨ epori ' mapɨ ' nɨto ' pe asa ' ipɨ ' .

text: Now I would not have you ignorant , brethren , that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you , ( but was let hitherto , ) that I might have some fruit among you also , even as among other Gentiles .
text2: I ' tunin nan pe pʉra ɨwesi kon i ' se pʉra esi , utonpa ton , ekonepɨtʉ ' pʉ inke rɨ ɨpiya ' nokon utɨto ' pe ( e ' tane mɨrɨ namai ' uwa ' kʉ ' pɨ ' sa ' serɨ pona rɨ nin si ) ɨ ' koro ' tau ' nokon iyakʉ ' pʉsa ' anʉnto ' pe uya , tʉron kon Papa pʉnon kon koro ' tau eporo ' pʉ uya kasa .

text: I am debtor both to the Greeks , and to the Barbarians ; both to the wise , and to the unwise .
text2: E ' nonkasa ' pe rɨ esi asa ' ron kon ena ' Kiri ' amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Kiri ' amʉ ' pen nɨ ena ' , asa ' rɨ rɨ emepoke ' ton mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ emepo pʉnon kon ena ' .

text: So , as much as in me is , I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , wakʉ itekare ɨnekamapai kuru esi serɨ ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon Ron pon kon pɨ ' rɨ marɨ .

text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ : for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth ; to the Jew first , and also to the Greek .
text2: Wakʉ itekare pɨ ' ɨpiyɨtʉ pen nɨ , apʉne pʉra Papa meruntɨrʉ pe iyesi tanporon kon apurɨnin nan epika ' tɨto ' ike pe ; wapiya Esuwerʉ iwano ' pe , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ pen iwano ' pe .

text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith : as it is written , The just shall live by faith .
text2: Apʉne pʉra wakʉ itekare yau Papa uya anʉn nɨ ipokena ' rɨ tukai ' apurɨto ' winɨ iyepiya ' tɨ si ' kɨrɨ iu ' matʉ pona , iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' kasa : “ Ipokena ' awɨrɨ te ' sen uko ' mamʉ apurɨto ' winɨ , ” tawon .

text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men , who hold the truth in unrighteousness ;
text2: Papa uya kota ' man nɨto ' usenpoikasa ' Epʉn poi Papa pʉra e ' nɨto ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨri ka ' pon amʉ ' eseru pɨ ' wakʉ i ' tuto ' pe pʉra iku ' nin nan ɨri teseru kon winɨ ,

text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them ; for God hath shewed it unto them .
text2: Papa i ' tuto ' ipɨ ' esi to ' pona tense rɨ , apʉne pʉra tense rɨ Papa uya iku ' sa ' to ' pona .

text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen , being understood by the things that are made , even his eternal power and Godhead ; so that they are without excuse :
text2: Apʉne pʉra non e ' kaa ' pʉ si ' kɨrɨ Papa ewakiri tʉusensen pen — siyaro ' rɨ imeruntɨrʉ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Papa pe iye ' to ' i ' naino rɨ — usensa ' wakʉ pe rɨ , tʉto ' ka ' nʉ ' se iyekonekasa ' rʉ ' pʉ winɨ , ka ' pon amʉ ' e ' to ' pe iye ' wapu ' tɨto ' ipona pʉra .

text: Because that , when they knew God , they glorified him not as God , neither were thankful ; but became vain in their imaginations , and their foolish heart was darkened .
text2: Apʉne pʉra Papa i ' tu tane to ' uya , Papa pe to ' uya apurɨpɨtʉ pʉra iyesi , to ' uya tenki ta pʉra rɨ iyesi ipɨ ' , e ' tane to ' usenuminkato ' esi iwotori ' pɨ pʉra rɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ emepo pʉn to ' ewan ewarumamʉ ' pʉ .

text: Professing themselves to be wise , they became fools ,
text2: Emepoke ' pe to ' e ' ku ' tane , epe ' rɨ to ' ena ' pʉ ,

text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man , and to birds , and fourfooted beasts , and creeping things .
text2: mɨrɨpan kon uya Papa teri ' sen pen ku ' to ' eke pe entakanoma ' pʉ to ' uya ipe iye ' to ' pe ika ' sa ' ke ka ' pon teri ' sen pe rɨ nin mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ toron amʉ ' pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ o ' amʉ ' pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ene amʉ ' rɨ .

text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts , to dishonour their own bodies between themselves :
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , Papa uya to ' nonkasa ' ɨri to ' ewan e ' to ' i ' se yau ɨri pe tekumato ' kon yau tʉtonpa kon pokon pe tʉpun kon eno ' mato ' to ' uya ya ' .

text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie , and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator , who is blessed for ever . Amen .
text2: I ' nairon pe Papa e ' to ' entakanoma to ' uya kasi pe e ' nɨto ' ke , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ika ' sa ' ton nɨ apurɨpɨtʉ to ' uya mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iyapiyo ' pe rɨ to ' esi ika ' nin nʉ ' pʉ ta pe pʉra rɨ — tɨwɨrɨ rɨ tapurɨpɨ ' sen . Amen .

text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections : for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature :
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , Papa uya to ' nonkasa ' piyɨ ' nʉ ' nin nɨ nɨkɨ eseru ya ' . To ' uri ' samo ton nɨ uya i ' naino pe rɨ e ' nɨto ' entakanoma i ' naino pen nɨ ke .

text: And likewise also the men , leaving the natural use of the woman , burned in their lust one toward another ; men with men working that which is unseemly , and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet .
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa rɨ marɨ , warawoti ' si amʉ ' uya i ' naino uri ' san pokon pe e ' nɨto ' nonkasa ' , mɨrɨpan kon a ' mintasa ' tʉnɨkɨru kon yau tʉtonpa kon pɨ ' . Warawoti ' si amʉ ' uya ɨri rɨ kuu ' pʉ warawoti ' si amʉ ' pokon pe , mɨrɨpan kon uya tekota ' mato ' kon eposa ' tʉpun kon yau iye ' to ' awɨrɨ pʉra te ' sa ' kon wenai .

text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge , God gave them over to a reprobate mind , to do those things which are not convenient ;
text2: Miyarɨ rɨ , to ' usenuminka kasa pʉra rɨ Papa i ' tunin pe e ' nɨto ' enkurunpanin pe , to ' nonkasa ' iya iye ' to ' awɨrɨ pʉra to ' usenuminkato ' ya ' , tʉku ' sen pen nɨ ku ' to ' pe to ' uya .

text: Being filled with all unrighteousness , fornication , wickedness , covetousness , maliciousness ; full of envy , murder , debate , deceit , malignity ; whisperers ,
text2: To ' rɨ si epe ' tɨsa ' tanporon nɨ ɨri eseru ke , ɨri ke , mentai e ' nɨto ' ke mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iteseru pe te ' sen awɨrɨ pʉra e ' nɨto ' ike ke . Ɨri pe tʉron kon pɨ ' te ' ku ' san pe to ' esi , te ' wɨsan pe , ɨsipɨ ' te ' san pe , enku ' tɨnin nan pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨri ɨnku ' pai te ' san pe . Ka ' pon eseru pɨ ' tʉusauro ' san pe ,

text: Backbiters , haters of God , despiteful , proud , boasters , inventors of evil things , disobedient to parents ,
text2: ɨri pe ka ' pon pɨ ' tʉusauro ' san pe , Papa ewaruma ' tɨnin nan pe , sapemanin nan pe , i ' tunin pe te ' ku ' san pe , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉutapurɨsan pe ; ɨri kupʉ eseru sara ' tɨnin nan pe ; tʉsan kon maimu awɨron kon pen pe ;

text: Without understanding , covenantbreakers , without natural affection , implacable , unmerciful :
text2: iya ' kwarʉ pʉnon kon pe , apurɨ pokena ' ton pen pe , tʉusi ' nʉnkasan pen pe , ɨsentu ' mʉnon kon pe , aiko tawon nan pen pe .

text: Who knowing the judgment of God , that they which commit such things are worthy of death , not only do the same , but have pleasure in them that do them .
text2: I ' tui ' ma rɨ Papa usauro ' sa ' esi ipoken kamoro serɨ rupɨ ku ' nin nan esi uma ' tan nɨto ' eponin nan pe tawon , serɨ ton kuru kupʉ to ' uya , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ kamoro serɨ ku ' nin nan pɨ ' rɨ nɨrɨ wakʉ pe man ta to ' uya .

text: Therefore thou art inexcusable , O man , whosoever thou art that judgest : for wherein thou judgest another , thou condemnest thyself ; for thou that judgest doest the same things .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ɨmɨrɨ , ka ' pon , ɨnʉ ' rɨ eseru aimenkanin , ɨye ' wapu ' tɨto ' ipona pʉra iyesi , ɨ ' rɨ poirɨ rɨ tʉron nɨ eseru aimenka auya , ɨiwano ' pe rɨ nin ɨuseno ' ma mɨrɨ , apʉne pʉra ɨmɨrɨ eseru aimenkanin uya mɨrɨ ton nɨ kupʉ .

text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things .
text2: Serɨ si i ' tu ' nokon Papa uya eseru aimenkato ' esi kamoro serɨ rupɨ ku ' nin nan pɨ ' esi i ' nairon po .

text: And thinkest thou this , O man , that judgest them which do such things , and doest the same , that thou shalt escape the judgment of God ?
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa si ɨmɨrɨ , ka ' pon nɨ nin , uya eseru aimenkato ' kupʉ a ' tai to ' pɨ ' mɨrɨ rɨ kupʉi ' ma , Papa uya eseru aimenkato ' piyapai ayainʉmʉ tukai ' pe ' ɨye ' kupʉ ?

text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering ; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance ?
text2: Mɨrɨ pe pʉra katɨ , eke pe rɨ ɨsi ' nʉnke ' pe iye ' to ' iku ' tane auya , ɨyenpɨ ' to ' iya , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉuseta ' kai ' pʉra iye ' to ' nurunpa auya , i ' tui ' ma pʉra Papa e ' to ' ɨsi ' nʉnke ' pe uya ayato ' esi ɨyera ' tɨto ' ya ' ?

text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God ;
text2: E ' tane apʉne pʉra sa ' man pe rɨ tera ' tɨsen pe pʉra rɨ ɨyewan esi pɨ ' , kota ' man nɨto ' amʉranʉkʉ auya ɨiwano ' pe rɨ Papa uya kota ' man nɨto ' weyu a ' taino pe , ipokena ' eseru aimenkato ' iya usenpoika a ' tai .

text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds :
text2: Papa uya , “ itʉrʉ ka ' pon kaisa rɨ inkupʉ ' pʉ pɨ ' tense , ” tasa ' iya .

text: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality , eternal life :
text2: Kamoro ka ' pon amʉ ' sa ' man annawɨrɨ wakʉ kupʉ pɨ ' te ' san uya eke pe tʉku ' to ' kon , tʉnamato ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ eri ' nɨto ' pen warinpa ena ' inke rɨ uko ' man nɨto ' tʉrʉ iya .

text: But unto them that are contentious , and do not obey the truth , but obey unrighteousness , indignation and wrath ,
text2: E ' tane kamoro tiwano ' kon pe rɨ te ' san mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ i ' nairon ana ' sipai pʉra te ' san mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨri pɨkɨrɨ te ' san pɨ ' , moro isakorotasa ' pɨ ' ekota ' man nɨto ' esi mɨrɨ .

text: Tribulation and anguish , upon every soul of man that doeth evil , of the Jew first , and also of the Gentile ;
text2: Moro ewankamanin mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ a ' kwarʉ ainʉnpanin e ' to ' oton tanporon kon ɨri ku ' nin nan ka ' pon amʉ ' pɨ ' : wapiya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pɨ ' , mɨrɨ tʉpo Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen ;

text: But glory , honour , and peace , to every man that worketh good , to the Jew first , and also to the Gentile :
text2: e ' tane eke pe iku ' to ' , inamato ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉusewankamai ' pʉra e ' nɨto ' esi tanporo wakʉ ku ' nin nan iwano ' pe : wapiya Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pɨ ' , mɨrɨ tʉpo Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen pɨ ' ,

text: For there is no respect of persons with God .
text2: apʉne pʉra Papa esi pɨ ' tenu yawon kenan pe pʉra rɨ .

text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law : and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law ;
text2: Tanporon kon , main , Mosi ' winon piyapai imakoitasa ' kon uma ' tato ' oton mɨrɨ main piyapai rɨ marɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporon kon imakoitasa ' kon main o ' noro eseru utaimenkato ' oton main ke .

text: ( For not the hearers of the law are just before God , but the doers of the law shall be justified .
text2: Apʉne pʉra kamoro mɨrɨ main etanin nan esi pen ipokena ' pe Papa enu yau , e ' tane kamoro main awɨron kon anʉmʉ Papa uya ipokena ' ton tukai ' .

text: For when the Gentiles , which have not the law , do by nature the things contained in the law , these , having not the law , are a law unto themselves :
text2: ( Kasi pe pʉra , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen , main , Mosi ' winon esanon pen , uya ikupʉ ti ' naino kon nɨ main e ' to ' i ' se , main pe rɨ tiwano ' kon pe to ' esi , main esanon pe pʉra rɨ esii ' ma ,

text: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts , their conscience also bearing witness , and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another ; )
text2: to ' uya enpoika si ' kɨrɨ mɨrɨ main e ' to ' i ' se e ' menukasa ' to ' ewan pɨ ' , to ' ewan uya rɨ nɨrɨ ekama to ' pɨ ' , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' usenuminkato ' uya rɨ ipoken pʉra to ' e ' sa ' ekama , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron nɨ a ' tai ipoken to ' e ' sa ' ta iya rɨ . )

text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel .
text2: Serɨ e ' ku ' to ' oton Papa uya ama ' aino eseru aimenka weyu a ' tai Sises Kʉrai poro , wakʉ uyekareei nekamayai ' ne ' kasa .

text: Behold , thou art called a Jew , and restest in the law , and makest thy boast of God ,
text2: Ɨmɨrɨ nin si , Esuwerʉ pe te ' sesa ' sen ; main , Mosi ' winon enupɨkɨrɨ te ' sen mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Papa pokon pe ɨwe ' to ' pɨ ' tʉutapurɨsen .

text: And knowest his will , and approvest the things that are more excellent , being instructed out of the law ;
text2: I ' se iye ' to ' i ' tunin pe ɨwesi yau , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ewai ' tawon pe te ' sen epoi te ' sen pɨ ' apʉne pʉra main nenupa ' pʉ pe ɨwesi pɨ ' .

text: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind , a light of them which are in darkness ,
text2: Pori ' pe ɨwesi yau tenku ' na ' nan anin pe ɨwesi pɨ ' , ewarupɨ yau te ' san weyu pe ɨwesi pɨ ' ,

text: An instructor of the foolish , a teacher of babes , which hast the form of knowledge and of the truth in the law .
text2: iya ' kwarʉ pʉnon enupanin pe ɨwesi kon pɨ ' , aiko ton nʉ ' kwɨ mʉre amʉ ' ti ' saai pe ɨwesi pɨ ' , apʉne pʉra main esi wakʉ pe i ' tuto ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ i ' nairon yen pe —

text: Thou therefore which teachest another , teachest thou not thyself ? thou that preachest a man should not steal , dost thou steal ?
text2: Ɨmɨrɨ si , tʉron kon enupanin , ɨiwano ' pe pe ' ɨusenupa pen nɨ ? Ɨmɨrɨ ama ' pe e ' nɨ namai ' itekare ekamanin , ama ' manin pe ' ɨmɨrɨ ?

text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery , dost thou commit adultery ? thou that abhorrest idols , dost thou commit sacrilege ?
text2: Ɨmɨrɨ iyemari ' masa ' kon ka ' pon amʉ ' kʉsekumanin tawon , tekumasen pe ' ɨmɨrɨ ? Ɨmɨrɨ papa tato ' ipɨ ' pe ika ' sa ' itewaruma , ɨpʉreman nɨto ' , use ' man nɨto ' iwʉ ' ton pe ' rapumanin ɨmɨrɨ ?

text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law , through breaking the law dishonourest thou God ?
text2: Ɨmɨrɨ main pɨ ' tʉutapurɨsen , main pe ' ti ' kwɨ ' se Papa namanin pe pʉra te ' sen ɨmɨrɨ ?

text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you , as it is written .
text2: Iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' kasa : “ Papa ese ' e ' sapema Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen koro ' tau ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon uriya ' , ” tawon .

text: For circumcision verily profiteth , if thou keep the law : but if thou be a breaker of the law , thy circumcision is made uncircumcision .
text2: Itepe ' e ' pe un pi ' pɨ puturʉkato ' esi main awɨrɨ ɨwesi yau , e ' tane main i ' kwɨtʉ auya yau , itun pi ' pɨ puturʉkasa ' pen pe rɨ ɨyena .

text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law , shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision ?
text2: Kamoro itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon pen e ' sa ' main e ' to ' i ' se awɨrɨ , itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon pe pe ' to ' kupʉ pen ?

text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature , if it fulfil the law , judge thee , who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law ?
text2: Kʉrɨ ipun pe itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' pen , mɨrɨpan e ' tane main awɨron , uya ɨyeno ' ma mɨrɨ , ɨmɨrɨ iye ' menukasa ' main tensen pe esa ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ un pi ' pɨ puturʉkato ' esa ' , esi main i ' kwɨ ' nin pe .

text: For he is not a Jew , which is one outwardly ; neither is that circumcision , which is outward in the flesh :
text2: Ka ' pon esi pen mɨrɨ Esuwerʉ pe kuru kɨpo ' po rɨ kʉrɨ rɨ pe iyesi yau , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ kɨpo ' po rɨ , ipun pe rɨ un pi ' pɨ puturʉkato ' esi nɨrɨ pen nɨ .

text: But he is a Jew , which is one inwardly ; and circumcision is that of the heart , in the spirit , and not in the letter ; whose praise is not of men , but of God .
text2: Kane , ka ' pon esi mɨrɨ Esuwerʉ pe kuru tʉyau kʉrɨ rɨ pe tesi yau ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ un pi ' pɨ puturʉka esi tepe ' ke rɨ ewan wannɨ ma ' kʉʉi ' tɨ kasa , iya ' kwarʉ winɨ , iye ' menukasa ' main na ' ne ' awɨron pen nɨ . Pʉse rɨ waraino ka ' pon apurɨpɨ ' to ' esi mɨrɨ ka ' pon winɨpaino pen , e ' tane Papa winɨpaino pe .

text: What advantage then hath the Jew ? or what profit is there of circumcision ?
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ eponin pe ken si e ' nɨ Esuwerʉ pe e ' nɨ yau , mɨrɨ pe pʉra ɨ ' rɨ epe ' pe yun wannɨ pi ' pɨ puturʉka ?

text: Much every way : chiefly , because that unto them were committed the oracles of God .
text2: Eke pe rɨ tanporon yau rɨ ! Tanporon wapiya , Papa maimu kuru rɨ e ' nonka ' pʉ mɨrɨ to ' ena ' .

text: For what if some did not believe ? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect ?
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ pe ken iyesi to ' tonpa ton uya apurɨto ' pʉra iyesi yau ? To ' uya apurɨto ' pʉra iyesi uya Papa e ' to ' tʉusauro ' sa ' awɨrɨ pʉra kupʉ ?

text: God forbid : yea , let God be true , but every man a liar ; as it is written , That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings , and mightest overcome when thou art judged .
text2: Pen kuru rɨ ! Tɨwɨ Papa nesii i ' nai rɨ , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporon kon e ' tane kasi ye ' pe . Iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' : “ Ipokena ' pe ɨusi ' tu pa amaimu yau ɨyeseru aimenkato ' yau itentai ɨyena pa , ” tawon .

text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance ? ( I speak as a man )
text2: E ' tane ipoken pʉra e ' nɨto ' uya Papa e ' to ' ipoken enpoika wakʉ pe kuru , ɨ ' rɨ ken si ta ? Papa esi wakʉ pe pʉra rɨ uya kota ' man nɨto ' nepʉ upona ' nokon ta ? ( Ka ' pon e ' sei ' pɨ ' to ' e ' pe rɨ nin si e ' kapʉ . )

text: God forbid : for then how shall God judge the world ?
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa iyesi pen ! Mɨrɨ kasa iyesi yau , nai kasa Papa non eseru aimenkai ' no ?

text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory ; why yet am I also judged as a sinner ?
text2: Ka ' pon nɨ entarumʉ , “ Kasi ye ' pe esi uya Papa e ' to ' i ' nairon pe koneka yau eke pe iku ' to ' temo ' kai ' , ɨ ' rɨto ' pe ken si tʉmakooikenan pe uyeno ' ma ? ”

text: And not rather , ( as we be slanderously reported , and as some affirm that we say , ) Let us do evil , that good may come ? whose damnation is just .
text2: Tapai pʉra pe ' nai — kasi ye ' pe rɨ ina pɨ ' usauro ' nɨsa ' na ' ne ' kasa mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉron kon uya ikupʉ , ina uya — “ Ɨri ku ' pai ' nokon wakʉ pe itepe ' pʉ e ' to ' pe , ” ta , ta pʉra ? To ' eno ' mato ' esi mɨrɨ i ' se to ' e ' to ' pe rɨ .

text: What then ? are we better than they ? No , in no wise : for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles , that they are all under sin ;
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ ken si ? Ina ken pe ' si Esuwerʉ amʉ ' esi wakʉ ton pe ? Parɨ pen nɨ ! Ekamaka ' sa ' nokon nɨ mɨrɨ , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen esi mɨrɨ ɨsi ' kaisa rɨ makoi o ' no .

text: As it is written , There is none righteous , no , not one :
text2: Iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' kasa : “ Ɨnʉ ' rɨ pʉra iyesi ipokena ' pe te ' sen , tikin nan pʉra rɨ ;

text: There is none that understandeth , there is none that seeketh after God .
text2: ɨnʉ ' rɨ pʉra iyesi ito ' ka ' nʉ ' nin , ɨnʉ ' rɨ Papa warinpanin .

text: They are all gone out of the way , they are together become unprofitable ; there is none that doeth good , no , not one .
text2: Tanporon kon nɨ era ' tɨsa ' ɨsi ' kaisa rɨ siya tanporo rɨ to ' enasa ' se pe rɨ ; ɨnʉ ' rɨ pʉra iyesi wakʉ ku ' nin , tikin nan pʉra rɨ . ”

text: Their throat is an open sepulchre ; with their tongues they have used deceit ; the poison of asps is under their lips :
text2: “ To ' esen ton esi emenna ' ton akasa ' uruwai ' ton pe ; to ' ani ton esi enku ' tɨn nɨto ' ku ' nin pe . ” “ Ɨkʉi urarii rɨ esi to ' e ' pi pɨ ' . ”

text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness :
text2: “ To ' mʉta ton epe ' tɨpɨ ' sa ' e ' pa ' nʉ ' nɨto ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨsipɨ ' e ' nɨto ' ke . ”

text: Their feet are swift to shed blood :
text2: “ Aitune ' pe rɨ to ' pʉta ton esi mʉn ennoko pɨ ' ;

text: Destruction and misery are in their ways :
text2: to ' utɨ ' pʉ e ' ma ' pʉ tau uma ' tan nɨsa ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ usewankaman nɨto ' e ' nɨmɨ ,

text: And the way of peace have they not known :
text2: mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tʉusewankamai ' pʉra ka ' pon uko ' manto ' ku ' to ' to ' ni ' tunʉ pen . ”

text: There is no fear of God before their eyes .
text2: “ Papa pɨ ' to ' enari ' nʉnto ' pʉra rɨ iyesi to ' enu yau , ” tawon .

text: Now we know that what things soever the law saith , it saith to them who are under the law : that every mouth may be stopped , and all the world may become guilty before God .
text2: Serɨ si i ' tu ' nokon , tanporo main uya tasa ' na ' ne ' , ta iya kamoro main o ' no na ' ne ' nan pɨ ' , tanporo mʉta e ' tʉtʉikato ' pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ tanporo non pon kon e ' to ' pe Papa pɨ ' ekamanin pe .

text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight : for by the law is the knowledge of sin .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ɨnʉ ' rɨ anʉmʉ Papa uya pʉra iyesi ipokena ' tukai ' main kupʉ iya pɨ ' ; e ' tane ru ' ku , main poro makoi i ' tunin pe enan .

text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested , being witnessed by the law and the prophets ;
text2: E ' tane nin si serɨ Papa uya ka ' pon amʉ ' anʉnto ' ipokenan pe usi ' tusa ' , main piyapai , main , Mosi ' winon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Pu ' kena ' amʉ ' nekamayai ' ne ' .

text: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe : for there is no difference :
text2: Serɨ ipoken e ' nɨto ' usi ' tusa ' uyepʉ Sises Kʉrai apurɨto ' poro tanporon kon apurɨnin nan piya ' . Tʉponaron pʉra rɨ iyesi ,

text: For all have sinned , and come short of the glory of God ;
text2: apʉne pʉra tanporon kon nɨ umakoitasa ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ to ' u ' ma ' sa ' mɨ airɨ rɨ eke pe Papa ku ' to ' tepose pʉra ,

text: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus :
text2: mɨrɨpan kon ekonekasa ' tʉuse ' mai ' pʉra wakʉ nonkasa ' iya winɨ e ' man nɨto ' poro iye ' sa ' Kʉrai Sises winɨ .

text: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood , to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past , through the forbearance of God ;
text2: Papa uya itʉsa ' use ' man nɨto ' ike pe upɨ ' nokon tʉusentu ' mato ' pe imʉnʉ apurɨto ' poro . Serɨ ku ' sa ' iya ipokena ' pe tesi ekamanin pe , apʉne pʉra a ' kʉre ' tɨnin pe tesi ke makoi ton pena iye ' ku ' sa ' rʉ ' san nonka ' pʉ iya tʉponi ' simai ' pʉra —

text: To declare , I say , at this time his righteousness : that he might be just , and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus .
text2: ikuu ' pʉ iya ipoken tesi serɨ a ' tai tukai ' enpoikanin pe , ipoken teseru esi enpoikanin pe mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' anʉnnin pe ipokena ' pɨkɨron kon pe Sises apurɨto ' winɨ .

text: Where is boasting then ? It is excluded . By what law ? of works ? Nay : but by the law of faith .
text2: Nai ken si utapurɨn nɨto ' ? Mɨrɨ pʉra rɨ iyesi . Ɨ ' rɨ iteseru pe ? Main pe ' awɨrɨ e ' nɨ pɨ ' ? Kane , e ' tane apurɨto ' pɨ ' .

text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law .
text2: Apʉne pʉra ka ' pon anʉmʉ Papa uya ipokena ' pe ta ' nokon apurɨto ' winɨ main awɨrɨ e ' nɨ winɨ pʉra .

text: Is he the God of the Jews only ? is he not also of the Gentiles ? Yes , of the Gentiles also :
text2: Papa pe ' esi Esuwerʉ amʉ ' rɨken e ' to ' itese ' pɨ ' pe ? Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen e ' to ' itese ' pɨ ' rɨ nɨrɨ pen pe ' kʉrɨ ? Ewai ' , Esuwerʉ amʉ ' pen nɨ nɨrɨ ,

text: Seeing it is one God , which shall justify the circumcision by faith , and uncircumcision through faith .
text2: tikin nɨ rɨken Papa esi pɨ ' , ka ' pon itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' anʉnton apurɨto ' winɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' pen mɨrɨ rɨ marɨ apurɨto ' poro .

text: Do we then make void the law through faith ? God forbid : yea , we establish the law .
text2: Apurɨto ' pɨ ' ken pe ' si usauro ' nɨ uya main , Mosi ' winon pʉra iye ' to ' pe ikupʉ ? Parɨ pen nɨ ! E ' tane ru ' ku , main awɨrɨ e ' nɨ ' nokon .

text: What shall we say then that Abraham our father , as pertaining to the flesh , hath found ?
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ ken si eporo ' pʉ utamokori kon Epʉra ' an uya serɨ rupɨ pɨ ' ta serɨ ?

text: For if Abraham were justified by works , he hath whereof to glory ; but not before God .
text2: Epʉra ' an anʉnsa ' pe iyesi yau ipokena ' pe inkuu ' pʉ winɨ , itapurɨto ' ipɨ ' esi mɨrɨ — e ' tane Papa rau pen .

text: For what saith the scripture ? Abraham believed God , and it was counted unto him for righteousness .
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ ta imenukasa ' itekare uya ? “ Epʉra ' an uya Papa apurɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨ pɨ ' ipokena ' pe iyesi , ” ta ' pʉ ipɨ ' .

text: Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace , but of debt .
text2: Ka ' pon e ' tʉrawasoma a ' tai , itepe ' pʉ esi mɨrɨ irepato ' ike tukai ' iyesi pen nɨ e ' tane iye ' tʉrawasomasa ' rʉ ' pʉ ipɨ ' pe iyesi .

text: But to him that worketh not , but believeth on him that justifieth the ungodly , his faith is counted for righteousness .
text2: E ' tane rɨ , kʉrɨ ka ' pon te ' tʉrawasomasen pen pona e ' tane Papa apurɨnin ɨri ka ' pon anʉnnin ipokena ' tukai ' , apurɨto ' iya uya ikupʉ Papa uya anʉnto ' pe ipokena ' tukai ' .

text: Even as David also describeth the blessedness of the man , unto whom God imputeth righteousness without works ,
text2: Tepi ' uya mɨrɨ rɨ marɨ ta isaurokʉ a ' tai ka ' pon e ' to ' pɨ ' pori ' pe Papa uya anʉmʉ a ' tai ipokena ' pe iyesi tukai ' , inkupʉnʉ pɨkɨrɨ pen :

text: Saying , Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven , and whose sins are covered .
text2: “ Pori ' pe kamo esi ɨri to ' nʉkuu ' pʉ pɨ ' usentu ' man nɨsa ' kon mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ imakooi ton inɨpontɨsa ' na ' ne ' nan .

text: Blessed is the man to whom the Lord will not impute sin .
text2: Pori ' pe kʉrɨ ka ' pon esi imakooi i ' tuto ' Itepuru uya pen ipɨ ' , ” ta .

text: Cometh this blessedness then upon the circumcision only , or upon the uncircumcision also ? for we say that faith was reckoned to Abraham for righteousness .
text2: Serɨ pori ' pe e ' nɨto ' pe ' esi itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon iwano ' pe rɨken , mɨrɨ pe pʉra itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon pen nɨ nɨrɨ katɨ iwano ' pe iyesi ? Epʉra ' an anʉmʉ ' pʉ ipokena ' tukai ' apurɨto ' iya pɨkɨrɨ ta pɨ ' e ' nɨsa ' .

text: How was it then reckoned ? when he was in circumcision , or in uncircumcision ? Not in circumcision , but in uncircumcision .
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ waraino ton o ' noro serɨ e ' kuu ' pʉ ? Itun pi ' pɨ puturʉka ' pʉ tʉpo pe ' iyesi ' pʉ , mɨrɨ pe pʉra irawɨrɨ katɨ ? Mɨrɨ tʉpo pen e ' tane mɨrɨ rawɨrɨ !

text: And he received the sign of circumcision , a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had yet being uncircumcised : that he might be the father of all them that believe , though they be not circumcised ; that righteousness might be imputed unto them also :
text2: Mɨrɨpan uya tʉyun pi ' pɨ puturʉkato ' eporo ' pʉ ento ' ipɨ ' pe , Papa uya anʉnsa ' ipokena ' pe enpoikanin pe apurɨto ' iya winɨ , itun pi ' pɨ puturʉkasa ' pe pʉra rɨ marɨ iyesi koro ' tau . Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , tanporon kon apurɨnin nan kʉipʉnʉ pe iyesi e ' tane itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon pen , anʉnsa ' kon tato ' pe to ' pɨ ' .

text: And the father of circumcision to them who are not of the circumcision only , but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham , which he had being yet uncircumcised .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon kʉipʉnʉ pe rɨ marɨ iyesi , itun pi ' pɨ iputurʉkasa ' kon pe rɨken to ' esi pen e ' tane tʉutɨsan nɨ marɨ apurɨto ' pʉta ' pʉ awɨrɨ ukʉipʉnʉ kon Epʉra ' an enau iye ' sa ' rʉ ' pʉ itun pi ' pɨ puturʉka rawɨrɨ .

text: For the promise , that he should be the heir of the world , was not to Abraham , or to his seed , through the law , but through the righteousness of faith .
text2: Main poro Epʉra ' an mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ imunkɨ amʉ ' uya iku ' to ' pe uya tukai ' usauro ' nɨsa ' eporo ' pʉ pen non anʉnto ' iya , e ' tane anʉn nɨto ' tʉuye ' sen apurɨto ' winɨ .

text: For if they which are of the law be heirs , faith is made void , and the promise made of none effect :
text2: Apʉne pʉra kamoro tʉuko ' mansan main awɨrɨ rɨken esi yau anʉnnin nan pe , apurɨto ' esi mɨrɨ itepe ' pe pʉra rɨ mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ iku ' to ' pe uya tukai ' usauro ' nɨsa ' esi mɨrɨ se pe rɨ ,

text: Because the law worketh wrath : for where no law is , there is no transgression .
text2: apʉne pʉra main uya kota ' man nɨto ' nepʉ . Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ main pʉra na ' ne ' airɨ main awɨrɨ pʉra e ' nɨto ' pʉra iyesi .

text: Therefore it is of faith , that it might be by grace ; to the end the promise might be sure to all the seed ; not to that only which is of the law , but to that also which is of the faith of Abraham ; who is the father of us all ,
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , iku ' to ' pe uya tukai ' usauro ' nɨsa ' uyepʉ apurɨto ' winɨ , iye ' ku ' to ' pe wakʉ nonkasa ' winɨ , mɨrɨpan e ' kupʉ mɨrɨ a ' tai tanporo Epʉra ' an munkɨ amʉ ' pɨ ' — kamoro rɨken main pɨ ' te ' san pen e ' tane kamoro Epʉra ' an uya apurɨto ' pɨ ' te ' san nɨ marɨ . Tanporo ukʉipʉnʉ kon pe iyesi .

text: ( As it is written , I have made thee a father of many nations , ) before him whom he believed , even God , who quickeneth the dead , and calleth those things which be not as though they were .
text2: Iye ' menukasa ' na ' ne ' kasa : “ Ɨkonekasa ' uya mɨrɨ tu ' kan kon tʉpataron kon kʉipʉnʉ pe , ” tawon . Epʉra ' an esi ukʉipʉnʉ kon pe Papa enu yau , inapurɨnʉ — Papa uko ' man nɨto ' tʉnin iyeri ' sa ' ena ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨ ' rɨ rɨ esa ' nin moro ipʉra rɨ iye ' tane moro iyesi kasa .

text: Who against hope believed in hope , that he might become the father of many nations ; according to that which was spoken , So shall thy seed be .
text2: E ' ku ' nɨto ' ipɨ ' pʉra kasa rɨ iye ' tane , te ' ku ' to ' yau rɨ Epʉra ' an uya apurɨ ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan ena ' pʉ tu ' kan kon tʉpataron kon kʉipʉnʉ pe , ta ' pʉ na ' ne ' tʉpɨ ' kasa rɨ , “ Mɨrɨ kasa kuru apayan nʉ ' san e ' to ' oton , ” tawon .

text: And being not weak in faith , he considered not his own body now dead , when he was about an hundred years old , neither yet the deadness of Sara ' s womb :
text2: Apurɨto ' tʉuya yau tɨ ' sɨ ' mʉnka ' nʉ ' se pʉra , i ' tu ' pʉ iya rɨ tʉpun eri ' sa ' pe rɨ — apʉne pʉra 100 e ' to ' airɨ rɨ tʉwʉipiyaai esi pɨ ' — mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Sera mʉre yen nɨ nɨrɨ esi ' pʉ iyeri ' sa ' pe .

text: He staggered not at the promise of God through unbelief ; but was strong in faith , giving glory to God ;
text2: E ' tane rɨ Papa uya ikupʉ tʉuya tukai ' tauro ' ka ' pʉ apurɨ ' pʉ iya , apurɨto ' iya umeruntɨta ' pʉ , mɨrɨpan uya Papa apurɨpɨtʉ ' pʉ ,

text: And being fully persuaded that , what he had promised , he was able also to perform .
text2: ipan pe ti ' tui ' Papa esi meruntɨ rɨ ikupʉ tʉuya tukai ' tʉusaurokʉ ' pʉ ku ' nin ye ' .

text: And therefore it was imputed to him for righteousness .
text2: Mɨrɨ wenai , “ Papa uya anʉmʉ ' pʉ ipokenan tukai ' , ” tasa ' iya .

text: Now it was not written for his sake alone , that it was imputed to him ;
text2: Main , “ iku ' to ' esi ' pʉ mɨrɨ , ” tawon e ' menuka ' pʉ kʉrɨ rɨ iwano ' pe rɨken pen ,

text: But for us also , to whom it shall be imputed , if we believe on him that raised up Jesus our Lord from the dead ;
text2: e ' tane urɨ ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ iwano ' pe , anʉnsa ' pe ipoken e ' nɨto ' e ' ku ' to ' oton na ' ne ' — urɨ ' nokon apurɨpɨ ' na ' ne ' nan uyepuru kon Sises i ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' iya pɨ ' eri ' nɨto ' apai .

text: Who was delivered for our offences , and was raised again for our justification .
text2: Itʉrʉ ' pʉ eri ' nɨto ' ya ' umakooi kon wenai , mɨrɨpan i ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ iko ' manto ' ya ' wakʉ pe ekonekan nɨto ' pe Papa enu yau .

text: Therefore being justified by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ :
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , apurɨto ' poro Papa uya uyanʉnsa ' kon ipokena ' pe pɨ ' , usewankaman nɨto ' pʉra iyesi Papa pokon pe e ' nɨ pɨ ' Sises Kʉrai , uyepuru kon poro ,

text: By whom also we have access by faith into this grace wherein we stand , and rejoice in hope of the glory of God .
text2: iporo epoto ' eposa ' apurɨto ' winɨ serɨ eke nonkasa ' iya ' iyau e ' mʉ ' sa ' kan nɨsa ' nokon na ' ne ' . Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ epori ' ma ' nokon ipokon pe Papa ku ' to ' eke pe yau e ' nɨ ' nokon pɨ ' e ' ku ' nɨto ' yau .

text: And not only so , but we glory in tribulations also : knowing that tribulation worketh patience ;
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa rɨken pen , e ' tane epori ' ma ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ ekota ' ma ' nokon yau , apʉne pʉra i ' tu ' nokon ekota ' man nɨto ' uya sa ' man awɨrɨ iku ' to ' enpa ' ka ;

text: And patience , experience ; and experience , hope :
text2: sa ' man awɨrɨ iku ' to ' uya , eseru wannɨ ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ eseru wannɨ uya e ' ku ' nɨto ' enpa ' ka .

text: And hope maketh not ashamed ; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us .
text2: Mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ e ' ku ' nɨto ' uya ika ' nɨ ' pʉra ku ' nɨ pen , apʉne pʉra Papa uya tʉusi ' nʉnkato ' nonkasa ' uyewan kon ya ' Wakʉ A ' kwarʉ winɨ , itʉsa ' iya na ' ne ' uyena ' nokon .

text: For when we were yet without strength , in due time Christ died for the ungodly .
text2: Menyatʉu , iweyu a ' tai kuru sa ' ne , imeruntɨrʉ pʉra rɨ marɨ e ' nɨ ' nokon a ' tai , Kʉrai erikʉ ' pʉ Papa uya tasa ' pen awɨron kon iwano ' pe .

text: For scarcely for a righteous man will one die : yet peradventure for a good man some would even dare to die .
text2: Iteseru pen nɨ ɨnʉ ' rɨ erikʉ pʉra iyesi ipokena ' pe te ' sen ka ' pon iwano ' pe , wakʉ ka ' pon iwano ' pe ɨnʉ ' rɨ e ' to ' e ' tane eri ' pai itiwano ' pe .

text: But God commendeth his love toward us , in that , while we were yet sinners , Christ died for us .
text2: E ' tane Papa uya ui ' nʉnkato ' kon tʉuya ya ' rɨ enpoika wakʉ pe serɨ yau : Tʉmakooikenan pe rɨ marɨ e ' nɨ ' nokon koro ' tau , Kʉrai erikʉ ' pʉ uiwano ' kon pe .

text: Much more then , being now justified by his blood , we shall be saved from wrath through him .
text2: Papa uya anʉn nɨsa ' ipokena ' pe pɨ ' imʉnʉ winɨ , mɨrɨ entai rɨ epika ' tɨn nɨto ' oton kon iporo Papa uya kota ' man nɨto ' apai !

text: For if , when we were enemies , we were reconciled to God by the death of his Son , much more , being reconciled , we shall be saved by his life .
text2: Apʉne pʉra , Papa eyaton pe e ' nɨsa ' nokon yau , itonpa pe enan nɨsa ' nokon Imu eri ' to ' poro , mɨrɨ entai nin si , itonpa pe enan nɨsa ' epika ' tɨto ' oton iko ' manto ' poro !

text: And not only so , but we also joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , by whom we have now received the atonement .
text2: Serɨ rɨken nɨ esi pen mɨrɨ kasa , e ' tane epori ' man nɨ marɨ Papa yau Sises Kʉrai , uyepuru kon poro , iporo Papa tonpa pe enan nɨsa ' eposa ' nokon na ' ne ' .

text: Wherefore , as by one man sin entered into the world , and death by sin ; and so death passed upon all men , for that all have sinned :
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , makoi ewomʉ ' pʉ non pona tikin nan ka ' pon poro na ' ne ' kasa kuru , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ uma ' tan nɨto ' makoi poro , mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ serɨ na ' ne ' kasa uma ' tan nɨto ' uyee ' pʉ tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' pona . Serɨ ta uya , apʉne pʉra tanporon kon umakoitasa ' pɨ ' .

text: ( For until the law sin was in the world : but sin is not imputed when there is no law .
text2: Main , Mosi ' winon e ' tʉrʉ rawɨrɨ , makoi esi ' pʉ non po . E ' tane makoi mɨrɨ tato ' pʉra iyesi main pʉra na ' ne ' airɨ .

text: Nevertheless death reigned from Adam to Moses , even over them that had not sinned after the similitude of Adam ' s transgression , who is the figure of him that was to come .
text2: Mɨrɨ nin si e ' tane , uma ' tan nɨto ' e ' sa ' esa ' wannɨ pe Atan si ' kɨrɨ Mosi ' pʉ ' kʉ pona , kamoro rɨ main ti ' kwɨ ' se , Atan kasa imakoitasa ' kon pen nɨ esa ' pe , tʉuye ' ton ento ' ipɨ ' pe te ' sen .

text: But not as the offence , so also is the free gift . For if through the offence of one many be dead , much more the grace of God , and the gift by grace , which is by one man , Jesus Christ , hath abounded unto many .
text2: E ' tane repan nɨto ' ike esi ɨri ku ' sa ' Atan uya na ' ne ' warai pen nɨ . Apʉne pʉra tu ' kan kon eri ' sa ' pe iyesi yau tikin nan ka ' pon uya ɨri ku ' sa ' pɨ ' , mɨrɨ entai Papa uya wakʉ nonkasa ' mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ repan nɨto ' tikin nan nɨ ka ' pon , Sises Kʉrai uya wakʉ nonkasa ' winɨ iye ' sa ' , tu ' kan kon nɨ ka ' pon amʉ ' uya eposa ' eke pe kuru rɨ !

text: And not as it was by one that sinned , so is the gift : for the judgment was by one to condemnation , but the free gift is of many offences unto justification .
text2: Repan nɨto ' ike , kanan , esi pen tikin nan ka ' pon , Atan umakoitasa ' moron nʉ ' pʉ kasa : Eseru aimenkato ' esi tikin nan makoi e ' ma ' pʉka pɨ ' , mɨrɨpan uya eno ' man nɨto ' nepʉ ; e ' tane repan nɨto ' uya tu ' kan nɨ ɨri ku ' pɨ ' sa ' e ' ma ' pʉka , mɨrɨpan uya anʉn nɨto ' ipokena ' pe nepʉ .

text: For if by one man ' s offence death reigned by one ; much more they which receive abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness shall reign in life by one , Jesus Christ . )
text2: Apʉne pʉra tikin nan ka ' pon uya ɨri ku ' sa ' winɨ , uma ' tan nɨto ' e ' sa ' esa ' wannɨ pe yau kʉrɨ rɨ tikin nan ka ' pon poro , mɨrɨ entai kuru kamoro eke pe rɨ wakʉ Papa nʉnonka ' pʉ eponin nan mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ anʉn nɨto ' Papa uya ipokena ' pe nʉtʉrʉnʉ esi esa ' wannɨ pe uko ' man nɨto ' yau tikin nan nɨ ka ' pon , Sises Kʉrai poro .

text: Therefore as by the offence of one judgment came upon all men to condemnation ; even so by the righteousness of one the free gift came upon all men unto justification of life .
text2: Mɨrɨ moron nʉ ' pʉ pe , tikin nan ka ' pon nʉkuu ' pʉ ɨri moron nʉ ' pʉ pe tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' eno ' mato ' esi ' pʉ kasa , mɨrɨ kasa rɨ marɨ tikin nan Papa maimu awɨrɨ e ' nɨto ' ku ' sa ' moron nʉ ' pʉ esi ' pʉ anʉn nɨ Papa uya ipokena ' pe uko ' man nɨto ' ne ' nin pe tanporon kon ka ' pon amʉ ' iwano ' pe .

text: For as by one man ' s disobedience many were made sinners , so by the obedience of one shall many be made righteous .
text2: Apʉne pʉra tikin nan nɨ ka ' pon e ' sa ' pɨ ' main awɨrɨ pʉra iporo tu ' kan kon nɨ ena ' pʉ tʉmakooikena ' nan pe , mɨrɨ kasa rɨ marɨ tikin nan nɨ ka ' pon esi pɨ ' main awɨron pe tu ' kan kon nɨ anʉmʉ Papa uya ipokena ' ton pe .

text: Moreover the law entered , that the offence might abound . But where sin abounded , grace did much more abound :
text2: Main e ' tonpa ' tɨ ' pʉ ɨri e ' kupʉ epanto ' pe . E ' tane makoi epansa ' yau , wakʉ nonkasa ' epansa ' miyarɨ rɨ ,

text: That as sin hath reigned unto death , even so might grace reign through righteousness unto eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: makoi esi ' pʉ na ' ne ' kasa esa ' wannɨ pe uma ' tan nɨto ' yau , mɨrɨ kasa rɨ marɨ wakʉ nonkasa ' e ' to ' pe esa ' wannɨ pe Papa uya anʉn nɨ ipokena ' pe poro tɨwɨro ' rɨ uko ' man nɨto ' ne ' nin pe Sises Kʉrai , uyepuru kon poro .

text: What shall we say then ? Shall we continue in sin , that grace may abound ?
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ ken si ta ' nokon serɨ , mɨrɨ a ' tai ? Umakoitan pɨ ' rɨ e ' nɨ ' nokon , wakʉ nonkasa ' epanto ' pe ?

text: God forbid . How shall we , that are dead to sin , live any longer therein ?
text2: Kane ku ! Uko ' man nɨto ' ɨri yau eri ' sa ' ; nai kasa iyau rɨ marɨ uko ' man nɨ pɨ ' e ' nɨ ?

text: Know ye not , that so many of us as were baptized into Jesus Christ were baptized into his death ?
text2: Mɨrɨ pe pʉra , i ' tu auya ' nokon pʉra katɨ iyesi urɨ ' nokon tanporo iyepa ' taisimasa ' kon Kʉrai Sises ya ' epa ' taisima ' pʉ ima ' tato ' ya ' ?

text: Therefore we are buried with him by baptism into death : that like as Christ was raised up from the dead by the glory of the Father , even so we also should walk in newness of life .
text2: Iye ' u ' na ' tɨsa ' pe rɨ e ' nɨ ' pʉ ' nokon ; mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , ipokon pe epa ' taisiman nɨto ' poro uma ' tan nɨto ' ya ' , Kʉrai e ' mʉ ' sa ' ka ' pʉ terikʉ ' pʉ apai kasa kuru eke pe Ikʉipʉnʉ ku ' to ' poro , urɨ ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ uko ' manto ' pe iyesi emenna ' uko ' man nɨto ' yau .

text: For if we have been planted together in the likeness of his death , we shall be also in the likeness of his resurrection :
text2: Ima ' tato ' yau ipokon pe uta ' si ' nɨsa ' yau , ipokon pe kuru rɨ marɨ uta ' si ' nɨ ' nokon mɨrɨ iye ' mʉ ' sa ' kato ' yau .

text: Knowing this , that our old man is crucified with him , that the body of sin might be destroyed , that henceforth we should not serve sin .
text2: Apʉne pʉra i ' tu ' nokon pena e ' nɨto ' eseru pokapɨtʉ ' pʉ kurusu ' pona ipokon pe makoi pun enato ' pe ɨ ' sɨ ' mʉra , makoi poitorʉ ton pe pʉra e ' nɨto ' kon pe —

text: For he that is dead is freed from sin .
text2: apʉne pʉra iyeri ' sa ' pe na ' ne ' emo ' kasa ' makoi apai .

text: Now if we be dead with Christ , we believe that we shall also live with him :
text2: Eri ' nɨsa ' pe iyesi yau Kʉrai pokon pe , apurɨ ' nokon ipokon pe rɨ marɨ uko ' man nɨ ' nokon tukai ' .

text: Knowing that Christ being raised from the dead dieth no more ; death hath no more dominion over him .
text2: Apʉne pʉra i ' tu ' nokon pɨ ' Kʉrai e ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' pɨ ' eri ' nɨsa ' apai , iyeri ' kapʉ pen kanan ; itentai uma ' tan nɨto ' esi pen .

text: For in that he died , he died unto sin once : but in that he liveth , he liveth unto God .
text2: Uma ' tan nɨto ' iyerikʉ ' pʉ na ' ne ' yau , iyerikʉ ' pʉ makoi ya ' tikin ite ' kwa tʉnakonomaton pe pʉra rɨ ; e ' tane si iko ' manto ' nʉko ' manʉ ' ai ' ne ' , iko ' mamʉ Papa iwano ' pe i ' se iye ' to ' awɨrɨ .

text: Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin , but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa si , ɨsi ' tutɨ ' ɨri yau ɨuko ' manto ' kon eri ' sa ' pe e ' tane nurɨne Papa iwano ' pe Kʉrai Sises yau .

text: Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body , that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof .
text2: Mɨrɨ pe iyesi pɨ ' , makoi kʉse ' nin tʉuma ' tasen ɨpun kon esa ' pe ɨri i ' se iye ' to ' awɨrɨ ɨwesi kon pa .

text: Neither yield ye your members as instruments of unrighteousness unto sin : but yield yourselves unto God , as those that are alive from the dead , and your members as instruments of righteousness unto God .
text2: Ɨpun kon pʉ ' kʉ rɨ kʉ ' tʉtʉu makoi ena ' , ɨri ku ' to ' ike pe , e ' tane e ' tʉtɨ ' ru ' ku Papa ena ' , kamoro uma ' tan nɨto ' apai uko ' man nɨto ' ya ' iyera ' tɨsa ' kon pe ; mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ ɨpun kon pʉ ' kʉ itʉtɨ ' itena ' ipoken e ' nɨto ' ku ' to ' ike pe .

text: For sin shall not have dominion over you : for ye are not under the law , but under grace .
text2: Apʉne pʉra makoi e ' to ' pe pʉra iyesi ɨyepuru kon pe , apʉne pʉra main o ' no ɨwesi kon pen , e ' tane wakʉ nonkasa ' o ' no .

text: What then ? shall we sin , because we are not under the law , but under grace ? God forbid .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai si , ɨ ' rɨ ken ? Umakoita ' nokon ken pe ' si apʉne pʉra main o ' no pʉra e ' nɨ pɨ ' e ' tane eke wakʉ nonkasa ' o ' no e ' nɨ pɨ ' ? Kane ku !

text: Know ye not , that to whom ye yield yourselves servants to obey , his servants ye are to whom ye obey ; whether of sin unto death , or of obedience unto righteousness ?
text2: I ' tu auya ' nokon pʉra pe ' iyesi ɨye ' tʉsa ' kon a ' tai ka ' pon ena ' imaimu awɨrɨ ɨwesi kon pa ipoitorʉ ton pe , imaimu awɨrɨ ɨwe ' to ' kon poitorʉ pe ɨwesi kon ? Makoi poitorʉ pe ɨwesi kon yau , uma ' tan nɨto ' ya ' anin , mɨrɨ pe pʉra main awɨrɨ e ' nɨto ' ya ' , ipoken uko ' man nɨto ' ya ' anin .

text: But God be thanked , that ye were the servants of sin , but ye have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you .
text2: E ' tane tenki tapai ' nokon Papa pɨ ' , makoi poitorʉ pe rɨ ɨwe ' pɨ ' sa ' kon e ' tane , tanporo ɨyewan kon pokon pe ɨyenupato ' kon awɨrɨ ɨwe ' sa ' kon ɨye ' tʉsa ' kon na ' ne ' ya ' .

text: Being then made free from sin , ye became the servants of righteousness .
text2: Makoi apai ɨyemo ' kasa ' kon ; ipoken e ' nɨto ' Papa enu yau poitorʉ pe ɨyenasa ' kon .

text: I speak after the manner of men because of the infirmity of your flesh : for as ye have yielded your members servants to uncleanness and to iniquity unto iniquity ; even so now yield your members servants to righteousness unto holiness .
text2: Ka ' pon pe e ' nɨto ' yau ekama uya apʉne pʉra ɨ ' sɨ ' mʉra a ' naino kon ɨyeseru kon yau ɨwesi kon pɨ ' . Ɨpun kon pʉ ' kʉ tʉpɨtʉ ' pʉ auya ' nokon kasa kuru ɨri poitorʉ pe , eke pe rɨ tepansen ɨri ena ' , mɨrɨ kasa si itʉtɨ ' ipoken Papa enu yau poitorʉ pe e ' nɨto ' ya ' , wakʉ pe ɨwesi kon pa .

text: For when ye were the servants of sin , ye were free from righteousness .
text2: Makoi poitorʉ pe ɨwesi kon a ' tai , ipoken te ' sen Papa enu yau ku ' to ' auya ' nokon pʉra rɨ iyesi ' pʉ .

text: What fruit had ye then in those things whereof ye are now ashamed ? for the end of those things is death .
text2: Ɨ ' rɨ ken si wakʉ mepota ' tʉi mɨrɨ a ' tai serɨ pe ipɨ ' si mɨpiyɨ ' atʉi ' ne ' apai ? Mɨrɨ ton moron nʉ ' pʉ esi uma ' tan nɨto ' !

text: But now being made free from sin , and become servants to God , ye have your fruit unto holiness , and the end everlasting life .
text2: E ' tane nin si , ɨyemo ' kasa ' kon pɨ ' makoi apai mɨrɨ awonsi ' kɨ Papa poitorʉ pe nin si ɨyenasa ' kon , wakʉ si ɨneporonʉ kon esi ayanin kon wakʉ pe e ' nɨto ' ya ' , mɨrɨpan moron nʉ ' pʉ esi inke rɨ uko ' man nɨto ' .

text: For the wages of sin is death ; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
text2: Apʉne pʉra makoi epe ' pʉ esi uma ' tan nɨto ' , e ' tane Papa e ' repato ' ike esi inke uko ' man nɨto ' Kʉrai Sises , uyepuru kon poro .

text: Know ye not , brethren , ( for I speak to them that know the law , ) how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth ?
text2: I ' tu auya ' nokon pʉra pe ' nai , utonpa ton — ka ' pon amʉ ' main , Mosi ' winon i ' tunin nan auro ' ka uya serɨ — meruntɨ pe ka ' pon pɨ ' main esi iko ' mamʉ pʉ ' kʉ pona rɨken ?

text: For the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband so long as he liveth ; but if the husband be dead , she is loosed from the law of her husband .
text2: Ento ' ipɨ ' pe , iyemari ' masa ' uri ' san utauronsa ' mɨrɨ tʉtaan ' pʉ pona nurɨne iyesi koro ' tau , e ' tane itaan ' pʉ eri ' sa ' yau , iyemo ' kasa ' nin si mɨrɨ emari ' man nɨto ' ku ' nin main apai .

text: So then if , while her husband liveth , she be married to another man , she shall be called an adulteress : but if her husband be dead , she is free from that law ; so that she is no adulteress , though she be married to another man .
text2: Mɨrɨ a ' tai nin si , tʉron nɨ warawo ' ya ' iyemari ' masa ' yau nurɨne rɨ tʉtaan ' pʉ esi koro ' tau , tekumasen temari ' masa ' e ' tane ta mɨrɨ ipɨ ' . E ' tane itaan ' pʉ eri ' sa ' pe iyesi yau , iyemo ' kasa ' mɨrɨ main apai , mɨrɨpan esi tekumasen temari ' masa ' e ' tane tato ' ipɨ ' pe pʉra , tʉron nɨ warawo ' mari ' ma tane iya rɨ .

text: Wherefore , my brethren , ye also are become dead to the law by the body of Christ ; that ye should be married to another , even to him who is raised from the dead , that we should bring forth fruit unto God .
text2: Mɨrɨ kasa si , utonpa ton , ɨmɨrɨ ' nokon nɨ nɨrɨ main yau ɨuko ' manto ' kon apai ɨyeri ' sa ' kon Kʉrai pun poro , tʉron nɨ iwano ' pe ɨwesi kon pa , kʉrɨ iye ' mʉ ' sa ' kasa ' rʉ ' pʉ terikʉ ' pʉ apai , Papa iwano ' pe epetan nɨto ' pe .

text: For when we were in the flesh , the motions of sins , which were by the law , did work in our members to bring forth fruit unto death .
text2: Apʉne pʉra u ' naino kon umakooi kon esi a ' tai uyesa ' kon pe , ɨri ɨnku ' pai e ' nɨto ' upakasa ' main winɨ esi ' pʉ e ' tʉrawasoman pɨ ' upun kon yau , mɨrɨ si epetan nɨ ' pʉ uma ' tan nɨto ' iwano ' pe .
